ReviewTitle: how much is the estimated budget
Review: hm is the estimated budget to go there? like the transpo from davao city and the entrance fee thanks

ReviewTitle: One of Davao City’s best places to relax and unwind!
Review: Eden is definitely one of the best places to relax and unwind in Davao City. There are beautiful flora-filled places you can go for a pictorial or just to enjoy the view of the Davao gulf. It also offers extreme activities like zipline, skycycle and...More
Beautiful scenery, great activities, and the climate is just outstanding! It's like you aren't in the Philippines once you step into this Nature Resort!
The place is relaxing. And a must see in Davao. The tour guide knows how to capture good pictures. I hope to be back.

Although the main intent of many visitors to this city is to have a photo op at the humble residence of the president of the republic , it is obvious the other must option is a visit to this nature park. Many things to do...More
Its such a wonderful place, i wish we could have spent more time there or at least spent the night there.

Eden Nature Park takes almost an hour ride from downtown Davao but the place enthralled and energized me. We availed their 45 mins guided shuttle tour which cost 120php per pax. You will have a moving tour and a quick 3 stops for photos of...More

ReviewTitle: Loved the gardens, awesome attractions too
Review: I had a great time at Eden! Towards the end of our visit it did start to rain but it was still fun!! Our group did a few of the attractions like the Sky Bikes and the massive swing. Both of those attractions helped me...More

We visited Eden Nature Park for a daytrip, and I wished we could have stayed more.. the scenery is so inviting i wanted to sleep in the swing! The air is so fresh and smell of sweet pine tree is all around. I heard the...More
Before we go back to Manila we decided to spend some time here. And We loved it... Had fun... My kids enjoyed the Sky Swing, Sky Cyle, Zipline They also loved the buffet lunch.

If you want a relaxed atmosphere surrounded by greenery and bursts of color, Eden is the place to be. Just sit around to enjoy the cool mountain air and the surrounding view, partake of a sumptuous lunch buffet and take the guided tour to its various gardens for a refreshing sight of colorful flowers including a quick lesson on Mindanao’s indigenous peoples.

I love the park really a family park a lot of nice things to do with or without children. The train journey through the park is also special, you can really admire all the beautiful places of the park. And do not forget the Spa, great after a day spent relaxing in the park and enjoy a super body massage. Different types of cottages to stay a few days, restaurants with buffet or simply order from the card. Really recommended.

ReviewTitle: Eden Nature Park is More Breathtaking than Baguio City
Review: Eden Nature Park is More Breathtaking than Baguio City! I realized that after my Baguio City visit last November 2017.  My most recent visit to Eden Nature Park was on July 2017 with my brothers and nieces. We enjoyed fishing under the drizzling noon and we had them fried and cooked as sinigang on a pot of clay! My favorite spot was the Rainbow Pass and just "bathing" under the forest cool sunshine and pristine air! Rejuvenating! Family and friends always enjoy the fun and excitement of the zipline plus the jumping high in the air groupie pic!  My first time and second time to visit Eden Nature Park was to attend USIP conferences in 2005 when I was still based in Jolo, Sulu. The accommodation including the food was very pleasant. Our bedroom was very comfortable. The place is very soothing and blissful.  I got to enjoy and drink all in the clean environment on my third visit because I personally chose Eden to be the place for our school field trip. It is the best spot to take your learners along with their parents to an educational trip and teach them about trees, protecting the environment, and about integrity of creation with The Creator Allah like we did for Al Munawwara Islamic School (AMIS) in 2011. Eden is Muslim-friendly, we were allowed to eat our baon halal food and to perform salah for dhuhr and asr. Alhamdulillah!
You guys should really try the SkyCycle. It's like riding a bike in the sky. Hahaha it was scary, but I got over it. 👌👌
Little baguio for the weather. Nature tripping for a new hobby. Taking extreme activities to choose. Can take you from a 1 hour tour to get a chance to see the park itself and what to offer.
You can enjoy your stay with your family for its very nature ambiance. Also you can learn more while touring around the park for it has many stops where the tourist guide tells more about the place
We had a quick tour and didn't really enjoy. they have a shuttle to tour you within the park with a guide. nothing special with their food. whole park looks and smells old.

This area is a special place in Davao with a nice view of the city from the highland. Huge area with some forested side left, others as orchard, as farm garden for fruits, ornamentals and vegetables. The restaurant option are buffet area for salad etc and seafood or catch and cook afterwards. It has accomodations for those who would like to stay. Got some livestock like deer on some areas too.

From kids, adults & young once will surely enjoyed. The place is nice & well maintained. The staff are very friendly & accommodating. You will never regret in including Eden as part of your Davao experience.

ReviewTitle: Nice place away from the city, fun rides, slippery when raining
Review: Visited today. It was about an hour away in the mountains. We had a chance to do the fishing pond where you catch fish (Hito and tilapia) and they can cook it for you or you can have them clean it and bring it home. My wife and 9yr old son had a blast catching fish while my 2 year old also enjoyed!   We did horseback riding and the sky swing which was fun, and a bit scary as well. If you have the time it’s worth it to check out this place!
the place is so relaxing, there's a lot of activities esp for yound adults. the fresh green salad is so delicious.

The food is ok, medyo matagal mag serve then nung nilabas na ung food sa gutom ng mga tao naguunahan talaga. medyo creepy ung place lalo pag gabi na. the room is old pati ung smell amoy luma nadin. we enjoyed the fishing though.

In eden you avail of a buffet lunch at their restaurant. The vegetable salad is so fresh because they pick it at their garden. And they sell pack of lettuce and dressings too. Their food is so good and drinks and ice cream is included...More
This place is very well made. It was a project by one visionary that spanned over twenty years. We had a good tour guide that had good knowledge of the place. The restaurant had a good buffet meal.

despite its distance and the rainy weather, we pushed going here because of the rides, the sky swing especially. upon entrance, you had to pay for the entrance fee which included snacks or buffet lunch. we opted for snacks since it was cheaper and we...More

ReviewTitle: Good Food, Fresh Air, Exciting Adventure
Review: Since they grow their own veggies, the food is not only delicious, it's fresh and eco-friendly. They also have superb amenities. No AC in the rooms, only a ceiling fan since the temperature is almost always cool so be sure to bring comfy clothes for...More

ReviewTitle: True to its name, a Davao must see
Review: Everything Eden stands for without Adam & Eve. A sure relief from the fast lanes, stress-full urban living. Refreshing gardens, romantic blooms, picture perfect foliage, therapeutic strolls, a true selfie paradise, a nature lovers treat

It was total amazing trip for all. They have a different amenities you can choose they also have extreme rides that you must try and a total package that suits to your budget with free meal. Though it's kinda away from the heart of Davao...More

It is a very well-maintained nature park/resort. Come here if you want to relax and get away from the busy city. The food is not that great, but you can definitely enjoy all the different activities the resort has to offer -- from the hiking...More

Great escape from he "blender-like" chaos, traffic, and scruffiness of Davao. Probably best to visit during a weekday, and show up at the rides (which are not within the main grounds) early. Also, try and opt for a day when it's unlikely to rain-- although...More

One of Davao City's major tourist destinations. If you are a non-Filipino the food is not good. It's more a place to ramble around in. Go down and watch them catch catfish (for a fee) out of a stocked pond, go swimming in the pool, take the shuttle bus tour of what was once an avocado plantation before becoming what it is now. If you are a nature buff, take your binoculars and your field guides--lots of birds.

Of all the parks in Davao City, this is the one best maintained. Although called a "park", Eden is more of a resort, complete with its own restaurant, lodgings, and activities. Situated on the mountain, Eden feels like a more modern adult summer camp.  in addition to walking the grounds and seeing the greenery, you can also add some thrilling activities to your itinerary. During our trip we tried the Skyswing,Skyrider and Skycycle. The Skyswing takes you far up top before the rope releases you and you "swing" to a stop. The Skyrider is named for the zipline, letting you ride across the grounds twice. The Skycycle gives you the chance to bike across a tightrope held at a great height above the ground. The three "sky" activities were all very much worth it. Horseback riding ended up just being the a horse being led around a small track twice--I would recommend skipping this one.

ReviewTitle: A good location to re encounter nature
Review: Took a tour with friends and family, and we had a grand time in this spot. We enjoyed the shuttle tour with our very friendly tour guide Jerald. Sky Cycling was exciting, and our younger kids had tons of fun during the horse ride. Eden is a charming place to relax and bond with friends and family. It has a wide play park too. Eden has a lot for you to see.

If you love the nature then this is the place for you. It will have everything you need from zoos and play ground for the kids and adventure rides for adults. But the highlight of the trip would be their buffet(which is included in the entrance fee)!! You can feel that everything is fresh and delicious even their coffee is very fresh and they have jalapeno flavored ice cream! The only downside is that the way their is a bit hard if you are commuting, and if you are driving make sure your car is up the job because ours overheated. Just saying
Indulge in the beauty of nature with a variety of flora and fauna... or you can choose to tick your bucket list for zipline adventure, zipbiking and more..

Great variation of activities from trekking to horse back riding, slingshot, cable bicycle riding and so many more. I only tried those mentioned. We were taken to an exclusive tour (thanks to our tourmates who didn’t arrive on time. lol). The flower and vegetable garden were beautiful. The zoo was home to different species. The lunch buffet was mostly traditional Filipino dishes but doesn’t much have to offer. The cultural show was wonderful.

A surprisingly ideal place to hold a teambuilding session. Everyone was very relaxed which helped establish an atmosphere of good camaraderie among employees.   The restaurant is NOT a disappointment. We all enjoyed out All-You-Can-Eat meals which choices range from the healthiest to the unhealthiest type of food. The green salads are to die for.  For the nature type selfie-enthusiasts, this is your place!

Eden Park is a huge property, but ideal for people of all ages since they are offering guided tours where you'll ride on their jeeps with one guide to explain things you see around. There are also stopovers that will let you do picture-taking. But just like usual guided tours, it is always timed, which means that you do not have control over the time you'd want to spend on a certain area. After the tour, you have all the time to do your own exploration of the place. The package we had included a hearty lunch buffet, which is sufficient. Our only suggestion is to come here early as people tend to flock starting around 10am, and you'll have to be at the buffet area the moment it opens (I believe at around 11 or 11:30. Fret not if you don't feel like eating that much as there are also stalls like Aling Foping's halo-halo that is also offering light snacks like bibingka. We only stayed until about 2pm because we opted not to try other activities anymore like the skycycle, etc. We also didn't want the influx of crowd that usually comes at a later time of the day. Being surrounded by nature and having a hearty, healthy lunch was enough for us. I'd like to reiterate that you'll need to be early (they open at 8am) or better stay in one of their accommodations to truly experience the place.

ReviewTitle: Be Adam and Eve in Eden
Review: After you have overcome the getting there, and arranging the getting back, you can certainly enjoy a peaceful day in gardens, on rides, eating, and walking about.  TIP: If you don't have a car. Arrange a taxi for the day. 2500 pesos. He will take you there, wait, then take you home. When you add up the fare there and the return fare, it's almost the same anyway and at least you have a guarantee of getting home. If you have been lucky enough to get a taxi to take you there (700php -1000php), the Park Reception will order one to take you home. But there is a time limit to be able to do that. We made two mistakes - arriving late (about 2pm) and thinking we could get a ride home or at least down to the main town area below on a tricycle. Wrong! We ended up on the back of motorbikes, racing down the mountain. It was fun and at 50php each, a lot cheaper. Just don't depend on this. Okay, that's the transport. Let's talk about the park. You pay to enter, around 200php and that includes a snack at the restaurant. The fee is reasonable, the snack, (I had spaghetti), was just fine. The gardens and the walks and the scenery are quite lovely and a nice cool atmosphere away from the humidity of the city down below. There are horse rides, tame but great for kids and nervous partners, the sky bikes, safe fun and a great view, and the sky swing, heart stopping release followed by the feeling of butterflies wanting to escape from your tummy before it stops. Eden Park caters for overnight stays as well with cottages, different charges for different levels, of course, and there are pools and playgrounds. Accommodation was not cheap but if there were, say, a group of you, 8 - 10 people, then a mountain villa for about 12,000php is a pretty cool idea! The place is huge and if the rides aren't your thing, then romantic or discovery walks should fit the bill nicely. It's a perfect place to bring kids and you can guarantee they will sleep all the way home. :) Also a perfect place for a couple, and guys, if you want to take your partner somewhere romantic to propose, this could be memorable. Shout out "Marry me!" as they let the sky swing go. Her scream might be a yes, or just sheer terror. Add a bit of romance to the trip home by leaving late and having to ride pillion together on the back of a motorcycle with her hanging on to you from behind as you descend the mountain. Eden Park is a great day out.
If you are a Nature Lover, you should visit this place. You will really love to stay here forever. Don't worry about the food, they have a place to dine in.

You can find yourself relax and stress out from this beautiful and and nature loving man made place. The place is cool and quite, like a little baguio in the making. There are tall pine trees and hotels are nearby but a little far from the heart of the city.

This resort is naturally beautiful. We can't get enough of the garden. Too little for us. The trees and the cool climate is best. We love the simplicity of the area. The attractions are simple and average. The activities that are offered are the best. The selection of food is average but the freshness of ingredients is superb. The last time we came here, there was a good variety of fruits at the buffet. This time, there were few. Few but super sweet.

ReviewTitle: Solo traveller at Eden Nature Park
Review: The nature park is very nice and for a solo traveler like me, I took on the day tour package. Entrance is 400 with snacks included. The area is wide and we rode a shuttle for the guided tour. The tour guide was very knowledgeable and welcoming to the guests. There are lots of views that are instagram-worthy so do not forget to bring a good camera and extra batteries or powerbank. The combo ride (skycycle and zipline) is also cheap and because its cheap, i tried both! Its a very unforgettable experience most specially riding a bicycle on a wire. Overall, i really enjoyed my tour.
Good to be here.... but when you take a round tour the guide is so fast..... Mindanao is here........ The Coffee are perfect.... even for European..... Stefan S

The only good thing about this place is the sky cycle which you have to pay separately. Others are overrated. Im quite surprised why some considers this as the standard bearer for Davao activities/places to go. Boring and overrated. Try sky cycle tho.

Very beautiful area, its about 45 mins south of Davao, when you arrive the cool mountain breeze greets you. Very well organized tours in a small open Van with guide to educate you on all the flora and fauna. There's a zip line, horses, small kids zip line (free) and lots of flowers and vegetables. there is also a restaurant that is good. There's cold beer and soft drinks available.

For those unafraid of heights, you can do the Skycycle or Skyswing. For those afraid of heights, there is the equally exciting Skyrider. They have a massive restaurant, but the price and food quality are so-so. Skyview & Eden rates are subject to change.
Love the place. My family were very happy upon visiting here. Love the people as well, they are very friendly and accommodating

From Aldevinco Shopping center, we rode a jeep going to Toril then take a habal-habal. The fare is quite expensive yet the view is very worth it. It is so refreshing and relaxing. You can also ride the 200 meter zipline (skyrider).
After hours of travelling from our place. Ive got a chance to see this wonderful place. The rides, the foods, the tress All of them are the best.. Its really worth it.
Eden Nature park, This place makes me relax. Nice place Nice view. Good place for week end get away.

I love this place. Had a great time. I would go back again with friends. Highly recommended. The buffet lunch served was really good. Lots of choices. There are many activities to chose from. Great for family's.
We enjoyed the cool pine scented resort. Although the drive was ling it was woryh it. The food was good but a bit pricey. Best for families to stay a night or two. Also, better if you book in advance

Eden Nature Park is one of the best places to stay in Davao. The park offers a lot of amenities suitable for friends and family. With its cooler climate, one can enjoy the breathtaking sceneries as they tour around Eden.

ReviewTitle: Going to Davao a must to visit this EDEN
Review: I was taken by my friend in this place and you will have a whole day of fun for hiking, activities and fun fun fun. Spend at least a whole day to get a feel what this place has to offer. If you want to...More

We loved the place. We stayed overnight. Never felt so close to nature before. We have seen beautiful flowers. We enjoyed the playground. We tried fishing. We also did the skyswing. The overall experience is definitely one of the best moments couples can treasure.

I went here on the last day of my trip...just right after the crocodile farm i went straight to eden.. From toril i hire a habal for 100 pesos up to the mountain the weather is good and upon going up to the mountain. I...More

Most clients of our travel agency would want to visit this place especially for nature lover and those who wants to try the highlands than the beach. The place have so many activities just bring few extra cash to try them all because the entrance...More

Got the three bedroom cabin for my sisters birthday....and the place was outstanding. They have a shower and toilets on all the rooms and the area was so quiet which was perfect for the family gathering. I loved the weather as it was cold and...More

ReviewTitle: It was a good buffet lunch
Review: On this trip, it worked to our advantage to place reservations prior to arriving. The guard had our name and waved us past the queue of vehicles that were registering at the entrance. Had lunch after paying for all inclusive entrance fee. Buffet was pretty...More

We did not regret allocating half a day of our Davao trip to Eden. We did a Samal island tour in the morning, which was a mistake since we were exhausted by the time we went to Eden (mostly because of the traffic and travel time took a lot from us).   We arrived mid-afternoon and missed the guided tour so we ended up using the map's primary and secondary routes. I would recommend adding more signs along the routes since we got lost. Tons of activities that cater to any type of visitors. I suggest capping your Eden adventure by going to Lola's Garden to enjoy the view.

An excellent place to relax and enjoy the nature and don't miss the sky cycling! The butterfly garden is also not to miss; ask the caretaker and you can have interactive/selfie with the butterflies. The lunch buffet is also good.

The facilities where great. Very reasonable. This place is a great place for young children, many activities for them and adults not myself "thrill seeker". Rides not scary enough for me. I would definitely recommend this place. One thing they could do a shuttle bus too and from Davao, it would bring in more customers.
The tour is nice. I love the skycycle. The food in their buffet is refreshing and there's a lot of choices.

Now that the weather is cold i cant help but remember my visit to this place. It' s like a home away from home. If yoy are tired of the city life then this is the best place to be. You would really feel that you are one with nature plus their green salads are to die for! You can also enjoy their activities at very affordable price. I love it here wish i stayed a night.

The packages for their outdoor activities are awesome. I envy what they have for Palawan. For 300Php you get a combo of SkyRide and SkyCycle (Zipline) both ways. Worth it for the money. And they have free snacks.

This is a private park that takes you about an hour to reach from Davao. You go up hill quite a bit, so expect the heat to be somewhat lower. This can be both a day time excursion or a place to stay. But I've only been here as a day tour from Davao. The main attraction is the nature park itself. But for those who like to spend a bit of time fishing in a pond or to experience a bit of rush. There area options available right there.  I've visited the park several times now and it's actually a really nice experience. The guided tour takes you through what is a man made park, that tries to give you a sense of both what was there before the area was settled by the Spanish and some of the local flowers and fauna. It's a good experience for all ages and offers some great photo opportunities.   Included in the price of entry is a buffet lunch which was really nice. There's plenty of variety and anyone should be able to eat their fill. Happy to have been here again and very easy to recommend as one of the top destinations in Davao.

Made the long trip was looking forward to come here read some reviews the few animal enclosures were hard to get close to the steps not very well mataiined then went to the walking trail got about 500 metres down the trail then came across the trail closed sign was disappointed had to walk back went to reception to ask why no sign at the start of the trail they just laughed had the buffet lunch which was tasty a lot of variety but expensive for what was there
It's like you have stepped out of the Philippines once you enter Eden. Pine trees, cool air, flower - beautiful scenery! A must-see place!

I have lived in Davao for 6 years and each time I have visitors, I would take them here.But since I'm residing in another country, and it's my mother in law's first visit to Davao, I decided to bring her to Eden. She was simply amazed how beautiful the place is. And I was surprised that they have improved their system from the entrance, to the day tour to their lunch buffet . And I should give credit to our tour guide ( sorry I forgot her name ) . She is very informative and makes you feel that she is happy doing her job. Oh, there is a cut off time in the morning day tour. When we arrived that morning, we were told that the last day tour in the morning is at 10:45, and the next one is at 1 pm. I was quite disappointed because that means we have to wait. Then before I start feeling so disappointed, we were told that there is a group of 5 and they could squeeze in another day tour before the lunch buffet. Yes! So we ended up having the day tour and enjoyed the lunch buffet after. Sum it all up, excellent day for us.

ReviewTitle: Look after your animals, they make your profit
Review: The bus trip around the place was very good and the guide excellent and very helpfull. The fishing adventure I found pointless as the it was not a sporting event. The fish are trapped in a small area and hungry, so when you put your loaded hook in front of them what do you think they are going to do. The worst part though is the horse riding. The poor creatures looked starved and barely capable of carrying a Philippine person, and as I weigh around twice that amount I cancelled my ride in the fear I would hurt one of the four `ponys` that had the task of none stop running around carrying whomever chose to ay. I found it sad that despite the obvious profit that these animals were generating for the place they were underfed and cared for. I would first suggest that a weight restriction be placed on this event. I was even more upset when I reported my thoughts to the main booking place and the girl said you foreign visitors are always complaining about this.

The rides, the views, the farms, all of it! Worth it! I've been here thrice, and on all occasions, the staff and facilities are always consistent. The weather is perfect in the morning and there's always something to do for everyone be it deer watching, fishing, plucking fresh basil or more aventurous activities such as their sky rides. The fact that it's a 30 minute cab ride away from Davao city makes it very convenient and accessible for all people!

We find the place so cool and calm. This place is good for those people who want to commune with nature. You will find sanctuary of birds and butterflies, field of beautiful flowers, rare specie of animals and birds. A playground for young and old alike activities like zipline. For those who loves trekking this nature park is another place to visit.

This is highly recommended for family/group tours. There are lots of activities to do in Eden Nature Park. Far from the city but its an nice escape for the day. Overlooking Davao City, Eden is indeed the best way to be closed to nature while enjoying various and exciting activities. Must do if you're in the Philippines.
I'm from Davao and I never really see why people go to Eden. There's an entrance fee that includes a snack which is not really good. Reminds me of cafeteria food back in elementary school.

ReviewTitle: The Name Says it all, it's all Nature!
Review: A good venues for seminars as they offer different native houses for accommodation. Their food is great and not to mention their extreme adventure rides like the 360 swing is just simply amazing. Eden is the ideal place if you wanna take sometime to rest and enjoy the nature away from all the noises in the city.

Everything was absolutely amazing, the sights, sounds, and activities! The only thing I didn't care for is that everything was so far apart and I didnt realize until I was half way to the next activity. Other than that there was so much to do and see! Definitely a must do in Davao!

Our host treated us a day trip to Eden. Around 30 minutes drive from city center.  Entrance/arrival is simple. They will explain which are included and at a very reasonable price. Good thing it's not a one time fee that includes everything which gives the guest to pay only what they want.  We had buffet lunch which we enjoyed so much. There are good varieties on food selection, included are salads (really good!), appetizers, main meat dishes, soups, desserts and drinks are also covered. The must-try is the chilli/jalapeno ice cream!  Our kids enjoyed the tour and the park amenities. We tried the Sky Cycle and my husband tried the Sky Swing.  A must experience place when in Davao.

We really had a great experience at Eden Nature Park with my friends. We really enjoyed exploring the different kind of attractions and tourist spots at the Park. We came there for a short summer vacation at Davao and we didn't missed the chance to visit of the highlights in Davao and that's it Eden Nature Park.

What a place with everything included. The whole Park with lots of fun food and other things that you can do right here and try some adventure life around in the park. quite far from the city but its an nice escape for the day. Must do if you're in the Philippines.

This is totally a haven. Food, Scenery, Fiona and Fauna... Everything you desire for a city escape have this park. You can enjoy a sumptuous, delicious, hungry-satisfaction-guaranty, cheap, and healthy food from a wide array of variety from meats to poultry to white meats, fresh vegetables and sweet desserts at their buffet restaurant. Some says it will be forever their biggest attraction. Well, it really attracts me a lot.. (laugh) you could have the entire tour for just about 30 mins - 1 hour with their tour service guided with a staff. Most definitely a haven and is highly recommended.. :)

this is highly recommended for family/group tours. but hey, even if ure alone, you must go and relax in here. forget the hustle bustle of the city and enjoy a refreshing location. there are so many activities to choose from but i love the tour around the acres of property. love the old trees and fora around it. meticulously planned! another thing i enjoyed is sky cycle and zipline. one can also stay in their cottages spread all over the place. enjoy the cool night breeze with love one and friends.

Place is good for a quick city get away, a 30-45 minutes ride from downtown Davao City. The place is situated on the foot of the majestic Mt. Apo. You can go hiking and fishing but if you are more adventurous--you can try the zip line and sky ride.  Food is amazing, veggies are grown organically. Garden salad with sesame dressing is a must have.

Lush green in just 30 mins away from the hustle of the urban Davao. This paradise makes you just wanna sit back and enjoy the view.  Free the mind with what to expect but let it unravel to your heart's desire. Just let it go and set it free.
Our tour guide is accommodating, even became our photographer. Brings you closer to nature. It's not everyday that you get to see fruit bearing trees like durian, marang and mangosteen.
Beautiful place to visit and have a great lunch. The flowers and wonderful and love the views of the area

We when there late afternoon the roadside going to the resort park is very unpleasant for my opinion, there are kids playing on the street and the entrance going inside the park is dirt road. The surrounding, is very unorganized. The snack menu only have 2 choices and its does not taste good.

ReviewTitle: Enjoyable even if you don't care about the sky rides
Review: Took us about an hour to reach Eden with moderate traffic from our hotel (Seda Abreeza). We made a a day tour booking via FB messenger. Their website is not in operation and they did not respond to my text or email. My daughter is a big fishing fanatic so we got the P400 fishing village package. (Amount is consumable.) We took the shuttle tour (P120 / person) to have a guided tour of the place. Tour was just ok with a lot of picture perfect opportunities. Tour lasted for about an hour with three stops: Flower garden / Ampitheater, Tinubdan (cultural dance, tribal houses, medicinal herb garden), and Lola’s garden.  My children were not interested with any of their rides but they did enjoy catching fish. We missed the sign that says you need to pay for all the fish caught (you can’t throw them back in) so we ended up with 4 kilos of Tilapia for lunch. >.< Charge for the Tilipia + cooking fee is almost at P400/kilo! Aside from the Tilapia catch, you can order other items on their menu (sinigang, salad, pancit noodles). Their grilled tuna belly was quite good. Food is not cheap and the I paid for the most expensive Tilapia meal in my entire life’s existence. (I can buy live tilapia in Manila for P120/kilo without the need to fish for it. hahaha).   After lunch, we visited the aviary and the butterfly garden. The aviary is just ok. Nothing we haven’t seen from our numerous visits to zoos and aviaries. We had fun in the butterfly garden because the attendant was very knowledgeable and accommodating. My boys love insects (ew....) so they enjoyed handling the butterflies, caterpillars, larvae and walking sticks (of all sizes and colors!). We appreciated the interaction and what we learned that day because of the attendant in the butterfly garden. He even challenged us to find the walking sticks in the garden. They are definitely not easy to find as they can “play dead” and fold up their legs to appear like a stick.  TIPS * Eden opens at 9am. Arrive early to beat the heat and the crowd.  * If you opt for the fishing village package, reserve a hut right after your shuttle tour. You can order ahead then head across the park for the rides.  * Bring sunblock and insect repellant
Spent a day in Eden Nature Park with family and we had a grand time.. we enjoyed the buffet lunch and the guided tour.. our guide was very knowledgeable and accommodating..

ReviewTitle: A place to renew your energy!
Review: Entrance fees is inclusive of either snacks of lunch. Sumptous food is serve for both! Experience the adrenaline rush with their exciting activities such as zip line and more. You can also take a dip in their nice swimming pool...

ReviewTitle: 2nd time to visit, first time with Family
Review: The place was the same as I remembered the first time we visited. There were a few additions. I wish they charged us less for the buffet price for the child who was 4 years old who did not eat at all. The food at...More

Great day out for the family make a day out it , lots activities from high wire bike riding to fishing , horse riding , plenty things to do , Everything just stops at lunch time , all the workers just go and have lunch...More

ReviewTitle: A full interaction with the nature
Review: Eden is the best getaway if you want to experience natures and forest. This place has amusement park, restaurant and hotel.

The food served during our tour was Filipino-themed. Fruits​, vegetables and other ingredients are locally grown. The foods are served on-time and is fresh. The ambience is good and we salute the student dancers from a local tribe.
Such a beautiful setting and a wonderful place t visit and enjoy the peacefulness of the place. Put this on your list.

Eden is like a paradise where you can take a glimpse of the wonders of nature. This place is good for nature lovers! You'll take a trip of the whole nature park rich in Davao's Flora. The tour guide is so nice and friendly. The...More
If Manila has tagaytay, davao has Eden. The weather is cool. The food is good and organically grown in the park. The tour of the park interesting and you can have photogenic shots of the place.

ReviewTitle: Most magnificent paradise I've been to
Review: It was a long trip going to Eden. But the nearer I get, the more I sense a lighter feeling. And when we got there, I could never imagine myself being in the same paradise in other places. I enjoyed the tour and knowing the...More

After a long cab ride it was worth the trip. The tour of the organic gardens is scenic and informative . The lunch is the real value as the food is the best I had in the Philippines. Lot's of it also.

Been here 5years ago,but it improves alot.I visited last March with my family and we really had an amazing day at Eden.Away from the busy city,relaxing and with adventure at the same time.Very friendly tour guide,food is the best for lunch buffet! Very fresh from there own garden and very tasty.It is really worth for what you pay.  Cycling is very creepy for me and my husband ,but my family really enjoys.Of course it is safe and secured but it was just too shaky for us.Highly recommended for family adventure!
For nature lover and good for family outing number 1 you must visit in Davao City... So relaxing and fresh....there's a lot plants & trees... We enjoyed their sky swing and sky cycle very exciting👍👍👍
We went there its heavy rain at that time so we didnt enjoy our tour but the place is nice.its good for the group because they have a lot adventure activities.
The place offers great adventure. You should try the Sky Cycle which really gave me a one-for-the-books experience. It was the highlight of my Davao trip in 2016.

Eden park is a must see place in Davao. Sky cycling and sky swing is fun and something different experience for the kids. There's also horse back riding, zip lining and we did a trip around the park seeing the local tribes sing and dance. They also have a buffet restaurant available for guests.
Plenty to see and do especially for thrill seekers. High in the hills give great views over the city and a refreshing coolness to the air

ReviewTitle: A Good Place for Nature Lovers
Review: I enjoyed my stay at Eden Nature's Park. They have different kinds activities for every nature lover. What I love most about Eden is their Lola's Garden. There, you will see the spectacular view of Davao City and the Davao Gulf.
Even nature park is one of the best resort here in Davao city it is relaxing and you can do a lot of activities, like fishing,sky cycle and many more.

I recommend to all people who was not able to go yet in Eden Nature Park . Eden Nature Park is a far in a downtown area in Davao City but its not a hassle because we had a jeep to go in these place . when you go Eden nature park you can ride a jeep then after a jeep motorcycle the price is 200 per 2 person . and this place was a friendly and nature place because of their facilities, and their rides .they have may rides in eden which can give us a memorable moment when you experience that activities.
I really enjoyed my trip here. We captured a lot of fish in their fishing village. 300 per person and it's already consumable. We also enjoyed the tour in the whole park. It's just 120 pesos

First off, we commuted going there. From the downtown area it wasnt difficult to get a jeep and get off the main road going to the venue. The motorcycle ride going up to Eden was a lot of fun. Just make sure to haggle the price (when we went it was 150 for 2 pax so price could be a little bit higher by now. Shouldnt be more than 200 for 2 pax one way).   Second, food at Eden was average. The day we went it was the typical Filipino fare. The package we got included lunch so I would say fairly priced.  Third, the room. It was bigger than most hotels or resorts here in Davao. The bathroom has a little nook where it has plants. There's cable tv but no AC. That being said, that was a concern at first but when nightfall came the temperature dropped a bit. There's a ceiling fan if you still need a slight breeze when you sleep.   The area overall for sightseeing is really nice. You have an option to either hike or ride their guided tours. We went hiking down this path where the guided tours dont take. For someone who's used to hiking untouched terrain, you might like it. The place has little falls ans beautiful streams. It's a nice quiet place to be one with nature.   There are other activities than you can do at the venue however they charge a fee. We didnt avail of that option since the hike alone was enough to exhaust us! BTW, be warned that if you visit the venue by taking public transport, better wear your most comfy outfit (sneakers, jeans, t shirt) and bring extra shirt should you get sweaty in the process when you hike.

Our friends wanted to show us some of the Davao area, so they took us to Eden Nature Park where we took a guided tour through the grounds of the park. There are extra activities for those who stay a little longer. Will have to go back and enjoy the zip-line!
You need to bring a lot of money when you'll go here. Because at the main entrance, you will be charged entrance fee with meal. Meal is mandatory. No choice. Plus another fee for the shuttle tour.

We visited eden park with group of friends and my husband. The place is great! One of the best place to visit if you go to Davao in the Philippines. We spent the whole day going around with our tour guide who was very accommodating and willing to take our pictures. I really love the close encounter with nature not to mention the wonderful view. Had a wonderful time, a very relaxing place to visit and clean beautiful natural surroundings. The hydroponic section was very interesting.

We were walk ins Eden Park. Arrived at 1pm and were discouraged to get the buffet. But when we got to the lunch area, you cannot not choose the buffet. We upgraded to the P500 buffet lunch which was worth it!   Their play ground for kids on that sprawling garden surrounded by pine trees was just beautiful! They have a mini Zipline that my 4 year old bravely road almost 20 times!  We did not go on the tour, you have to come early and book your schedule earlier than your buffet lunch. That way you can pick a good schedule. They had a 1pm and 3pm tour around the whole property.   I liked the place. We met people holding meetings and seminars there because they had accommodations too.  Will come back again!

ReviewTitle: Something different for a tropical place
Review: I come from Canada so not very impressed with the "mountains experience " that is promoted sometime. It is a nice fresh air.But man...those horses are too small and work too hard to carry those people.

It's my 4th time to visit Eden Nature Park, but its our first time to go there using public transportation that's why I decided to write a review since most visitors are backpackers. We are actually residing also in Toril (Centro) so it easier to find ways of going there. From Mercury Drug, for backpackers you may hire a motorcycle (habal2x) and pay P100/head. Or if you are a group you may hire a taxi and pay P500.00 (4-5 cap.) It will only take about 20 minutes to get there. Entrance Fee includes meal, either plated snacks of P220 (adult) or P190(child) or you may avail of buffet lunch of P550 and P350 respectively. In our case, we chose plated snacks since we want to stay at the Skyview Cafe while waiting for our sched for the recreational rides.  Upon our arrival at 10AM, we immediately started our tour of the place by having pictorials on various "eden landmarks" near the daytour center (instead of booking for a shuttle tour). Among them are the souvenir shop, aviary, fernery, fishing village, swimming pool and butterfly garden. Realizing that the nature park is about 40hectares ( and we have not much time to do the mountain trekking), we decided that we need to book for a shuttle tour service (P120/head) since we have a guest from Iligan who need to see the whole place. Since, our shuttle tour is scheduled by 3pm we proceeded to the Eden Sports field just across the nature park and see the recreational activities they are offering: Skyrider (P150), skycycle (P200), combo skyrider&cycle (P300), skyswing (P300 for solo & P400 for tandem). If you are however afraid of height you may enjoy horseback riding for P100.00, go fishing for P40/head or enjoy the cold swimming pool for P80/adult and P55/child. Among said activities, I opt for the newest and most challenging.. the SKYCYCLE! It was such a great experience as compared to skyrider where you will only sit down.. zipline-like. In skycycle you get to experience the heart-thumping feeling once you are already sitting on the bike, holding the brakes while waiting forbthe gate to be opened. Once it is opened you have to decide to backout or go for it and face your fear on a metal rope!  If you are CRAVING for adventure, greater heights, challege of a lifetime...skyswing is a must-try! While said activities are for the adults and fearless, kids may enjoy the "indiana jones" rides which is free and unlimited. By 3pm, shuttle tour starts with a tourguide, passing through the Deer park, hydrophonic gardens, mangosteen orchard, dragonfruit farm, flower garden, ampitheater, Tinubdan where a group of cultural dancers will welcome the group with dances, there are also native huts and man-made cave (fiberglass). The tour will then proceed to ornamental nursery, fruit tree collection, herb garden and last stop is Lola's Garden where that famous wishing well with lots of hibiscus flowers, carabao statue, amazing view of the davao gulf. The tour will take about 45minutes to 1hour. The whole experience is full of fun especially because of the new activities/rides that they've added. Although it would have been better if they will also make a picnic area for families and groups.

ReviewTitle: A PLACE TO VISIT WHEN YOU ARE IN DAVAO!
Review: if you are looking for a colder place to stay in davao then book for this eden hotel located i toril bayabas, wherein you will have fun staying with your family because there are lots of activities you can do in that place, there is also a swimming pool but then due to its colder climated and location so its much colder to swim. if you plan to visit this place then stay for an overnight enable for you to enjoy its surroundings. there is also a daytour wherein they offer a lunch buffet, the foods that they serve are fresh and delectable
day-tour was enough for me and my best friends buffet was grand be sure to enjoy all activities don't forget your sunblock and insect repellant best ride: unlimited Indiana Jones for free
Tho, the place is a way too far from our hotel (city), the activity experience was awesome. Nakakaenjoy ang zipline. :D
Will visit again. It's a bit far but it's worth it. The place never really gets old. It was amazing back then and it still is today

If you're up to nature trip this place is highly recommended. The weather is cool and great for relaxation. If you're up to adventure, you may do trekking, swimming, ziplining etc. They also have a playground, very good for kids and those young at heart....More

A good day out with a lot to see and do. We were a large group of about ten adults of all ages and two young children. One child fell over and had a minor injury. He received excellent first aid and care. An exciting...More

Nature at its best. If you wanted to do not so usual things like sky cycling, sky swing and sky rider (zip line), then this is your best bet. We haven't toured most of the other places there since we have time constraints. I would...More

Went there with the kids - 4 year and ten-month old. Treks were good for exercise and city-stress relief. Nature was preserved though a number of rooms/cabins/facilities/venues were left in shambles. Great hydroponic system going. Affordable food prices. Fishing was okay as family activity. Recommended...More

It's quite a long travel going here and public transport going there is limited to tricycles, motorcycles and taxis, which are all not that cheap. Not much to see. Malagos Garden Resort offered the same sights minus the Zipline and Skywalker, but Malagos was better...More

ReviewTitle: Nature Trip for a Family Reunion
Review: Good place to go for a Clan Reunion with a Nature setting. Big enough for a ball with the Clan and intimate enough for couples retreat.

we havent really explore this resort. the kids just rode the skycycle to their delight. the entrance fee covers your merienda/snacks , the price of which is reasonable. the resort is far from the city.

I was here with BF for my birthday celebration and I tell you, it's really worth the trip ;) We had a great time commuting, especially when we had the motorcycle ride uphill :P The place is just wonderful...

It was our first time in Eden Nature with my family and relatives. The place was clean and the aura was welcoming too. I can say that the place is expensive and at the same time worth it. One of my favorites was the air...More

Getting there: It's approximately 1 to 1.5 hours from the City. You can take a taxi but be prepared to pay 2x the fare. This is because the place is out of the way and taxis will most probably not have passengers on the way back. Estimated fare: P450 (x2, so it's P900 total). I suggest to call before you go there, just to make sure that the attractions are open or that the place isn't closed off for a big event. There's a section of the road that's winding so if you tend to get car sick, make the necessary preparations. I also suggest to go there in the morning, so that you can maximize your stay. They close at 5-ish but you can still walk around on your own.   Suggestion to the management: Please consider organizing shuttle tours that will pick guests up from their hotels (or one hotel, which can be a meeting place for all) in the city and bring them back.   What to wear / bring: Plenty of insect repellent. Wear comfortable shoes because you will be doing a lot of waking. For this same reason, bring plenty of water. Because it's high in the mountain, it might get a bit cold in the mornings and afternoons. So, bring a jacket or a shawl.  Going around Eden: It's a huge place and we were traveling with our 83 year old grandmother, so we opted for the guided tour. This entails a separate payment from the entrance fee. The tour itself was good. The guide was lively, and he had plenty of information and side stories to tell. It took about 45 minutes to go around the place. I felt that is wasn't enough time to truly enjoy the sights. It was a challenge for my grandma too, because she couldn't move very quickly. I suggest to the management to make it at least an hour. The tour comes with a free snack, which is good to take after the tour. (Not before, because the winding roads might not be friendly to a full belly).   There are other activities and attractions like the zipline and the aviary. You can also go hiking.   Overall, it's a fun place to spend a day. The fees are a bit expensive but worth it when you see that the place is that well-maintained.
If you need a rest from stinky city go there. Green, almost clean, almost silent. Interesting Plants. ll in good condition. So much to see if you look closer. Nature is great!

ReviewTitle: Rip Off! Tour is separate from the fee you pay at the entrance.
Review: First time in Davao. When I got to the entrance I asked what time the tour was and the cashier said that the 1p.m. had left already (although it was only 12:35) so the next was at 2pm. Then after paying the P220/person I mentioned to the cashier that we will do the zipline while waiting for the tour. She then said to go inside the park (park and activities such as zipline/horseback riding are in separate locations, you have to cross the street) to confirm the tour as it is first come first served. So I went inside the park and presented my ticket thinking they were going to list our names for the tour. The lady said I have to pay P120/person for the tour. I was very surprised and asked her what was the P220.00 I paid for, she said it was for the entrance fee and the snack! The cashier at the front made it seem like the tour was included in the P220. She should have informed me that I need to pay for the tour inside! But she said you need to "confirm"!!! She should have said you need to pay for the tour inside. Also, the Management thought of feeding the guests even if the guests doesn't want to eat! Give the guests the option to buy your food!!! What if your guests just had something to eat or doesn't want to eat especially if they are going to be ziplining or horse back riding. Also, why separate the cashier location for the tour, it should just be at the entrance too. Then I asked the lady at the Tour section if we could just go around on our own and she said yes but you cannot bring your car. I went back to the entrance and asked for our money back!
Needs to be hear at least after lunch. The place close at 6pm The rides closes at 5pm. They have free merienda. There's some hustle that's why it took us to late to arrived the place.

ReviewTitle: A must visit in Davao City
Review: This is a very good tour to do. Reserve a whole day for the family because there are so many things to see and do. The buffet lunch is also very very good. Make sure to do the skycycling and other fun activities.
This Park was well maintained and was a beautiful location to visit. The adjacent adventure park is a must see visit for anyone visiting this place for the first time

ReviewTitle: Nice places but needs finishing touches
Review: I went on a public holiday so it was very busy, the entrance took time to get in and all the tours was sold out. We decided to take the walk, but got quite lost and gave up.  You are not allowed to take in any food so we went for lunch there, where the buffet was sold out, so had the snacks which took 1h to line up.   Afterwards we went to the zipline which had a 200 strong line.  This park has everything for a nice day out, apart from a good management that can facilitate large crowds.

ReviewTitle: Lots of activities and good food but crowded
Review: We stayed overnight here and tried the big swing and walked the trail. Lots of activities for all but lots and lots of people also. Tours were all full so we couldn't try them.   Big swing took over an hour to wait due to sheer crowds (Dec 27)  The trail was beautiful - ask for the map.

Amazing place for adventure for friends and great for family bonding. You should try the sky rides and eco-tours...Friendly and accommodating tour guides. Please book your reservations ahead..Worth the trip..
If the city is too hot for you you can head out to the mountains and visit Eden Park. Too bad there is no good restaurant in the Park.

An absolute fun and bonding place for family. Your family will surely love the nature and the activities offered within the area. It was part of our tour so the time was limited it was also Sunday so the place was "packed". We were so excited to try the cycle and zip line but will have to wait till 1pm. Better to book the rides first to avoid disappointment.My daughter and wife just tried the horseback riding and the mini zip line. The aviary was nicely set up, the butterfly dome was also entertaining plus the fact that the guide was knowledgeable. The package we had taken at the entrance was 300 pesos consumable at the Fishing village which was very ideal since you can fish what you want to eat and ask the kitchen to cook it for you . There is also an good array of local cuisine in the menu. No desserts though.Overall it is very good experience.
a day is not enough for me to enjoy the whole facilities. perfect for family and friends and even couples :)

ReviewTitle: As the names states, this is Eden
Review: Been coming to Davao for about 10 years and Eden is one of my favorite destination spots. There is zip-lining (highly recommended), food, pools and great hiking. Looking for some beautiful pictures? There are TONS of opportunities here.
Great for a unwinding and relaxing time, far from the hustles and bustles of the city. Their lunch buffet is good too. It's worth the visit. :)

There are lots of activities to do in Eden Nature Park. There's like a hanging swing where you have to seat and hold tight because you might fall if you don't hold at the bar tight. We also try the Sky Cycling.It was an awesome extreme experience!!! After the sky cycling is a mandatory Zipline so you can go back to ground.   There's also a mini bird zoo and it's not too hot to walk around the place because there are lots of trees that will cover you from the heat of the sun.  This is a must visit place near Downtown of Davao City!! I want to go back!!

My bf and I availed the lunch entrance. It was 550 per head. Its a bit expensive but when we arrive to the dining place， out entrace was worth it. Good food, especially the veggies and fruits. If we xould just stay there and eat all day lol.   3pm is our scheduled shuttle tour， which is 120 per head. The place is actually big and slopy. You cant explore everything by just walking. You really need to have the shuttle tour. The thing that I just dont like is that we only have 3 stops and every stop we only have 5 minutes to do photographs. How are we going to enjoy the site within 5 minutes? I hope the management will give more time to the visitors. The last stop is the adventure area where the zipline， skycycle and etc are located. It`s up to you if you want to stay or go back to the information office， which is the starting point.  I was very excited about the swing but my bf is too afraid so we only avail the skycycle. Skycle is 200 per head. We were ready and waiting for our turn then suddenly the rain fall heavily. That was the most unsatisfied feeling I ever felt in my whole existence! That was supposed to be our first skycycle experience! The rain ruined it all.  You should really check the weather before planning to do outdoor activities.

This is by far the best place we visited in Davao. All the sky rides are so affordable and you will even get discount if you are their guest at their resort. We came here so late but they still able to accommodate us even though its alreay cut off for the sky swing. Superb staff and rides crew. The room is clean and very relaxing. We enjoyed the scenery and of course the food. Worth every peso! Keep it up guys! Daghang salamat Davao!
Eden park offers guided tour which is around 45 minutes. We also fished for our own lunch and had it grilled on the spot. The sky adventure park is also a must try!

I went here upon the recommendation of a friend who lives in the city. I find the park nice place to unwind and have some activities like camping and bonfire, but I am expecting some improvements to make it a tourist destination by international standard. Set up a viewing deck to have a glimpse of Davao City and environs, more choices of foods, a showcase of tribal culture and practices, lessons in jungle survival, add more fun activities for the kids and the young at heart a bird show or an encounter with an exotic animals, a butterfly garden, to name a few.

ReviewTitle: So so place, can be improved
Review: Been here and it has a good variety of activities but everything has a price that are even more expensive compared to a day pass at a world class theme park around Asia. Is it worth it? I don't think so.   Starting from the entrance fee which includes either meal or snacks to the rides that cost Ps 120 per person for 30 minute round about in the forest with stop over taking pictures of flowers gardens is overrated.   There are rides you can try if those are your kind of fun but still, I find them overrated. If you have taken rides in other world class theme parks, this is probably not even half the standard of fun but they charge you like they feel they are world class (which is not).   I would not recommend it at its current state.

ReviewTitle: beat the stress in your own special way....
Review: A nice place to beat the stress and the nature will keep you calm and appreciate its amazing beauty.

ReviewTitle: If we only had a lot of time hahaha, LOVE IT!
Review: Went here in the afternoon of November 2015 I wish we were here in the morning so we had a lot of time. We took the guided tour and enjoyed it. The tour guide is very energetic and lively. I love her! She even helps...More

Beautiful settings as you can see the city of Davao, good food served here, you can have over night stays at reasonable prices, catch your own to eat, this place shows you the different tribes of the Philippines.

I loved the food but they could improve the tour. Our tour guide that time was not feeling well and she had a hard time talking because of our non-native companions who were talking loudly. I wish there were more flowers just like the last...More
Go for the guided tour with shuttle service, for Php120, its well worth it as you will be able to see the entire place and appreciate God's gifts of trees, folliage, flowers and much more...

On our last day in Davao, we opted to visit Eden Nature Park to try out their Sky Cycle and Zipline. It was worth 300 pesos for the Combo (Sky Cycle and Zipline). They also have the Sky Swing that we did not try as...More

very cozy nature park, cold during the night time and early morning and since this a nature park so there were insects all around esp. mosquitoes and ants. the restaurant serves organic food- if I am not mistaken, they serve vegetables and fruits grown in...More

ReviewTitle: Nice path but incredible adrenaline experience
Review: The tour of the park was good. Rainforest, buttery farm, swimming pool and bird centre were some of the attractions on offer. We on the other hand found the zip line, sky bike and mega swing a lot more exciting, well worth the trip.

ReviewTitle: Nearer to Mother Nature, nearer to Earth, closer to God - at Eden's !
Review: Hectares of land and uphill climbs , superbly awesome landscape,the cool breeze from the plants and treats defeated the heat of the sun. Worth visiting with family, friends, or as a couple. Be prepared with your walking sneakers.

If you book a tour here, they will only let you if you book a snack or buffet lunch with the tour. Which makes your tour a little bit expensive. Buffet lunch is at P550.00 per person and the tour costs P120.00 per person. The...More

Eden Nature Park is just how I expected it to be - breathtaking. The beauty of the place is unbelievably admirable since it is man-made! Oh, the sell fruits like mangosteen, durian and lansones in cheaper prices (if P25 is cheap for you?) The buffet they offered gave me a few reasons to ponder. I loved the Shrimp Pasta with Basil & Grilled Fish with Pesto Sauce! Though I wish they will let tourists stay in one place for atleast 10 minutes instead of 5 minutes. ☺

Enjoyed the tour of the whole park with a lovely weather. Great for family bonding with various amenities and cottages for overnight stay. The buffet lunch is very sumptuous with fresh fruits and veggies grown from their orchard.

This spacious park is a joy to visit even if development is ongoing and a bit far from downtown Davao. First, the restaurant serves organic food. Second, the tour guides are well-versed on their spiels and they have improvised megaphones for everyone on board to hear. Third, the varied ethnic culture of Davao and some parts of Mindanao are depicted in the designs of different cottages available for accommodation. Worth the relatively long trip and a longer relaxing, enjoyable stay.

This is a good place for family or friends looking for something to do in Davao. The place is huge that almost a day or half day can be spent here. Different views and attractions. We ride the sky cycling. (Bicycle in the sky). It is a good experience! Rates are reasonable too!

ReviewTitle: Day well spent at Eden Nature Park
Review: Great salad meals, great tour around the farm, and very affordable price! My wife enjoyed the zipline! This park, however, is way, way out. So make sure to book a reliable transportation (I suggest that you ask your hotel).
About 60-90 minutes from Davao but worth the effort. 220 pesos entry which includes a snack meal. Bus trip is a good starting point and a variety of activities after that

No wonder Eden Nature Park is one of the most recommended places to visit in Davao. There are so much to see like their butterfly house and bird display, the flower area, the different plants and trees like marang and durian trees, the dragon fruit plant etc. The one i liked best is the place where their ancestors are featured, they even have a short presentation. Their receptionists are very attentive and considerate. They did not hesitate when we asked for a refund when we decided not to get their buffet lunch package and changed our choice to their plated snack. Highly recommended is the sky adventure located opposite the parj entrance. We had a great time with their exciting and breathtaking skybike, skyswing and the zipline. Not to mention the beautiful view of the ocean, mountain and lush greenery surrounding us.

The rooms are great and I like that it gets naturally chilly at night. We did not rent a room with aircon, but the room was very cold at night since Eden is situated at the highlands. Their buffet is also very delicious. My family didn't get to do other activities except touring and fishing because we are all overweight (lol), but there are many other (more extreme) outdoor activities available.
Stayed there for One Night without any sounds and Pollution. Sky cycling , Sky swing activities and many more activities are there. Complimentary buffet breakfast is amazing and ambience.

Original venue was the vista restaurant then when we arrived, there was a wedding set up and we were told that it was moved to skyview cafe. My husband and i had severe headaches that time thus patience is limited...ano ba yan! We were not told when we did the booking 2 hours ago. The skyview cafe -- the venue was ok, though a little crowded as it is a closed venue unlike in the vista. The kids had a lot of games, best in costume and decorate your cupcake contests, and of course the trick or treating---- they went to 3 sites and were given candies/loot bag. They were also given the certificate of participation. The snacks was ok---though not healthy (standard: spag, hotdog and brownies). Over-all, the kids really enjoyed the event and that's what more important to us. Improvement points for next year: (i) pls fix the venue ahead of time (ii) adults are paying php220 each for the snacks, we dont eat bread/spag so i hope you have an option if we can just take your vegetable pack and 1 bottle salad dressing---or any option similar to that. Thanks.
The staff are very helpful and friendly. Very scenic views too. It was a charming place and a nice easy thing to do.
Just went you've seen it all, there is more to learn about the Nature Park. They have a ton activities and the food is pretty good. If you are sick of traffic and the noise, get away to Eden.

I enjoyed this place a lot because of the adventures I had. It's a good place to experience the nature of the Philippines and also some adventures activities as in Zip line cycling and etc.. The nature is beautiful and relaxing. At the top you'll...More

You have to pay the packed snacks or buffet before you enter the park which is not a good idea. My mom is on diet so we chose rhe packed snacks but it was frustrating. So we ended up to eat our lunch at Fishing...More

ReviewTitle: Great place to visit when in Davao
Review: This is a great place to visit with a lot of activities like the sky cycle. We also had lunch at the restaurant that served a lunch buffet which Hay Day limited selection but the quality was very good. Would have spent more time on the property had we had more time.

ReviewTitle: A day out at Eden Nature Park
Review: If you ride a car from the heart of the city, you'll reach the place in an hour. But if you ride a jeepney to Toril, drop off at Mercury Toril and ride a motorcycle to Eden Park, it will probably take you one and a half to two hours (without traffic). This is a mountain resort. Since it usually rains here in the afternoons, schedule an early morning visit.Avoid visiting during holidays, as locals and tourists flock the place.  I recommend the one hour shuttle tour, it will take you around their gardens, vegetable farms and the scenic spots in this resort. I'm impressed by how the owners utilized the vast area, turning it into a mountain resort with its cute cottages, fish pond, organic farms that provide fresh vegetables for their buffet (their vegetables are also sold in SM supermarkets), fruit plantations and cultural village with natives in their traditional garb and exhibiting tribal dances. It's also amazing how despite all these, the owners were able to maintain the natural diversity and landscape of the place. For meals, they serve plated snacks and lunch buffet. I've tried the buffet, it has a variety of good food. I was delighted with the freshly picked vegetables, salad dressings, fresh fruits, pasta and meat dishes. I didn't sample their lechon belly, as they didn't serve it during my visits, but from what I've heard, it's heavenly. I cannot enumerate every recipe I 've tried, but when it comes to presentation, freshness, taste, and variety, I'd rate it 4.9 out of 5.  This place also boasts of a zipline and skycycle but I haven't tried these. I roamed the grounds on my own and enjoyed a view of the sea and the cool mountain air. The only disappointments I encountered are the seemingly old and not so well-maintainedfish pond. You can catch your own fish here and have it cooked according to your preference. I was about to do so until I noticed how murky and foul smelling the water in the fishpond is.  To wit, a visit here is worth the long trip. It's a great place with great food.

4thumbs up! 👍🏼👍🏼👍🏼👍🏼 this is a must visit place in Davao! Foods( buffet,organic) service, the tour via shuttle, the terrain, tour guides, excellente! Uphill scenery plus their garden is surely an instagram friendly view! Dont forget to taste their salads and organic sauce!:)

ReviewTitle: A one of a kind experience
Review: You should go here when youre in davao since its the only place that offers skycycling. You are required to pay the entrance fee with food inclusion, P540 for lunch and P220 for plated snacks. Its far from the city but still is accessible even if you dont have a private car.

Beautiful place to unwind & relax..It is way cooler than in the city.It is a secluded place in the middle of a sprawling forest park..I would love to come back again in the near future..

ReviewTitle: A veritable staple to every Davao traveller
Review: A great place to unwind, any trip to this sprawling forest park is a must do if you visit Davao. Make sure to come during off seasons however, as the crowds can get stifling.  Pros:  - Accessible and filled to the brim with great amenities for travellers who wish to enjoy nature without going full caveman - Prices are just right to spend a whole day or an overnight stay. - Fun games for all the family  Cons:  - An influx of visitors during the peak season leaves the places crowded and amenities packed, better plan ahead or go during the off season.

ReviewTitle: Beautiful place , shabby rooms and restaurant
Review: Stayed last June 2015 with family and friends as part of our "quality time" . My sister and I , along with our families now live abroad and my mom was just diagnosed with terminal illness.Lovely place but not suitable for the elderly with balance/mobility problems. Shuttle to and from rooms is a big plus.  Rooms are big but needs redecorating . The screen of our window is ripped . Lucky we didn't have mosquito bites.  Restaurant service/ food is terrible. We tried to order lunch at the restaurant but were told to go to the ?cafe as they serve lunch there for the guests on day tour. I explained that we are not on a day tour but were pointed to the direction of the cafe anyway. Paid a lot of money for below par small serving of microwaved spaghetti and sandwich as there is nothing else available (The staff serving us rang the kitchen) . 8 year old was still hungry and my mom hardly touched her food. Breakfast was equally disappointing . Not much on the buffet and when we asked why the table next door has corned beef they put some on our table too(???) So if we didn't ask for it, we won't have it? Fishing was fun especially for my 8 year old. We had our catch cooked and it was better than the restaurant.  The Pool was nice but apparently uses solar heating and it was over cast so water was cold when we first went in.There was a seminar/convention of some sort whilst we were swimming and was not a welcome "noise" .Surely , if we can hear it then the people attending can hear it loud and clear.   Paid to go on a tour of the resort which was ok but was on quite a tight schedule (can probably be longer) to hop off the shuttle, look around and take pictures.   Paid promo rates for the rooms . Won't stay again unless paying promo rates and will bring sandwiches for lunch and a lot of snacks and drinks .Maybe I can sneak in a microwave and bring food (joke!).

this place should be on the list of every family on vacation in davao city. it is a good way to relax and enjoy the beauty of nature. it has many activities that will keep everyone happily busy! fishing, hiking, camping, swimming, zipline, horseback riding and many more!

Absolutely fantastic from start to finish.  Park excellent and very professional.  Tour was great as was the lunch and refreshments.  But the best part of it all was tour guides and all the staff who make you feel so welcome.  Thoroughly recommend this to ANYONE visiting Davao !!! Thanks for the experience :-)
This place is all-in-one! Great adventures especially the "sky swing". Great food! Great view! Good for relaxation.

Good place to unwind from the stressful city traffic and air pollution. Tried their skycyling, and it was so fun. Proud of myself for conquering my fear. Don't stop cycling until you get to the other end, unless you want to be stuck in the middle.

Had a good day here its up in the mountains so a lill bit cooler the attraction part was almost all we did (long wait) but was worth it nice ziplines big katapult (minimum 12 years) all fun. The youngest had a good time on the horses. We had the entry ticket with snack/lunch and well that was bad microwaved pasta or bread. Maybe the lunch would have been better but we didnt try that. So overall this is a nice trip to do when you are in davao.
Go for zipline and skycycle rides. It's the site's newest attractions. Try the combo to save. Enjoy also a quick horse ride before eating the free snack frebbie with the entrance ticket.

ReviewTitle: Great place for adventurers and nature lovers
Review: You can visit this place anytime of the year: have a retreat on holyweek, you can have you're valentine date with your special someone and own a cabin for a night or two, christmas with family in a cabin in the woods (but its not creepy! Promise! Haha!).  A must try is the sky-cycle. Conquer your fear of heights, pedal in the sky! Its exhilirating. Of course I was nervous at first and wasnt able to look at the view below on my first ride. But you're experience woudnt be complete if you dont take a look at the trees below, the tiny people, and you're co-riders. Haha! If you're a group of eight, you can commission the people in charge to have you take the ride at the same time. Yes, there are eight sky cycle you and your friends can ride at the same time. Perfect for a groufie up above while on a bike. :)  You can also try the indiana jones. Its a cute experience. Brings out the child in you. There are other activities you can try too. I recomment you stay overnight to have a wonderful experience.
It's a nice place to visit with family, friends and love once. And if you want to feel the fresh air this is the perfect place. Thanks.

From the tour around the area - wonderful tour guide who's being very helpful during photo-ops, to their extreme activities: giant swing, skyrider but skycycle stood out, to their sumptuous buffet! who wouldn't want to experience Eden Nature Park?!   Will surely be back to munch those green and purple lettuce - the best and freshest lettuce in town!  And oh, Mangosteen are sold cheaper in here than what stalls outside used to offer. ;)
the place has an easy access, there will be a guide map you will spend whole day wandering the place, friendly animals and very serene place.

Nice outing for the family because they have varied activities. Have a lunch of their own produce.Visit the gardens and animal exhibits and take a dip in the open air pools.

There is fishing, skyline, horseback riding and many other things to do at a price. I really do not see how everyday persons can afford to go here.

Superb! enjoyed our stay in there together with my boyfriend! I highly recommend this place who will visit Davao. This is a must visit!

The resort has all the amenities that you are looking for. It is good for nature lovers, good organic foods served. Swimming pool, playground, horse back riding amongst other things...Walk, jog, exercise, food trip , play ...ah so good place to be

ReviewTitle: Nice place but a bit expensive
Review: If you love nature, this is a good place to visit. Here you can relax and feast your eyes on the beautiful gardens around. You will surely enjoy taking pictures with the nature as a backdrop. They offer 30 to 45-minute guided tour with a...More

I've been there last Easter Sunday and the place was full of people and kids doing Easter Egg Hunt. I had no idea that we can't bring food inside the resort (well, I lacked on research this time), so I and my partner ended up...More

ReviewTitle: a short but very educational trip
Review: we have seen a lot of animal,flowers and its good to feel that you are close to natures.we are so happy we get to visit the place

ReviewTitle: Perfect get away for the whole family
Review: If you're a nature lover, then you'll surely love Eden. You could take a tour so you could see the entire place though its only time limited to take photos, they got beautiful landscapes and gardens.Eden got a lot to offer if you want a...More
We were 20 something family, stayed in Shangri La and mountain villa, both great, Shangri La is really special. Great resort, great gardens, great activities, great staff.

This place is awesome! You should try trekking without a guide, you just need to have a map. Also, tour around the property and love the sound of nature. If you're a nature lover you should really visit this place. You should also try the...More
If you are up for the challenge you can take a walking tour or you can ride in a tour van. The van makes several stops at interesting places in the park. Value priced entry fee and tour.

ReviewTitle: You must visit Eden, great place!!
Review: Take the tour its very informative and fun. I chickened out on the sky ride but my friends loved it. This is a must do!!

The views and the sites were great. From the trails to do a little hiking to the little tour that they have to see the whole property. Was great time I suggest a trip to see when you're in the the area.

ReviewTitle: A lot has changed since I visited last
