Review: We only had a day tour and we went to 3 different stops: 1. the rainbow where we had our picture taken and with jumpshot to boot, 2. the large datu house made of nipa and wood and we took several pictures and last is...More

Great place to be with family to relax and enjoy the amazing beauty of nature that surrounds you. You also get to enjoy great food with their buffet breakfast and lunch. And if you haven't tried fishing then you can give it a try here...More
This park offers both tours of their various plantations and a buffet lunch. There was also a butterfly garden a limited aviary.

We have been visiting almost every year and we bring family and friends. Our last visit however ended too soon. They were rude staff of the tours and we weren't treated nicely. :( The FOOD is yummy!!! Great customer service in the resto and other...More

Location: General Santos City, General Santos, Philippines
Review: If you want to experience relax and unplugged yourself from urban worries but at the same time having a fun filled getaway with your family this is the place. You can enjoy the scenic view and the kids can have a wonderful experience on different...More

Lots of pine trees and cool weather with nice looking cabins, this is my kind of highland retreat. I love the tranquility here. They have recreation like zipline , pool, skybicycle etc. It is so refreshing here. Plus it offer great ovelooking view of Davao...More

perfect for lover nature, the food is perfect.healthy and fresh . over viewing metro downtown.the place is cold specially at night so you dont have to use aircon .the air is fresh , perfect rides but you need to book early or take the ride...More

Eden Nature Park is on top of a hill (or a mountain?) and the view especially at Lola's Garden is really breathtaking.....i love the herbal garden when you can smell the scent of the herbs and the flowers are really beautiful. I forgot the place...More

if you are a nature lover, this is the place for you. well maintained and interesting.flora and fauna well represented.tour guides very eager to answer question. i have pollen allergy though, so i made sure i had my nasal spray and allergy tablet.
At night, fireflies every where. There are a lot of activities to do by day. Swim in the pool. Fish. Bike. Walk around. Breathe in fresh air.

My numerous visits to Eden Nature Park always ends with happy visitors. This time, my family from the US came to visit us in Davao City and with an elderly aunt, a male cousin and his daughter - it was a perfect way to spend...More

It took us a while to reach this place and when we arrived they are already close ( didnt do my research, our driver also didnt know). It was huge and lots of activities can be done especially for families.

I went there for many times and I appreciate for improving the sports field and adding attractions. This place is good for athletic people that loves thrilling experience such as the sky cycle, sky rider, and sky swing. You can avail the shuttle tour and...More

My mom was diagnosed with a terminal illness last June and we wanted to spend some time together, as my sister and I both work and live abroad. Rooms-Good enough for the price we paid(promo rates) Food- buffet breakfast was not great and there was...More
Had a nice time during our visit. The food (availed a lunch buffet) was so great. And the tour was worth trying. That bringing you closer to nature feels.
Nice place there!. i've enjoyed my tour and its very cool.. best place for family bonding there. i love it!

We stayed in Gardenia room there. It was a forest like living experience. The buffet breakfast was simple and good. We enjoyed the nature especially the day tour. We love the fishing village, our children enjoyed the fishing. It is indeed a wonderful getaway place👍

I have spent one of my best days in davao city here in Eden park. We really enjoyed riding the motor going to eden then enjoying the nature. Breathing a fresh air while walking around and taking some nice pictures. We enjoyed the nice games...More

This is a nice escape from the very hot and humid climate of Davao city.As you go up higher the mountain you can feel the cooler air slapping on your face as you race to the top.Soo many tourists and guests when we arrived,expected as...More

Worth the trip. Entertaining. Kids of all ages has something to do. The guide is very helpful. Fishing is very fun. Sadly the only fish is tilapia beyter if its bangus or milkfish. Fish caught will be cooked and has to be paid for.

If you want adventure this is the right place for you. Skyrider, then, Skycycle. Now, Eden Nature Park and Resort is adding another extreme attraction called Skyswing. “Skyswing can test your limits at the resort’s highest and fastest adrenaline rush,” there's fishing village, swimming pool,...More
It was so amazing... i so love the sun flowers and all the flowers. And the food... it is to die for... specially the salad. Super worth the trip.

Breathtaking experience! After an hour of travel by car from the city, the mountain ascend will give you an idea of a serene and nature rubbing elbows event. The calm ambiance is felt as soon as you enter the resort, being one with Mother Nature,...More

ReviewTitle: A beautiful place for our family bonding
Review: The first time my elder sisters visited Davao not for me but to relax ,escape their household(haha),eat at magwala-I recommended Eden right away.I have been to Eden twice before and I have known that the mountain resort clime and ambiance are perfect for envigoration as...More
Eden park wonderful for relaxing. However, you need to pick the good time for visiting this park. It's suitable for families as well and there are an area for kids enjoyment.
We visited the park during a very sunny and comfortable day. The elevation kept the temperature in check. Our 5 year old loved the kids rides just beside the lunch area.
We drove to Eden Park to get away from the very hot weather in Digos city. The park is quite high up in the mountains, so the weather is a lot nicer up there, lower temperature and a little breeze.

A very relaxing tour arnd the area.. Though you only get to enjoy each spot for 5mins.. Guides are provided and shuttle.. Julie, our guide has a very modulated voice and is knowledgable abt the places of visit..
we explored the whole eden and we were amazed and educated!tnx to our guide and my daughter enjoyed the tour...the buffet lunch was great!!!

This place offers relaxation at its finest. If you just want a quiet night, surrounded by nature, away from city life and just have your own perfect space, then this place is for you. I suggest you get the Vista Cottage if you're traveling as a couple as this provides a romantic feel. The rooms doesn't have AC because they offer the same climate as that of Antipolo and it can get pretty cold at night.  The accommodation comes with a free dinner and breakfast buffet for two so it gives your moneys worth. If you're also up for some adrenalin rush, try Skyswing! you won't be disappointed! haha
There are so many activities that you can do in this place. I suggest you go here early so that you can already enjoy the shuttle tour.
Do not visit during weekend. It's perfect for family day. The place is relaxing if not crowded. Also perfect for garden wedding.
The buffet is really YUMMY. I ate a lot in this buffet. The place is very relaxing. There were a lot of trees and activities that can be done inside this Park.

if you a nature and adventure lover this is the best place to go! we tried there amazing adventure rides and it was an amazing experience. Adrenaline Rush!!! I Conquered my Fear, I had tried something new adventure - the SkySwing, I survived as we were lifted up to 95 ft. Into d air & then suddenly dropped to swing back & forth!

HUGE private park with much to see and do. Everything from gardens to fishing to horse riding and the price of the tour in included with entrance fee. Lunch was 4/5 stars - very fresh and tasty. The adventure rides were quite thrilling - SkyRiding was terrifying (but fun!) and the Zipline was a blast. Didn't do the Sky Swing but several others in our group did and loved it. Great place to relax and enjoy the outdoors in a lovely setting.

ReviewTitle: Include this place in your Davao Itinerary
Review: This is our first stop in our Davao Trip and I was amazed that there was a little "Baguio" in Davao City. The cold mountain breeze and the pine trees truly are pleasant and relaxing. We bought tickets for their shuttle day tour for about 150 pesos I think and it was good for me, I saw for the 1st time a DragonFruit Tree, the gardens were beautiful and I learned a little about how the park used to be an illegal logging site so I felt good that we are contributing in saving the environment because I went there. I haven't stayed in their rooms though so I cannot comment on that but we also had buffet lunch there and the food was not bad but not too good either so it was just ok, I can say that you get what you paid for with this buffet. It was 550 pesos I think. Overall, I recommend everyone to include this place in their itinerary when in Davao City

We did a sidetrip to Eden Nature Park after our climb in Mt. Apo. We heard so much about this place, and we decided to give it a try. For 220 pesos for the entrance and food (snacks), more if you choose with lunch, excluding Ride fees, it is a bit pricey. But, the place is nice and well kept. We only went to the rides section which is opposite of the main facility. We did all rides possible, cost is around 1K. We were impressed with their staff, very accommodating, helpful, and polite. We enjoyed the rides, especially the sky swing! Exhilarating!
went here for a day tour and loved it!!! the place is amazing, the staff higly accommodating the the buffet lunch is amazing! will definitely book for an overnight stay next time

ReviewTitle: one of the best in davao
Review: when in Davao, don' t miss this nature park..it's one of a kind experience. Thumbs up for the managemen of this park.
He place was good since it is big plus you got a lot of attractions around the area. My brother and sister in law got a great wedding there. Foods were most organic. Staffs are nice.

restaurant was closed, everyday when we was there, so that means no food the staff was going to call to make up what happen, BUT NEVER CALLED, they just want your money, spent 36,000 for 3 days, you would think they would have better service...More

This park is for people who wish to have some peace and quiet, and for those who enjoy being close to nature and animals. They have peacocks that roam free in the area. Buffet lunch was nothing to write home about, lettuce was fresh, though.

Eden Nature Park is always a nice and refreshing place to be when you want to enjoy field or nature activities or just take a break from the busy city life. Here, you can either chill at their restaurant on a day tour and experience...More

I love the place. Great view...fresh, clean air, friendly staff and the buffet lunch was excellent. I've been there twice and I will definitely go back. The first time I went there I tried the zip line. We recently went there to try out the...More
very clean air and nature view with exciting rides, it's a combination of thrills and peace. i love the organic food they serve.

After you do the tour.. go to the other side. Where the swing. Zip line. Horse ride is. The only decent one is the big swing. 2 people for 500 or 300 for single. The horse ride is for kids. 100 peso 2 laps around...More

When you like to be with your loveone's, this place is the best place to be. The location is too far away from the heart of City Of Davao but upon arrival in the place, you will rewarded by the natures treasures.
Very nice nature and history of the native farmers. The park is clean and full of flowers. Nice children to play.

ReviewTitle: A must visit when in Davao
Review: Eden Nature Park is a MUST visit when in Davao. It is a nature park with the amenities of a Theme Park. TIP: Visit should be first thing in the morning because of a long line for the park tour.
Great for couple. Romantic and peaceful place to stay. Perfect place for celebrating anniversary and valentines. Nice to have garden wedding in Eden. A must visit place.

ReviewTitle: A good place to get away from City life
Review: IF you like nature this is a nice place to get out,.just to be in the greens again feels great. Good place for family outing. The food in the restaurant is filipino food but is was a warm welcoming in my tummy.

Stunning view of everything. Accommodation was great. I like the cottage style. Great for morning walks. Plenty of activities. My fav one was the "Skycycle"!!! and a trip around the place. Good food. Excellent staff. I'll come back definitely.

ReviewTitle: A place you shouldn't miss when going to Davao..:)
Review: Eden Nature Park is truly nature in every sense of the word. It's like you're really one with nature and you'd just like to stare at the beauty of God's creation. My children and my husband most especially enjoyed the Butterfly Garden, human interaction with...More

This place was too far from the city proper, that’s why when we arrived at the Davao City from Manila, we plan to go there first and we arrived at the EDEN by 4:30 pm... No more amenities to try and we just have one...More

We had a wonderful experience while we were there. The staff were very courteous. We had a sumptuous lunch at Vista Restaurant. The place offers many things to do and to enjoy. We decided to join the shuttle tour which took us to an hour...More
Very peaceful and enjoyable day Food was fresh and plenty of it The tour vehicles are too cramped for those of us above 6 feet tall

ReviewTitle: Good for a Day Out with the family.
Review: We have been to Eden several times and recently with kids and relatives. It is a beautiful drive from Davao City with spectacular view when driving up the mountain. We did a package of sightseeing tour in a mini bus and lunch. ( option to...More

ReviewTitle: Nice place but not the food!
Review: We went to Eden Park with my family when we had our holiday in the Philippines in December 2015. I loved the nature and the air was refreshing. It was about time to get away from the noise and terrible traffic in the city. Our...More
at home with fresh air and nature, a peaceful place to meditate and relax amidst the greenery, resort is a little bit pricey but reasonable for those who enjoy mountain climate
Great Park, beautiful scenery. And cool air to enjoy the scenic view! Will come here again with family!

Came here on a Saturday so there were a lot of people and kids. Arrived at around 11:50 and registered. However, next batch for lunch buffet was at "probably 13:30" as per the receptionist so we paid for plated snacks which were already available. The...More

place is so perfect for view. so relaxing. SkyRide makes you crazy especially the sky wing tandem.... it will make your head turn upside down. we try also the skycycle and the sky zipline. the weather is cold coz its located on the top of...More

If you are going to Davao, you must go here. It is like a small zoo with ziplines on bicycles! You can spend a night there or several hours. The entrance fee includes the best buffet lunch anywhere, all you can eat. Most animals are...More

Go to Eden for a day trip but stay in other hotels in the city for the night. They have good rides and fun activities for the family, but they have the worst room accommodation ever! We stayed at the Holiday Lodge on the first...More

ReviewTitle: Nice place away from the city noice!
Review: I went here with my friends and my mom for a day away from the town. Its about 45 minutes outside of the city depending on the traffic. Place is nice and the guided tour can be recommended. in regards to the food included in...More

I didn't really like to go here because i know that their facilities and available activities are almost similar to that in Caliraya and Sandbox ( plus some trekking if you have the patience and energy to do so). But forced by a group of...More

Had a great time loved the zipline and sky cycling.The lunch was average but filling. Helpful miss at the check in. You will need to negotiate a taxi price,we hired a real nice fella for 2,500p for the afternoon and he was prepared to stop...More
it's quite far from the main town of the city but you'll love it. a lot of plants and flowers that kids will surely love.

If you're in Davao and especially if you have kids, then the Eden Park experience is worth adding to your itinerary.  A meal is included with your entry fee as is the tour (around 45 mins including photo stops).  Very well priced in terms of value for money.

we arrive at the resort 4:45pm... if you enter the resort you should avail a buffet or snack on their restaurant. The guard said to us we should avail the dinner buffet costing 550 per head, and since we got a long travel to get there we accept what the guard said to us even if it is super pricey because we will not be able to see all the beauty of the resort. Good thing when we are at counter I ask the lady if they still have the plated snack, she said they have but it is a last call. Plated snack cost 220/head, instead of paying 1100 we just got to pay 440. Buti na lang... And we only have 1 hr to see what inside their resort. Sad thing, rides they have close at 4pm, kaya we did not try it... =(

The location is just out side Toril, approx. 5k..Up in the Highlands approx 2500 ft.. Very nice day trip. There is a entrance fee,, and one can pay for a tour around the park. Luch was a Buffett style and it was ok.. Nothing exceptional. Great view of Davao and hiking the trails before lunch amakes lunch even taster!!

We love this place because of the number of amenities and facilities it has. Basically, it is a getaway within the city since temperature drops several points (which means a lot for the local people who had to endure the tropical weather).  Food is always great and the rooms are well maintained. I also love the fact that they continually offer heavily discounted offers which is great for people looking to book multiple days with a big company.  Will keep on coming back here.

Went here with my family and friends to try the skycycle and it was so good, I did the skycycle twice. Or that's just me being an adrenaline junkie. The entire park was so huge that you'll need a whole day just to explore it. Highly recommended next time you visit Davao.

Great views of Davao and great place for photographs. Caught fish in the fishing village which they cooked for us ( for a small charge ) , nice to eat ! A nice day out. Day starts with a trip round the park ( they drive you round ) with stops for photo's at different spots. Nice collection of butterflies in the butterfly walk .
we will go back if we have the chance. Nice view. nice room....nice food. the staff are very accomodatng
My family and I went to Eden Nature Park last March of 2015. We had fun touring around the place. They have a tram so going places was never tiring. Food was also great.
It provide exciting sky game, such as sky bicycle, sky swiming, very funny and exciting. 我們是去玩他的高空刺激遊戲，例如高空腳踏車，高空盪鞦韆...等，刺激又好玩，如果只是玩這些刺激遊戲的可以不用買公園門票，直接到遊戲區，依你想玩的付費玩即可，非常推薦一玩。

The place is just perfect for people who yearn for relaxation and fresh air. It is best to go there early morning to enjoy the cool breeze and awesome sunrise. Very well maintained and explorers will enjoy the place a lot! Make sure you have plenty of time to explore the place because it's huge which is perfect for adventurers and trekkers. Unfortunately, we were unable to explore the whole place due to a limited time. But we will definitely go back when we return to Davao soon hopefully.

skycycle and zipline are a must do. get there early to book a place or you will be disappointed. go for the full day as there is no price reduction for half day visits and as most things close at 4/5pm it is a waste of money to go after 11am.
This is our second visit to Eden Park and we still enjoyed it. Loved the tour and the buffet lunch! It is truly a great family destination in Davao.

It was in Eden when I first experience the anicycling activity. it was really scary and yet adventurous experience I ever had. They served great foods for their buffet. I like most their salad from their own organic farm.   You can avail also their tour through out Eden Nature park. A budget of 2000 pesos is good enough to enjoy the whole thing (food and rides)

ReviewTitle: the place is scary at night.
Review: They offer overnight stays in Eden park but what they did not say is that the park closes at 4-5 pm. Leaving you with nothing to do the whole night. Even the pool closes at 5! There were bugs in the room and only a few roaming guards to make sure you were safe at night. when we arrived, it only took us 10 minutes to decide to go back to the city since our security was not that safe during night time. Also in the room we check in, they said there was a cable tv but it was not working! The best thing to do here would probably be just a day tour since everything closes at 5.

The location on Trip Advisor map is INCORRECT as of Jan 4, 2016. The park is at least 10 miles northwest of the location indicated by Trip Advisor. The park is enjoyable and noticeably cooler than Davao City. Our park guide was very informative and very helpful in taking many photos of us at the best locations with the best views. I definitely recommend a visit to Eden Nature Park.

Never expected that I'd appreciate more my visit with Eden Nature Park than the previous instances I was here. Their buffet lunch has improved, plenty of drinks and food to choose from. And they're adding rides too.

Tune a quiet and cold night. Don't be surprise if the rooms have no AC unit, in the evening you will know why. There are few activities in store for your family not to bore. Enjoy the walk or simply linger with the view. Food is lavishly fresh and palatable. It's a wonderful adventure with family.

I love trees, nature, etc. and it was all provided by Eden Nature Park (duh!), I would've loved to experience a day or two in their cabins and hike around the place. Pretty good place for couples and friends.
For nature buff. A great time in nature Family fun. Ok food. Love the skybike and an ok zipline. I'm going back there did not see everything there.

Me and my family has a day tour at Eden nature park. We just walked around the park and had some pictures taken.   We had so much fun with their outdoor activities like the zip line and sky cycle.. It was an amazing adventure for my family. The only downside is the platted food served for the guest. (We didn't choose buffet because lunch because it is quite pricey)

ReviewTitle: A great Park to visit,Good restaurant food,nice views
Review: Eden Nature Park, beautiful views and certainly a place for the photographer. I was thrilled when we arrived at this Park. The scenery was beautiful.The buffet meal that myself, wife and her two parents purchased from the Park Restaurant consisted of a nice variety of Salads,Filipino meals and sweets, as well as various fruit drinks(unlimited).After a short walk around the Bird Avaries we then joined about another 10 visitors for a guided motor tour of the Park area.Our female guide was very helpful, and during the 45 minute tour of the complex we stopped a number of times, where our guide took many photos, amongst the gardens and flowers of the tourists I would recommend a visit to the Park for anyone visiting or living in Davao There are a number of other activities that can be undertaken,but I would suggest prepare for most of the day to enjoy Eden Nature Park.

Eden made some enhancements with adding extreme rides to their park like, skyrider, skyswing, and zipline. But they fail to maintain/improve their park in general. The flowers and grasses are not as lively looking as they were 10 years ago, the reindeer enclosure has seen better days (and it stinks), but the good news is... they have great buffet!
Experience the soothing breeze of the pines and enjoy a moment with nature. It is 25kilometers from downtown Davao; but it is only 30-45 minutes ride.

it was my second time last August 2015, with friends this time. the place is quite far from the city, but worth it when you get there. really cool place, literally and figuratively haha! the place is perfect for lots of picture taking because of the beautiful surroundings. the last time we went here, they were full house. the zipline and sky cycle was already full until 4:00pm, so we just decided to roam around the area. but then the lady at the frontdesk heard our conversation, and told us that we still need to pay 350 pesos even if we are just going stay there, (i cant remember the exact amount). we didnt really like that but business as usual. that payment included snacks anyway-- choice of pasta or sandwich, and a glass og soda or juice. bring DSLR cam if you have one, the place is perfect using dslr. then wear rubber shoes, DO NOT use slippers. bring your shades/sunglasses and sunblock. and if you can, just wear plain colored shirts..

The place was indeed really great. It has an affordable tour package to see around the whole 40 hectares area. It also has a adventure package like the skycycle which was a fun filled experienced. The tourguide was indeed good plus friendly. The only package which we thought was not that a good deal is the snack package. The snack is worth 220 pesos which serve a spaghetti and a brownie. The price is not worth the snacks. But nevertheless the experienced is all worth it plus the place is really great.

If you're looking for a nature-tripping, this is the place to visit. The park is huge, you can either get a guided tour or just walk around the place. My friends and I decided to do our own tour in the park. The place is peaceful and quiet. There are a lot of areas with beautiful sceneries.   For those people who love thrills, try Sky Swing. It's a free fall ride! I love it! Although the first drop is only the exciting part, I still enjoyed it.

For those who love the outdoors, this is the place to be. They have a tour that will bring your around the park coz the place is quite big. It gets cold beyond 5pm but some areas are closed off around that time.

ReviewTitle: Nice trekking experience.,.,. Eden Nature Park Trail
Review: Try it's mountain trail, I went here solo and tried their mountain trail. You will truly enjoy more the Lola's place than riding a shuttle tour. No limit time and your alone in this place.

This is one of the best place to be in Davao City when you're looking for a getaway to a cooler place in the city. The floras & faunas around are already a good sight to relax. The place, food, activities & experience are over all awesome!

My first time here was with my BFF but unfortunately we where stopped by the rain.. they wont cater us for the rides anymore... The second time was with my Fiancee, Friends and Sister and Nephew who came all the way from Cebu to celebrate Kadayawan. We had so much adventure strolling the area... we went fishing tilapias... I caught one.. ehhehheh My nephew was better at fishing He caught 5.... We tried the swing and the sky cycle.... Its so FUN!!! But I got a little accident in the "Indiana Jones" it was negligence in my part... So be extra careful when using it... Its far from the City proper but Its worth all the effort just to there :D
It's a very good place for a little bit of an adventure and if you like long walks. This is a beautiful place if you have family and friends with you.
You should NOT miss this place, very interesting, nice guides, good food and overall I visited it twice

Amazing nature park. The skycycling and skyriding combo deal was good value for money. Our driver Johny was able to video/take photos alongside me as I did it. We also paid for the buffet lunch as part of our entry fee. Definitely worth it! So...More

ReviewTitle: Experience nature and adventure at its best.
Review: Nice place to relax, meditate and unwind with a package of heart-throbbing sky cycle ride and other rides that really conquer your fears.

This place is huge and sprawling but it is not an overnight wonder built on artificial turf and make-believe flora. It is owned by the Ayalas of Davao (not the Ayalas of Makati) and it took some 23 years before they opened the park to...More

We arrived around 11AM and signed up for the guided tour and lunch buffet.The tour was excellent but a little rushed.Our guide was very good and her English was very good.Saw many beautiful gardens and just enjoyed the creation of our Lord.

Day tour worth 550 inclusive of buffet is worth the money. For the tour you can pay 120 or you can start trwkking thw mountain trail around the whole place ( exhausting and very tiring) you can get lost and you wont bw pickes up...More
They have extraordinary beautiful flowers & view. Their set of foods for lunch buffet is great. Their tour guide is a great photographer 😄
Everything is relaxing....i like the view, their garden, flowers, nature as it is! Though, there's one thing that frustrates me, their entrance fee is quite expensive!

There's so much to see here! We opt out of their buffet package and shuttle service, we wanted more of than the usual tour, went down the trekking path which the shuttle can't reach, roam around the flower garden and fishing village. The place is...More

I went to Davao for the first time for a convention. I was so impressed with everything in the city. It was like NCR but cleaner, with more disciplined drivers, safer... On the last day of the convention I decided to stay overnight at Eden Nature Park. It was worth it. Even the rain didn't stop us from enjoying the place. A breath of fresh air in the South. The rooms were not airconditioned but it was cold. We have a balcony overlooking the lush manmade forest. At 380 pesos, you can eat to your heart's desire buffet style. If you're an adventurer seeker try their adventure park.   If you haven't been to Davao, do visit and do not and I repeat DO NOT forget to visit Eden nature park.

To maximize the eden adventure, visit the park first thing in the morning. We got there 8am and did the sky cycle first, then horse back riding. There's also the tandem ride, which my son didn't have the courage to try. It looks scary from the ground. But if you love thrill rides. You should try this.  Afterwards we took the first shuttle ride around the park at 945am. We got Emce as our tour guide and she was great! She took care of our pictures. We had a lot of complete family photos taken in the place. The tour takes around 1 hr and it was worth it. Afterwards we took our snacks- you get 2 choices spaghetti or tuna sandwich.   We'll be sure to visit this again :)
For those who are lovers of nature, this is the place to see, free from pollution and the hustle and bustle of city life.

its impossible to cover the whole area of eden because it is enormous. but when you are up there in the mountains you realize that Davao is a mountainous place. Join the shuttle tour to cover the whole place. but why do they have to charge separately for fishing and swimming?

ReviewTitle: Inhale, Exhale, Nature in a City
Review: I just love this place. Fresh Air. Mountain Breeze, Good for the Eye Sight due to the greenery. You gotta love this place. Perfect View and It's like you are in a different place. "IM ON TOP OF THE WORLD"

ReviewTitle: What a great place to experience nature
Review: Less than an hour from downtown Davao City you are out in the middle of nature! There are Pine trees and palm trees all mixed up together. The park is well-maintained and very secure. The food is served buffet style and is very tasty. The houses on the property are all unique in style and offer a beautiful night sleep. You can hear all of the wonderful night stones from your little house… There are also lots of activities like the skies swing! You are dropped from at least 50 feet high and sweating like crazy! You will want to discover everything for yourself …

This place is all about fun and nature! We had so much fun here and the place was also clean when we were here. The place is good for family activities and they also have a small restaurant to get your snacks and to freshen up.  Just be sure to visit early since their activities do have a limit per day.
A beautiful place to hang out with friends and family.A very affordable food also they offered.A very clean surroundings.Beautiful spot to take on..I love this place so much.

ReviewTitle: the best place to try extreme game !
Review: i go there with my group on oct 2015. i try sky cycle and sky swing. i really enjoy it.it worth for me because i just pay 330 peso for these two games.it very adventure and extreme. but this place very far from city.

Eden Nature Park is a little distance away from our hotel which is Seda Abreeza. The trip was all worth it. Upon arrival you will breathe in nature right away. Cool crisp air and the surroundings are all vibrant green. With around 90 students in tow we were able to schedule the mini cab rides by splitting the big group into two.   When in Eden Nature Park, I would personally recommend the mini cab ride going around the property. Especially to those who are not up to the walking, hiking challenge of the terrain. The tour takes about 45 minutes to finish and the tour guide will take you through the beautiful spots of the park like flower gardens, fruit plantations and breathtaking views. Many photo opportunities for those camera lovers.   Visitors should also try the buffet lunch. Yummy dishes made out from the freshly grown vegetables in the park. It has a good spread and worth the money.   The place is a two thumbs up! Ideal for families, groups, friends and they even cater to special occasions like weddings and reunions!

Exciting experience fishing in the man made lake with lots of fish then the staff cooks it for you any style you want. Then after lunch we had a nice tour around the big garden including to see the different greenhouses they have where they get their organic food that they serve.

EDEN has given new meaning to all our employees at the LGU during our teambuilding activities. It was a dream come true for them. the food, the rides, the tour, the environment , all manifested GOD's love for all of us because He has given a beautiful and heavenly EDEN.

I went to Eden Park Jan2015 with family. A bit far from city central but worth the travel! My Mom is fond of flowers and ornamental plants so the tour was such a delight to her. Buffet lunch included in the package was I think the best meal that I had during our 4-day stay in Davao. I didn't try the SKYCYCLE though for I am really afraid of heights!

we arrived here a little late so we were not able to explore all the activities and amenities of the place. however, we were able to take the guided tour and ride the skyswing.  the tour was nice as you will be able to learn more about the place and have oppurtunities for picture taking.  the skyswing was a blast. i would love to have tried the zipline too.

"Place like heaven" this is how my friends define the place. I only just imagine how wonderful it is,the expression of their face tells me more how satisfied they are with what they experience with the place.  April 1, 2015 the day of exploration. I personally witness the beauty of creation, what I saw is beyond my imagination. The place was so great covering with lot of trees, beautifully cultured flowers, preserve endangered animals like birds and many many more to mention. I was very much satisfied with the place. Deserve to be recommend.

We visited Eden in 2002 and I eagerly looked forward to our 2015 visit. The attractions have been upgraded. The tandem swing will scare you and give you a huge thrill on the way down until you pendulum to a stop. The skybicycle was a blast although I don't understand why so many thought this ride scary. Maybe it was my attempt to pedal quickly that kept my focus. I even looked down. The zipline was a fast shreek across the treetops...delicious, quick. Take a selfie video. No, I did not.   At the end of the thrills, enjoy your included snack, a modest little dish of spaghetti with a dollop of dessert. Hey, you only paid a little bit to enter, so, the snack is basically free. We brought beer and other snacks and drinks to enjoy under the cover of the picnic area, too.

It is not just an ordinary park as I would imagine. It is a very humongous one.When you enter the park, the fishing pond would see right through your eyes. It makes me want to go fishing right away. Beside the canteen is a mini Zipline where you can enjoy riding with your friends and family. The food is very delicious and you just cant regret every single cent you've spent in that park.

ReviewTitle: A spring garden in the south
Review: This place is a paradise in the middle of the mountain..the food is freshly cut from its own garden, the cabins dont need an air-conditioner, the lush of pine trees add beauty to the place. It's like Baguio City in Mindanao.

Personally, I find this place not worth my money. Although the activities (Sky Cycle, Giant Swing, etc.) are quite affordable at PhP200-400 per person, the entrance fee they charge is VERY, VERY exorbitant.  The place is also not prepared to handle the influx of visitors. I went there last Kadayawan 2015, and as expected, volume of guests was staggering! Eden was like a marketplace! Kadayawan is an annual event in Davao; thus, management should have anticipated the influx of people. Imagine waiting for food we ordered--bland spaghetti, toast, and softdrinks--for more than ONE HOUR!?!?!

ReviewTitle: Superb experience! Must see in Davao!
Review: Went here with my brother and his gf and my three-year-old son. That time skyrider was on maintenance and was not available. It is located at Toril, they called it Little Baguio. So you already have an idea how cold it is. :)  I tried their SKYSWING. I swear it was an extreme adventure I ever tried! Whoa! They will pull you until 95ft and at the count of three they'll release you and let you swing in the air. Fee was Php300 (about $7) for a solo swing. (Yeah, did it solo. Tapang-tapangan, lol!) Php400 (about $9) for a tandem swing which my bro and his gf tried.   They also tried SKYCYCLE, that cost Php200 (about $5) each. It was 250 meter long as far as I remembered and as high as 60ft.   My son tried their horseback riding for Php85. It was so long and they made two rounds. The manong caretaker was accommodating so I gave him a tip.   Entrance was Php220 with plated snacks, we chose spaghetti with garlic bread, mini brownies and soft drinks of your choice.   Will definitely go back here on our next visit to Davao! :)))

The price I paid for the buffet lunch was not worth it P550.00. If planning a day tour might as well choose the plated snack only, it cost more than 200.00.  The tour is not yet included in the entrance fee you got to pay 100.00, we did not avail the guided tour we opted to walk around. :)  Must try: skycycle 165.00 Skyrider was not available

ReviewTitle: Best Place to visit in Davao!
Review: There's a lot of things to do in this place. I dunno but we really had a lot of fun when we tried the mini zip line. lol

ReviewTitle: The highest place in Davao city
Review: Such a nice and cold place for staycation! Don't miss this place when you visit Davao! It's worth the time and great experience, specially if you love nature. There's an educational trip too!

We went here after our convention but was disappointed because the tour should be booked in advance due to the high demands of tourists during our visit. Nonetheless, we should have tried their different outdoor activities like zipline and biking in a wire, etc. We just take pictures of the outer facade and opt to buy some snacks due to long hours of drive. The food here was a bit pricey so next time you go here, bring your own bottled water/juice to save up.

ReviewTitle: A nice mountain escape that's not too far from the city
Review: Offers nice views of the city and the gulf. Clean, chilly mountain air is refreshing. Offers outdoor activities like horseback riding and ziplines. Great place to stay over the weekend. Only con I could find was the number of choices at the buffet table. Other than that, great place!  Will I visit again? Definitely.

Its the best Park in Davao and would love to visit again if i have time. It was also nice to stay in their lodge if i can next time to explore more of the place. Roaming around the Park will make u feel more relax as you both learn and enjoy seeing the different kinds plants. beautiful flowers, plants that we never usually see in our garden, great landscape and etc. Likewise, the merienda that was served after the tour around the park was also great.  Would love to be there again.
never been there before but many people have told me it is very nice there so one day i will go there when i have time

It was a fair distance from our hotel but we wanted to zipline for the first time ever. Fairly priced entry which included a plated snack consisting of canned spaghetti or a bun with sliced meat and drink. We opted for the drink only. We enjoyed our zipline and took a few pics then left. There was other attractio s available like horse riding and a tandem swing.

ReviewTitle: Love the calmness and verdant of the place
Review: We have been there last August 31,2015. Worth the entrance fee of P 220.00 with free snacks ( choice of pasta or sandwich package ) and additional fee of P 120.00 for shuttle service to tour around the park with the tour guide.The landscapes was great and nature is really good even its manmade. A must see place when you travel to Davao.
Wonderful nature view and very cool atmosphere. They offer lots of activities (wasn't able to try their skycycling and other outdoor activities). Their buffet food is good :)
We really enjoyed our adventure here at Eden Park.. I love the greenery nature and specially our first ever courage to try the sky cycling so much fun!
A mountain resort full of amenities for the whole family to enjoy. Usually a private car rental takes you there since public transport is rare but avialable.

Day Tour cost us P 220/ head including snacks (decent spaghetti or sandwich with chips/ toast and a mini muffin). This includes a guided shuttle tour and you can also visit the aviary/ butterfly farm. You can opt to pay additional fees (from 40 -...More
Organic food fanatics should come to this place. The vegetable garden is very nice. The lunch was great. Should try the bicycle zipline & indiana jones ride.

ReviewTitle: Do not miss the Butterfly Garden and Fishing Village
Review: We stayed for two nights at Eden. The price was affordable but meals were not included. There are a lot of things you can do here, tour, zipline/skycycle/skyswing, fishing, aviary and butterfly garden, horseback-riding etc. The employees are very friendly. We stayed in a villa,...More

I visited this place 3 times already and it would be my 4th time together with my parents. I booked it earlier like the month of June because I want my parents to have a perfect vacation even just for a span of time, so...More

ReviewTitle: A lovely getaway from the heat of the city...needs a little work in places.
Review: We have visited Eden country park a few times on day trips, you can take the shuttle bus around the park, see the flower gardens, visit the deer, take a horse ride, zip line, fish,use the sky cycle and have a good buffet lunch. On...More

ReviewTitle: Half day tour is not enough!
Review: The place was really good! I had a great time in Eden Nature Park. I will come back here for sure. If you want to experience their rides, I recommend that you book at least a day before because when we went there, we were...More

Just love the silence and kind'a cold place with all the pine trees around. If you plan to visit Edens Park it would be nice if you'll make a prior reservation, and the location is a bit far from the city so be ready for...More
I've visited this place for more than 10times... With family,relatives and friends:) Still i enjoy being at eden park

The resort offers a day tour and overnight stay. If staying overnight, make a prior reservation. For day tour, best to arrive early as the place could get packed especially around noon. Book the guided tour upon payment of the entrance fee as it's first come first serve basis.  They offer thrill rides (swing, sky cycle, skyride, horseback riding), also on first come first serve basis. They offer fishing experience where caught fishes can be cooked for a minimal fee. If intended to have the cooked fishes for lunch, start early before the peak hour.  Staff are helpful and polite. Food is just right for the price paid.

The facilities are good and most staff are polite and friendly. Although, I find the entrance fee should not be in a package deal with lunch. Food should be priced separately. If someone does not want to eat in a particular time then it is expensive to pay the entrance fee.

ReviewTitle: Great place to visit for the family
Review: As I learned all about Eden Nature Park, I grew more impressed by the philosophy behind the business. This place has too many attractions on site to mention, but be assured they have enough keep a family entertained for a day and the buffet lunch is not to be missed either.  The butterfly aviaries are a great attraction for the young at heart and young people top understand the life cycle of the butterfly. Commendation to the staff in the butterfly exhibit, the way they worked with young people was admirable and if a had a name of a young male worker in the butterfly exhibit, I would be recommending him for an excellence award.  Attractions for all ages were in place and from all who visited it was not a disappointment.  I would go back again.

ReviewTitle: Best place to cool off in Davao
Review: The rides were awesome! I enjoyed every minute of it. We stayed overnight so we made sure not waste any time, and by golly, did we enjoy ourselves. The surrounding was very refreshing since it was very clean and cool. We felt so at ease since the staff were so accommodating and not to mention the food.. the buffet was wonderful. Fresh garden salad with organic viands. I felt so healthy afterwards. All in all it was a great experience and will be sure to come back and recommend to family and friends. Thank you Eden!
The gardens are nice. The lunch was good. There's plenty of areas for beautiful photos. Too bad we ran out of time to try the sky cycling thing.

Quite far from the city . It's as if your in pine city or the highlands . If you're a nature lover , this one's for you . they offer different types of accomodations , you get to hike , ride their shuttle and see their indigenous cultural heritage , rainbow pass , zipline .

ReviewTitle: One with Nature, One Great Experience ^_^
Review: Originally went to Davao to just see the 30th Kadayawan Festival but since I'll be staying two more days after the festival I searched for places where I can go and that's where I found Eden Nature Park. Got curious so I done some research and decided to go. It is located in Eden Bayabas, Toril. The park sits right at the foot of Mt. Talomo.   The place is perfect for celebrating special occasions because of its relaxing ambiance. The park offers various activities such as zip lining, horse back riding, trekking, fishing, swimming or just simply going around the park to see the beauty of nature. Other must-see places of the park are the Amphitheater, Lola’s Garden, Flower Garden, Plaza Maria, and Mayumi’s well.  I have fear of heights but still I purchased the Combo Ride (Skycycle and Skyrider). After the rides I went to have my lunch at the Vista Restaurant where their served delicious snacks. My tour was at 10:45AM but I was able to finish the ride at 10:54AM. The front desk re-booked mine and put me on the next tour so I just stayed near the front desk until my tour arrives. The tour was really great and since I'm traveling solo the tour guide gladly helped me took my pictures. Its was very great experience and would love to come back. I would definitely recommend it to anyone who will go to Davao.   Keep up the good work guys! God Bless!
Eden Nature park is located in toril davao city one of the most nature park to go and sight seeing over looking davao city i like it ...
Another good place to explore. One day is needed to fully discover the forest trails. I This can be a good side trip after finishing the Philippine Eagle Center in Davao...

Has potential, but I wasn't impressed. Entrance fee included snacks, which was nothing special, but the effort is appreciated - there are few other food options in the area. They offer a tour of the park for 120.00 which we didn't take because it'll take you to limited areas only and each stop is only for 5 minutes - just good enough for pictures. Rode the skycycle - and the guy manning it, Lito, was curt, surly, impatient and downright rude. Some riders were nervous but he didnt care and was very impatient with the nervous ones. In fairness, the guy manning the zipline was a lot nicer. Will not recommend this place unless they make major improvements and train their staff
For those nature lovers this a place for you. Adults and kids would surely enjoy their stay. Located just 1 hour drive from davao city proper. They serve vegetables fresh from their gardens,

jeepney then a habal habal, for 13kms - trike wanted 300p from the pan pacific highway , taxi back to downtown was 450 but expect to pay more if going one way there. About 70 heclares of mainly woodlands planted in the 1960's with bungalows...More

If you want your kids to take a break from their gadgets, this is a good place to go. There are a lot of activities here which the kids and the kids at heart will enjoy. The entrance fee comes with a healthy lunch buffet....More
nice nature place and overlooking davao city and samal island to all nature lover this is nice one to explore

Eden Nature park is a lovely place to be if you want peace and quiet. At night time you can hear the crickets and the sound of nature like an orchestra of lovely music. The food served at the restaurant are mostly organic and locally...More

I've been to the place twice in a week. Firstly we did the day tour only as we have to visit other places and secondly with the big family with kids. I love the place, the buffet and the atmosphere. My nephew and niece enjoyed...More

ReviewTitle: A getaway from the hustle of the city
Review: I've been to Eden many times , in those times these were the few happiest moments in my life. It always brings me smiles and comfort whenever I visit this place. Its a magical experience for me because its so peaceful and quiet. Its always...More

Been here twice and it is always a delightful trip. First was solo for a travel assignment then with my daughter and friends. The kids roamed around and had tremendous fun sans gadgets!! Healthy food, too!

Make sure you have Eden Nature Park in your itinerary when you tour Davao. It's about an hour or so taxi ride from the Davao International Airport. But the trip is going to be worth it. The place offers recreational activities like fishing, mountain trekking,...More

Our friends from Davao toured us to this spot and we had such a great time. We kicked off our tour with a fabulous lunch at the Fishing Village. It was such an experience to catch the fish (albeit in a pond) that you will...More

It so fascinating to see the geographical view of Davao City from above. appreciating the beauty and the development of the city makes you to stay even longer for this place. having nice accommodation and cultural ambiance with fine weather.   There is no place like EDEN here in this city. if you want to unwind, meditate or bond . Go to this place and surely , you will love it.

ReviewTitle: Beautiful nature in a great scenery
Review: We went on a day trip to Eden, last july. After a rather long and slow tricycle ride we arrived at the park. I was immediatly overwhelmed by the beautiful nature surrounding. After a short but steep walk up we came at the entrance, this was 550 per person lunch buffet included. At first i was a bit surprised by this rate, but this melted away entering the park. First we walked a bit around at the bird park and the butterfly garden where we saw a lot of different spieces beautiful butterflies. We barely met other visitors though the amount of people at the entrance did us think different.  After some walking around on the upper side of the park, we went for the lunch buffet. This was just wow. So yummy, end really everything as much as you wanted to eat.  Every dish was well prepared, every dessert was yummy. The value for money was just superb. After lunch we really had to walk our food a bit off so went went by foot to the lower part of the park where we visited a beautiful flower garden, en some other sightings. All the personel was really friendly and helpfull when asking a question. I don't know f i would like a longer stay at the park because of it's remote location, but it surely is worth a visit.

my kids enjoyed the day trip to Eden's, just playing in the playground, indiana jones zipline, aviary, butterfly garden and even the short tour of the park on an open jeepney ride. the organic buffet was also great though could maybe use 1 more meat viand. me and my wife enjoyed the leisurely stroll with the nice view and the fresh air. We are going back to stay overnight and maybe setup a tent for camping

ReviewTitle: Beautiful place but a little overprices
Review: I can recommend you visiting Eden. It´s beautiful and peaceful. Price for staying is a little high and food is also a little expensive. . But for one or two nights it´s ok. Rooms or cabins are very nice with good beds. It´s no problem to go to Eden, just take a bus from Terminal in Davao to Digos City or Gensan. Bus will stop a few kilometer from Davao and from there you can go with motorcycle. Or you can take a taxi from Davao. Price is 800 pesos.

Been to this place for morethan two times already and for the sake of nature,view and fog experience you must go to this place though I highly recommend if you are a little bit out of budget you can still enjoy outside the park there is a place looks like a free road which you can have a great view of Davao city if there is no fog messing the view.   Entrance is around 200php and the food you will be serve is like worth 20php so don't expect something that will satisfy your stomach. Enjoy the place more.

Reservation is very easy and hassle-free. You can call their reservation hotline and they will book the date for you without downpayment. You can pay on your actual day of visit. They even text/followup you to check for your arrival time.  Travel time is 30 to 45mins from the city proper and the road is well-paved.  We availed of their buffet lunch for Php550/pax and hubby got his for free (since it is his birthday). Two choices for salad, one kind of soup(squash), four varieties for main dish (pork humba, beef, fish fillet, roasted chicken), spicy baked zitti, arroz ala valenciana(rice dish), plain rice, three types of dessert(maja blanca, brownies, leche flan), sliced fruits, 3 types of juice(blue lemonade, pink lemonade, regular lemonade, coffee  Shuttle tour is Php120/pax. Make sure to book your tour schedule as soon as you got in cause they have limited slot (you have to be physically present in the park to book this tour).  Guided shuttle tour lasts for 45mins to 1hr with three stops. Downside is you only get 5 to 10mins to explore/take photos per stop. So if you are the type who takes your time, you might feel that the tour is hurried. Guides are very knowledgeable though and friendly. Our tour guide, Julie, even offers to take your photos and suggests some poses.  Place is clean and well-maintained. Construction is on going on some parts. Did not get to try their sky rider/sky cycle activities due to time sched. They have a playground for kids and also Indiana Jones playground for the young at heart.  Although, we understand that they have limited number of shuttles and they need to go back to use for the succeeding tours, would have given 5stars if the tour stop overs are longer. Maybe 15mins?

ReviewTitle: nicely landscaped lots of things to do
Review: very nice park with a variety of activites, Im too chicken to do sky cycle but my friends enjoyed it butterfly enclosure was lovely
great tour experience with cold mountain environment with the different flora species scattered around the park. there is food and swimming

It was a very fun and exciting team building spent in the Cabin at EDEN nature park, Where you are at a 2200 feet high above sea level and viewing the nightly plains where you can see the city lights from afar and where no lights pollution take effect and for you to enjoy more about Star Gazing. Very Cold on the near December month. Pack your jackets and it is just 30 minutes away from the city. Cozy huh?

We went there a while ago and was very disappointed to find that we have to pay at our every move. When we want to join the shuttle, we have to pay 120. So instead, we chose to walk. Too expensive for that shuttle. After the tiring walk, we tried to ask for water from the dispenser and they said we should pay for it as it is for the dinner buffet. How could they refuse us free water when we paid for such an expensive buffet worth 550 with cold pasta, no soup, and just 4 viands, and a brownie and maja blanca for desserts to choose from?! Isnt that a bit harsh to tired people who chose to walk their trails?!

The place is all nature! There are flowers everywhere and some spots are overlooking the Davao Gulf. I would suggest to a nature lover to take a hike instead of taking the guided minivan tour. You would definitely enjoy the cool air and the calming sounds of the forest.   For those adrenaline junkies, better try the sky cycle and the latest addition, giant swing.  The greens served at the salad bar are definitely fresh. As for the other dishes served, nothing really special about them. Just your ordinary buffet dishes. The salads are must try though.;) oh and I like the different choices of drinks one can choose from.;)

ReviewTitle: Fun getaway for the whole family
Review: Eden offers a number of activities for the whole family. Must tries are the zipline and sky cycle and Indiana Jones. Kids and teens surely loved it.   Great job at rehabilitating what used to be over logged mountains in the 80's.  Should not be missed when visiting Davao City.
Nice place to go to escape the heat. Lots of fun activities for all ages. Takes a while to get there but worth the trip

ReviewTitle: It's relaxing but not very special, just a nice garden with some animals and a few friendly attractions
Review: We went there to relax a little and it's fine, same idea as the crocodile park but then with lots of trees, birds, swimming pool etc. Don't expect a huge zoo or so, it's all quite simple. The swing and skycycle are nice, to be recommended.

We had a whole day filled with fun and activities going here in Eden Nature Park.. We have spent our 3 days in Davao from Manila to go to a wedding and planning where to go after a day is not in our list..   We had a time where we are thinking if we should go to either Samal Island or in Eden Nature Park but we still ended going to Eden Nature Park because of budget risk too.. It was quite a lot of fun going here, exploring the place and being with my girlfriend.. Trekking is not (yet) one of her likes but after spending the whole day here, we managed to explore almost 90% of the place.. It was fun as if we are also trekking.. The weather is also cooperative as it never rained nor had a scorching heat from the sun.. The day was perfect and everything followed that day..   We ought to have our trip thru their van but we thought that spending is something that we cannot afford.. So we ended up walking most of the parts in this park and we never had a bad choice as we have explored and again almost 90% of this place..   You can see the pictures where we have been and ask me questions you might want to ask but ultimately, this is something that you have to go to if you are still young, young at heart and looking for some adventure.. :)

This park is quite wide, it has many trees to see , picnic areas to eat and unwind with families and friends. Since this place is large park, you can have any fun and family-oriented activities to do and enjpy. Enjoying the nature sharing memories and moments with your love ones.

ReviewTitle: Should have made the horse run!
Review: We enjoyed the rides, the pine trees, the sky cycle, zipline, horse back and the green fields. The food not so much. If they had more food choices, it would have been great! The rides are not as extreme but they're good on its own - wish they were longer, too.

ReviewTitle: There is something for everyone ...Food was great
Review: Did a day tour with a buffet lunch included. Really great spread..salad bar was excellent. P500 pesos for the day tour and lunch (really worth it) Took a tour around the park for another P120...nice place to take pictures..

A really great day out. Wasn't adventurous enough to do the nature hike or Cycle zip line but thoroughly enjoyed the shuttle bus ride around the park. The gardens are splendid. The birds and butterflies well worth a look. Rooms and chalets available to rent.

Our friend from Davao schedule us a trip to Eden. Eden has a Baguio vibe, cold weather and fresh air. Pine trees were bought from Baguio as per our guide. They have lots of activities to offer. You can also stay for a night or 2. The lunch buffet was affordable and delicious. You can also do fishing and have it cooked the way you want. The activities we tried are the eden tour, sky swing, zipline and horse backriding for my friends son.

Rooms are clean but a bit pricey. They also have a swimming pool. Some exotic birds. They have a big fish pond and you can actually catch fish and ask them to grill it. It was raining that day but we managed to enjoy walking as it's really a wide park. They have a shuttle from the entrance to the lobby if you don't want to walk. You can also just call them and request for a shuttle going anywhere inside the park. So if you love nature, then you'll love it there.
Fabulous lunch with vegetable grown on site. The 45 minute tour is worth the effort - views, unique plants and flowers,

ReviewTitle: They cannot keep up with big crowd
Review: It was a big mistake for me, hubby and my daughter to go this place last April 9th, 2015, which was "Araw ng Kagitingan", a regular holiday in the Philippines. The parking area was full and the receiving area was jam-packed. The whole place was very crowded. I was pretty amazed.   Anyhow, we paid for lunch buffet (there was a long line) and they said we had to wait. We waited at the children's park down by the restaurant. We can not go anywhere because we did not want to miss the lunch. We waited for like an hour and a half, maybe two hours, until we couldn't wait any longer. Hubby was not complaining but I knew that he was already starving. The waiting pissed me off so I thought to just get my money back and have lunch somewhere else. I talked to one of the busy girls in the receiving area. I was a little mad already but she remained so polite and calm, in fairness, explaining that she couldn't refund the exact amount we paid because we need to pay entrance fee of Php200 something pesos or we can just have the plated snacks. She said snacks are available right away. That somehow consoled me. So, we had plated snacks and got the rest of my money.

A beautiful garden full of a wide range of flora and fauna. I particularly loved to see all the fresh herbs and vegetables growing and the bus tour is worth taking so you can see a lot in a short time.

we went early as we only opted for the day tour. we paid for a shuttle tour.it was nice.the tour guide were kind too. she told us about the trees,and other plants . it was a knowledgeable tour for me since i didn't know what mangosteen tree looks like or other trees. hehe i think it would be great to bring kids here. there was a time when i felt like im no longer in davao city . the scenery and the fresh air was so relaxing. the guides were even kind enough to offer to take our pictures. then we headed back,and we tried their lunch buffet. the foods are delicious and they served really fresh vegetables. they have good choices of foods and drinks! I'd definitely come back.

ReviewTitle: Recommended for Family Trips with Young Kids
Review: We enjoyed this tour. The tour guide Julie did a wonderful job on guiding us during the shuttle tour. The area was all about nature, cool breeze was all around. I love the story about the owners who patiently waited for 23 years for the trees to grow before officially opening the site for operations. Food though was no good. I was already warned about it but there was no way of getting around it since aside from paying for the shuttle tour, you are required to avail of either a plated snack or buffet lunch. Plated snacks was P220 while the Buffet lunch was P550. Not only was the serving small but it did not taste good too. Not worth the price. I hope they can remove that.

ReviewTitle: far but if you really want to relax, try this
Review: I like the vegetations, can not believe they are man-made. I saw Pine trees which the guide said was from Benguet. Get a guide to tell you the story behind the Eden Nature Park, that is how to really appreciate it, and they people working there are very courteous.

ReviewTitle: Quick day trip to highland Davao
Review: There's a reason Eden is always on every Davao tourist's checklist. As a big fan of multiple activities in a sizeable area, I think it's a good excuse to trade city sights for some greenery for at least half a day, breathe in some fresh mountain air and finally find out how zipping, cycling or swinging in mid-air feels like. Who wouldn't want that?
Eden nature park is the best way to relax and enjoy with your family and breathe the fresh air. I will never be tired visiting this place.

If you love nature, You want adventure. Desperate to relax and rest. Something romantic and fresh. This is the destination you want to be with friends, corporate buddies, your spouse and the whole family.
The place is beautiful! Nature at its best. So cold, up in the mountains, 80 hectares of flowers, vegetables, fruit trees. Houses and villas for rent.
This place is good ambiance and relaxing. You must go there to enjoy life in davao. dont miss out because there are many rides to enjoy, and very cold pool :)

Far from the hustle and bustle of the city, Eden Nature Park is the perfect place to go if you want to relax and reconnect with nature. If you're the adventurous kind, you'll be happy to indulge in their multitude of outdoor activities which include...More
A very good spot to enjoy nature - walk or stroll around - enjoy the trees and the feeling of being around lush surroundings.

3000 feet above sea level you get a whole new perspective on the Philippines,, although it was a rainy day and we only spent a few hours there I was very very impressed, pine trees were tall and beautiful,,all the different types of flowers and...More

You have not really been to davao if you havent been to Eden. That about sums it all up. This place continues to amaze me. I have been here twice before and each time there is something new. (Of course i have probably been away...More

Been here for the nth time. The property has many amenities that caters to different types of guests. It has a pool, an aviary, a place that houses filipino culture including games etc., a fishing village where you can enjoy catching tilapia and catfish and...More

So many things to do here! Eat, sleep, sight-see, do "extreme" sports- start your own adventure! The travel is so long and a bit tiring since this located on a higher ground but whwn you arrive, you'll be welcomed by the cool and refreshing climate....More

We were not able to book the tour because it was fully-booked that time. They were handling a certain event of a government office that time. The park was so crowded. We were able to buy a ticket with free snacks. There were only 2...More

Eden is quite far from the City. If you are staying in Eden you will be far from Civilization. We just took the Day Trip. We got the Shuttle tour for 120 a person. The Shuttle tour will bring you around the Park, you will...More

If you're looking for some unique adventures here in Davao, Eden is the best place to be. They have Skycycle ride and ziplines which are all fun! Looking forward to riding their giant swing soon as well!!

Went there with some friends on a weekend and did not book ahead of time. We just walked in just like what we did on Dahilayan nature's park. We were so wrong on that plan as we did not get to have a shuttle tour...More

ReviewTitle: The Apple of Davao Traveller's Eye
Review: The business of Davao City proper is business. The proper business of travellers after conducting business in the City proper is to unwind the natural way: Eden Nature Park is such the place. Or for those needing a reboot (business traveler or not), a refresh...More
It is a way of having yourself feel the beauty of nature... A must see place. A way to experience nature.
The fruit bats were great & very educational for the kids & oldies alike. The bird & other wildlife collection are a must to see too!
traveled on this place for a photoshoot. nice place nice ambiance and nice people. although food is quite expensive but it worth the price.
This was a lovely outing after a few hectic days. There are a variety of activities for the active, and a lovely tour for the not so active. Meal was pleasant.
i love touring around their gardens. So relaxing. Friendly place for family & seniors. Our tour guide was very accomodating. She assists seniors. She's nice (i don't know her name).

The gardens are amazing but the buffet was very disappointing, cold food, it had been out for a long time and not appealing. Drinks were terrible. Take the tour around the whole property as you won't walk it.

ReviewTitle: Nice place for a day trip ir even an overnight getaway.
Review: Located about 40 minute drive from Davao City proper, this place is a nice break from the hustle of living in the city. Pine trees, cabin style rooms, animals, and day tours makes Eden a great family or couple destination.

ReviewTitle: Nice resort,an adventure for the family
Review: Excellent adventure facilities. The Skycycling and the Zipline are the main attractions for the more adventurous,while the beautiful gardens and view of Davao City are a feast for the eyes.From time to time, the view of Davao is obscured by cloud,due to the height of the resort.The wildlife include peacocks and squirrels. Being used to Filipino food,I found the menu satisfactory and quite good enough for my needs.Some other cultures might expect a little more,but there is more than enough for us.

A great place for relaxation and for pleasure. Has a daredevil blood? Try skycycling. For scaredy cats - try ziplining. Love hiking? Try there forest trail. Wants to see the view? Just by going up there, you can already see so many beautiful scenery.

What started out as a serene and refreshing nature trip...ended with an exclamation point when we tried the SKYCYCLE and ZIPLINE combo!!! Our family sampled the park's produce served at the lunch buffet...took a tour around feasting our eyes on the sunflowers and evergreen...enjoyed the aroma of the herb garden...got excited about the vast dragon fruit plantation...and marveled at the magnificent view. Food, nature, and adventure...a sure formula for a FUN-filled family outing!
If you want to relax and see a great view a must go place, i liked the most is their Indiana Jones ride its like you ride in a zipline

ReviewTitle: A place closest to the rainforest
Review: Visited Eden Nature Park in January, 2015 with friends. It was raining and found discomfort in the muddy surroundings, cannot find an easy parking closer to the ticket office, no umbrella assistance, had to run to the shade for cover. We were not able to enjoy as much as when it was not raining. However, we managed to take pictures and glimpse on the different attractions. It would have been better if there are attendants manning the parking and offering umbrellas to guests. The small store selling souvenirs seems not working well on sales, as the items for sale were dusty and unclean. Overall, it is a place for a sunny day.

Got a chance to travel to davao and visit eden. I so love the pictures i see posted on facebook but i did enjoy it more when I saw it myself. My son enjoyed the bike on zip ride. It was another kind of adventure. The tour guide is so helpful. Since lunch is included in the package I suggest more choices. The weather up there is likewise great and development is still ongoing.

Ride the bike on a zipline!  They have to improve their food though, so people will think of going back. It is too far from the city, that you should have a really good reason to go back, so it will be worth the time and transportation cost.
nice place. food buffet is great. the tour guide is very accommodating to questions and she even took photos during stopover.

It was our second visit to Eden Nature Park and we stayed for 3 days and 2 nights. My husband and I so love nature that we returned with our child to enjoy nature at its best. The serenity of nature brings peace to our soul. Our son loved the nature as well as the outdoor activities provided by the place. A relaxing getaway from city life. With all the beauty surrounding you, who can resist not going back to a heavenly place?

I had a great time at Eden Park. I didn't expect it to be such a big place so I was in awe when we arrived. We didn't know we had to have a reservation so we didn't get to tour the whole place using their shuttle and ride the skycycle. the place was fully booked!  We only stayed in the morning and it was a great morning. We walked around the place and saw different birds, deer, butterflies (they have a butterfly house) and played in the Indiana Jones playground.  If you want to experience the whole place I suggest booking one of their rooms so you have a whole day to chill while having fun.

This is just my second time visiting Eden but its been a while since then visiting here again was wonderful before we started our tour we had are launched their food is delicious afterwords we had our tour their staff was friendly and their attractions were unforgettable when in Davao try to visit if you can

If you love nature you will appreciate this park and zoo.. and if you want to relax you can stay here bcoz they have villas for the family and friends plus they have a swimming pool. There's a church inside for weddings and they have a place for your reception.. but you need to have a car or rent for a van to be able to go in edens nature park.. my 4 out 5 because of the location :-)
Excellent location, cool and relaxed atmosphere, good food, beautiful flowers, what more are you looking for?
A few kilometers away from the city but it's worth-in , the place is amazing beautiful view's and lots to do.

ReviewTitle: great for those who love nature and adventure
Review: Enjoyed the skycycle, the one-hour day tour trip, had fun picture taking with the views, thanks to our tour guide (wasn't able to get her name) , the short low profile zip was also fun even...

ReviewTitle: Very relaxing, good place to get away
Review: I we went up here with some friends whilst visiting Davao. It was a nice place. great if you enjoy the outdoors and nature. there is an entry fee to see the park, you can choose either with snacks or with a buffet lunch. I'd suggest the lunch if you are going to make a whole day of it. You cna purchase a shuttle bus tour of the place, takes 45 min and takes you to some nice photo shots. Nice, but a bit rushed. You only get 6 min to stop at each of the 3 locations, so you end up running around like crazy taking pics and dont really get to enjoy the views. If you are going up for the Zip Line or the new Sky cycle (bicycle way up in the sky on a rope), don't think you have to go to Eden park and pay the entrance fee. The zip line and activities are across the road and separate.  All in all a nice day, we spent about 3-4 hours there and did not get to see it all.

I damn near died of heat stroke. Don't do it man! Don't do it!  Other than that, the place was decent. Quaint little bamboo houses to see, zip line was OK, sky cycle OK, for Philippines standards both were good. Buffet was decent. Value for money was reasonable.

What they have done in transforming a formerly logged place into a lovely nature resort is truly admirable and remarkable. Mostly it is well done and well maintained.  However the girl in reception when we asked about the walking trail, wrongly told us it was closed. Maybe because she knew from my ticket purchase I was a senior citizen, however I am a capable one and I did the hike anyway, never once seeing any "closed" signs.

A bit far from the city, and not easily accessible if you don't have your own car. But once you're there, the travel is worth it because there are so many things to do - trekking, fishing, swimming, horse back riding, touring around the resort, zip lining and sky cycling. You can stay the night at one of their cottages, enjoy a massage at their spa or try their food at the restaurant while peacocks roam around the grounds freely.

ReviewTitle: Very nice place. Good tour guides.
Review: Nice big place that lives up to its name :) A good destination for those who love nature. We bought entrance tickets that comes with free meal/snacks which tasted good! The only downside of our trip there was it was raining.

Over rated park, long drive to get there ain't worth it. Ziplines already sold out & closed at 1pm. The tour they offered is very rushed. Only letring people off for 6 or 7 minutes each stop. Included snacks ain't good either. A wasted time inDavao. You'll have a better time doin the Wild River rafting

If you love nature, then, this must be the right place for u. Horseback riding, mini zipline, the beautiful Lola's garden, very good place for walking. Entrance fee is good because they provided lunch/snack though the would I really didnt enjoy.
Very relaxing, makes you think you are not in the Philippines surrounded by pine trees, fresh mountain air, cabins. Great place.

ReviewTitle: "The most interesting of the our day trip in Davao"
Review: We have been to various attaractions during our stay in Davao and by far this is the best attraction that we have experienced. Eden Gardens is a mountain resort about 3000 feet above sea level spreading over 80 hectares of land. Due to time constraint, we took the guided tour @120p per pax which takes an hour. This guided tour takes you to various points of interest like the Flower garden, Tinubdan (indigenous cultiral heritage of Mindanao, Lola's garden, vegetable garden, fruit tree collection, herbal garden, etc. If you have the time, go on the mountain trail by yourself.
