Heard it is a friendly yet challenging adventure. We went to theEden sports field which is located across the street from the main entrance. The horse park caters for children and they will love to ride on the horses. The Skyrider (zipline) and the Skycycle (biking on a cable across 200m of line) will provide the youngsters with some fun. Go for the combo Skyrider and Sckcyle @ 300p which saves you 50p if you go chose each adventure separately. We went fishing for Tilapia and Hito thereafter as we heard that the fishes just arrived yesterday. You have to buy what you catch (p210 per kilo) and either take it home have them cooked it. We chose to have our catch cooked there (not too bad for hungry stomachs). It was so easy to catch the fishes as that's what they want you to do. For those who wished to stay overnight, there are mountain villa, cottages and cabins at a price. There is a Vista restaurant which I cannot comment as I did not eat there. The cafe vista provides only snacks but best to bring your own. This place is good for family and friends. Strongly reccomended.
Place is great for group and adventures! We had soooo much fun from sky cycling, zip lines, riding horses, fishing, swimming, and the Tour...

This place is excellent for family adventures! We had soooo much fun from sky cycling, zip lines, riding horses, fishing, swimming, and not to mentioned the lunch buffet was the best served food for the entire family- it's worth the money!

Me and my wife have been to Eden a couple of years ago for a day tour. This time we decided to stay overnight together with our relatives visiting from abroad. Good that the Skycycle and Zipline was added to this place that our younger relatives we're able to enjoy their stay. For non-adventurous like us, we settle for the "Children's Zipline". There's also a Fishing Village but when we visited it, it was deserted and good for pictures only. A tip for management; when we visited another country, the village is complemented by a picnic ground where families grilled their catch with an in-house griller. With this approach, the picnic tables become full with so many tourists like us. With this approach, customers may come back again.   We took several Vista cottages. Cottage design is well-suited to it's environs, we loved the veranda. It's good that they well-maintained their bathroom facilities for it's foremost for us. The only drawback of the units are some lights are not operational, outdated wooden floors, and unfitted screen doors and windows for insect protection. For the shuttle tour, for us that have been there before, no excitement, it's the "same banana", only the dragon fruits are added into the landscape. We loved the buffet dinner served with generous refills (got several servings of fruits). Sorry for the free buffet breakfast; not a good combination.  Tip: If one's purpose is to do mountain-trekking, go elsewhere for when I check about it last quarter of last year, it's not operational until we came this month, it still was. Also, the swimming pool remains to be in maintenance, hopefully during your visit it becomes operational.   Tip for day tours: Arrange with your tour operator that you be allowed ample time to use some of the facilities unlike when we first visited, after lunch, the van driver already wants to go back to the city. Or better, rent a private vehicle so you can enjoy or better to stay overnight.

it's a typical family outdoor activity but it has a unique attraction called skycyle where you ride a bicycle on a zipline. its a unique experience where you can see davao city from above while riding a bicycle.

ReviewTitle: Fun place to be with especially if there are kids
Review: Lovely outing from Davao,with the beautiful flora and fauna around the place.The short tour around the whole place is great and the kids had a lot of fun.
A place that you have to visit once you are in Davao. A very nice tour with small train within the park. Friendly crew and guides. A good opportunity to learn more about local flora

We went here from Manila for a day tour just to experience the sky cycle. Commuting was difficult since you need to transfer from one mode of transportation to another. I suggest the park should provide shuttles to different point areas such as the airport and or city proper. The maps they provide are misleading! Beware. They should change it already as I've read the same thing in the earlier reviews. Beware also of tourist traps. Motorcycles/Tricycles outside the park will overcharge your ride if they know you're a tourist. You can ask assistance from the information area to call for a ride for you with the right price.

ReviewTitle: Nice place and model for conservation
Review: We like the athmosphere of the area. Maybe they can improved their food selection. Tour guide are knowledgeable about the tree scrubs that been in the area, the driver of our tour vehicle who took our pictures have good taste of selecting the background .

i have been taking tourists here for years and every year it becomes more and more expensive. still the location is great. there is a big variety of things to do and see. and if you are a vegetarian this is your place. they grow their own veggies there.

I went here with my mom and dad. We arrived at around 11:45 and was just in time for the buffet lunch. We availed the lunch and guided tour. The lunch was adequate and i think was worth its price since the salad served was fresh. There were multiple viands to choose from. Our tour was scheduled at 2pm, giving us time to enjoy our lunch and chitchat for awhile.  The tour around the park was informative. Our tour guide was funny and helpful. It lasted for about 45mins with ample stopovers to take pictures.   If you are travelling with your parents, take the tour. If with children, just stay in the playground or swimming pool and fishing village.

If you're into nature but still want to engages in some physical activities, well, this is the place to go!  It's a two way resort. The nature lover could go the right side and for those who love exciting activities you would be heading to the left side of the road. But first, you will need to pay the entrance fee, so one way or another you will still need to head at the right side of the road.  The Right Way! Feast your eyes with different kinds of flowers in their Flower Garden, wake your senses to the sweet aroma of different herbs and indulge yourself into the majestic view at the top. If you wanted to try fishing they also got this small pond for you, and if ever you got tired and wanted to reward yourself you can always have your fish cooked, of course you will be paying certain amount :). If you are into history, why not explore the cultures of the Southern Philippines, in here they have a place called Tinubdan where guest are given the privilege to take a glimpse of lumad life. And for those who want to take an adventure they have a Mountain Trail, which is a 4 hours hike.  Why Not Go Left? This side of the road is where you can have fun. I mean it! They have an obstacle course called Indiana Jones, where you can race with your friends. Also if wanna make it count, you can try their 200 meter long skyrider (zipline) and skycycle (bicycle riding in the air) while enjoying the view of Davao City and its Gulf. And if you are not into great excitement, you can engage into horse-back riding.  Access. *A day tour would only cost 200 pesos, where in a cab will take you to different parts of the resort, this also includes snacks serve after the tour (bet you will like their pasta!). *If you are into overnight staying they have cabins and lodges.  It is my first time to explore Davao, and this one makes it to my list.

Although far from the city center, I truly believed that this is one of Davao's best spot if you are into nature and he likes of flowers, fresh air and gardening. We only had a day our here which gave me a glimpse of both naturalistic and cultural aspects of the region. There is also a good buffet to top all of the the entire trip.  P.S - There is a fun sort of a ride, riding on a piece of tire that goes from one end to the other. Definitely will bring the youth in you. Also don't miss the creepy cave as you do on the tour.

It was our second visit to Eden park last Saturday. Compared to our visit in December 2011, the place has improved a bit, particularly the arrangement of the gardens. We got several gardening ideas during this visit and applied it once we got home.  The tour was short as usual, quite pricey if you come to think of it (almost Php 200/head) - and this is on top of the entrace fee that you paid for. The buffet was so-so, but definitely better than the snacks (don't even bother considering it). I also do not suggest that you bring your own food, unless you're here for overnight - bringing own food for cooking contradicts the idea of relaxation in this huge nature park.  Considering the distance from the city center, I don't suggest this to be a destination for overnight. It's great if you're a tourist who seldoms visit Davao but for the local folks, it's not really worth it in my opinion.  Make sure you check out all the places you can visit in this park. While the other spots don't have guides, it's fun to just walk around and check out their facilities. You might find something that tickles your interest like zip line, sky cycle, fishing, etc. Oh, don't forget to bring your selfie stick.

I love the scenery. If you came from the bustling city you will gonna love it. I love the flower garden. Although, I think it is a little overpriced. The tour costs 120 pesos per person and you will be toured in just 3 locations for less than an hour depends on how long you took pictures. And their buffet lunch is also overpriced. They have little food selections. I suggest to just take the plated snack and eat elsewhere. Though, their zip line and skycyle activity are cheaper than the other parks with same activities.

ReviewTitle: Our Silent Sanctuary.. A place where love and peace reigns
Review: 40 minute ride from Davao City. It's best to go there in the morning wherein you will have the best view of their Lola's garden. This is the first in our 3 day itinerary, went there on a habal-habal for experience.. One joyful ride as we could really feel the ambiance going up. Literally, you will smell pine trees all over. The guided tour has 3 stops for you to take pictures.. Entrance is affordable but you have to choose if you want snack or buffet lunch included on their package tour as it is required for you to avail of their guided shuttle tour and activities. The place is really big so we opted to have the shuttle. They do have accommodations as well if you want to spend a night or two. My partner got to experience their zipline and sky rider and it was worth it.. The fruits like mangosteen and dragon fruit is not in season so we didn't get the chance to see how it looked like because boy! They do have a lot of different plants and trees... Do not forget to taste the sorbetes outside as well upon exit .
It's a massive area full of walking path and the food like most Filipino food is great. You can spend an entire day here and just keep walking for hours.

Nice place, there are a lot of activities around the place. They have a mini bird and butterfly collections, wide forest, garden, and recreational activities like ziplines, sky cycling, and horse back riding. The food in the buffet was good too. Best enjoyed with your favorite group of people. :-)
Nothing much to do here, actually. But you can be one with nature. Pick a spot, sit down and just enjoy the serenity.

Eden is the best place to retreat to when you want to be out of the city without leaving the city itself. Their fresh garden salad is worth going back to as these are freshly harvested. Try out the new sky cycle and zipline for that adrenaline rush. You can also go on a road trip aboard their shuttle or do some trekking.

The Place was very serene and beauty at its best! If your a nature lover like me youll surely appreciate every details that they made in this mountain resort. The food in there restaurant was perfect they had all the foods so fresh because they do also have a vegetables farm inside.   Moreover, the resort caters different sports activities which is very nice. We availed for a tour for the whole are in which youll be riding a gulf car,What i like so much was when we passed by there garden area which was so amazing! they have different sets of flowers which was so wonderful. After that we passed by this herbal garden which i like since i love herbs so much.

ReviewTitle: Lunch with a view and MORE...
Review: Want to walk in the woods and fill your belly with good food? You choose which to do first, and then enjoy the day. My only regret is that we ran out od daylight. We should have left earlier, but there WILL be a "next time"! We visited on a Sunday and there were lots of people there. With plenty of area, and plenty of staff, there was enough to enjoy in every way.  We decided that, since it was lunchtime, and we were hungry, that we would go enjoy the buffet. There are two payment options at Eden for day visitors. for 200PhP, (about $5 USD) you pay an entrance fee and they also include light snacks. We opted for the more extravagant 520PhP which also included a sumptuous buffet. The food was good, and there is plenty of it. The offerings varied so that any tastebuds will be happy. There is even a table of fruits and melted chocolate pots to dip them. After we ate too much, wide walked around the grounds. There are lots of trails to wander and things to do. They even offer a fishing pond where you pay for the fish and they will charcoal cook them and serve with rice and other choices. Then, we got crazy and decided to try the "SkyCycles". They have mountain bikes that ride on a cable with extra cables for safety. Everybody has a harness tethered to a cable, and we saw how good it worked.  While we were waiting, one guy tried to peddle hard and left the wire with the wheels. He dangled for around twenty minutes while the crew got the necessary ropes and gear to "rescue" him. They were efficient and brought him back to the starting platform in one piece.

ReviewTitle: Lots of activities in the park,for all ages! Don't forget to try skycyle!
Review: This is a long trip from downtown Davao especially if you are commuting. If you are on a budget, you can still access the place but bear with the inconveniences. It would also be best if you know what to do in the park before going there to save time. Otherwise, you might miss the guided tour and end up not maximizing your travel time. In our case, our primary purpose is the guided tour and the skycycle.  Directions from downtown to the park: Take the jeepney going to Toril. Fare is 40php. Let the driver know that you are going to Eden Nature Park. He will drop you off in front of Mercury Drug store in Toril where habal habals and tricycles going to Eden are parked. Tricycle charged us 250php one-way for the entire trike. We thought it was a bit pricey but we had no choice, it was too hot at 10am so we opted for tricycle over habal habal. Going back, we took habal habal and the fare is only 50php. But I won't recommend it, it was way too hot I got sunburnt.  Guided Tour: We arrived just in time for the scheduled tour at 10:45am. Guided tour is 120php and time allotted is 1 hour. To be honest, I was not expecting anything from the tour but I ended up enjoying it. Lots of things to see around the park!  We also got the plated snack for 200php (pasta,bread, small cupcake and a glass of soda). We visited the fishing village for picture taking only but you can fish and you can have it/them cooked. There are cottages inside so you can have your lunch here.  Skycyle. The area for zipline and skycyle is outside the park. You will have to cross the other side of the street, outside the gate of the park. Skycycle is 200php but if you want to do skycycle and zipline, you are only charged 300php for both.   Am not gonna lie, skycycle is scary as hell! It's 60 feet high and going up is torture in itself especially for someone like me who has fear of heights. Once on top and you have mustered the courage to ride, remember that you will have to skycyle your way to the other station and back (roundtrip). I recommend you really do bike your way because if you get scared in the middle of the wire, you'll be stuck. It's worth a try! The more you pedal, the faster you'll get it done. We finished roundtrip in under 5 minutes. Don't look down, look at the grand view of downtown Davao instead! :D  Indiana Jones ride is also fun. There weren't many guests our age who visited the park that time so my friend and I monopolized the Indiana Jones ride. It was so fun we were screaming that mostly older guests had fun looking at us. (That or maybe they were annoyed we're being noisy. LOL)  Definitely worth the trip and skycycle is definitely the best experience!

Are you afraid of heights? Well, this might not be for you but if you are someone who's up for the challenge, be ready to face your fear and pedal your way through the sky in Eden Nature Park. - See more at: http://enjoyinglifetoitsfullest.blogspot.com/2014/08/davao-adventure-edens-skycycle.html
tranquil travels piece and quiet nice place to just get away from it all also have been to several weddings there beautiful setting

ReviewTitle: A great way to spend a day
Review: This resort caters for locals and foreigners alike. If you are happy to take a 45 minute drive from Davao City centre, you can take a day or half day trip without advance booking or you can book a cottage and stay for a weekend of fishing and swimming. I did a half day tour each time and I've been there 3 times over the last 12 years or so. The forest is beautiful but it is not "virgin", it is a reclaimed, deforested area which has been re-planted with a wide range of trees, many of which are unexpected in a tropical region. There is an open sided bus tour which takes you around the resort, through the forest and some spectacular gardens.  There is a restaurant which serves a reasonable cafeteria lunch. There is also a zip line ride and several relaxing areas. If you approach this resort as a place to chill out and relax, you will enjoy it and want to return.

You’ll love this place if you’re a nature lover who likes peace and quiet. My spouse and I spent our Valentine's Day at Eden Nature Park. We've been there a couple of times in the past but this was the first time we went there without the kids. We stayed overnight and rented the Vista Cottage 1. The rate was P3,220 which already included a Valentine dinner and breakfast. The Valentine dinner was far from romantic – way too many people and the tables were closely arranged it was really crowded. The acoustic band was okay but the singers did not even dress up for the occasion. Ahh, so much for my romantic dinner expectations, lol.  Anyway, here’s what I can say about the place:  The cottage/room:  The Vista cottage is awesome. You sleep to the relaxing sounds of crickets and river water running, and you wake up to the sound of birds chirping. So lovely. The room has no aircon unit (who needs one when it's really cold there!), it has firm beds (Vista 1 has twin bed), soft pillows and very clean, sweet smelling linen. It has a mini ref with two small bottles of complimentary water, an electric kettle with complimentary instant coffee and cream, and a small TV set (but lousy cable stations). It also has a wide dresser with equally wide mirror and a veranda overlooking the lush green trees. Vista 1 is situated on a hill and the veranda is really cozy. There is a sliding door that separates the room from the veranda. You may leave the door open at night without worrying about insects and mosquitoes because the veranda is fully screened. By the way, there's no wifi in the room, only in the reception lobby which I haven't tried it so I don't know if it works. Cellular phone signals are good, for Sun and Globe networks, that is.  The bathroom: It is very spacious and clean with hot (really hot!) and cold (really cold!) shower, clean and soft towels, toiletries that include rolls of toilet paper, dental kits, shampoo and soap.  There is no hair dryer but no big deal, really.  The food: Dinner was okay and buffet breakfast was nothing special (hey, no brewed coffee!). Expect fresh, organically grown veggies in the food menu. I'm sure you'll love their fresh lettuce, arugula and mizuna. You may have your meals sent to your room but make sure to order hours ahead.  The staff: I have only good words for the staff - from the booking staff, to the reception staff to the housekeeping and restaurant staff. They are all friendly and very courteous.  Eden is not easily accessible by public transportation. You may go there via private car, rented car or a taxi. They also have cottages and dormitories for big groups. The place is huge but you can explore it in one day. I suggest you join the day tour and be enthralled by the beautiful flower garden and amphitheater, the organic farm where they grow herbs and lettuce (mostly), the aviary (though small), the nicely designed swimming pool (very cold water, by the way), and the fishing village (catch a fish, pay and have it cooked). For additional fun, you can avail of their zip line ride, horseback riding or let the child in you enjoy the playground.   Overall, I find Eden Nature Park a very pleasant and relaxing place to stay. It’s not cheap, though. If they don’t say it’s free, then most likely, it’s not :)

We arrived a bit late in the morning and had to limit our time at this park. Took a riding tour over 60 of the 80 hectares. Good for photo ops. Missed the skycycle and fishing village. Will return soon to finish. Need a full day to enjoy.
You must try the sky cycle and zip line...its really an adventure. It was such an achievement. Very nice foods...fresh vegetables and fruits. A tour in the place is also very nice.
Just take a day tour and it'll be full packed. Take overnight and you'll get all what Eden can over. A very good place for family bonding.

Even if Eden Nature Park was 95% man-made, you can never take out the fact that it looks intricately designed with all the native flowers and plants growing around including all the herbs and rare plants. Our tour guide, Miss MC was really nice and accommodating and she really takes wonderful shots using our cameras! We had lunch also at the park and it was hearty and delicious! Money was really spent well for me personally!

The place is sprawling and conferences are held here. There are many sites with cottages, townhouses, all in a sylvan setting for rent. Take the open car tour, since it takes you around the many places on the sides of the mountain and the valleys. Really a great getaway place.

Loved the turon served as dessert during the buffet lunch! It was mouth watering! Loved the flowers in the first stop of the day tour, I could stay there for a whole afternoon just to adore the garden. The view was relaxing and the weather was cool!

It's a place to relax and enjoy nature - the variety of vibrantly colored birds, peacocks and peahens walking beside you and staying in your garden while you snooze in your cottage, garden of flowers, a botanical collection of rare plants, and sweet songs of cicada and crickets, dances of fireflies etc. etc.  If you want adventure - try the zip line and get a good view of the Davao gulf.

I really enjoyed my stay there. I commuted going. Easyto go to. Took a jeep for 20 pesos then I took a motorcycle heading to the place. They charged me 140 going up then 100 going down. May seem a bit expensive but it was worth the experience. It was a good 20 minute ride one way. I got there at 10:30am and I took the 1pm tour. The tour costs 120 pesos per head. While waiting, I availed of their lunch buffet that was 550 per head. It was very good. I enjoyed the food. Loved the pizzas and the fresh salads. Place is about 90% man-made as to make it more accommodating. But they kinda did a good job keeping nature really well. For solo travellers, this place is a must go to.

Eden is just the best place to relax and it is also an astounding tourist attraction. The guided shuttle tour (costing around or less than Php200) is a great way to know more about Eden and Davao's history. Solo tourists can surely be entertained since one can join with a bigger group.  Horseback riding, zip line and skycycle are also available if you want some adventure or just want to destress a bit.

Situated along the highland of Davao City, this attraction is not to be missed when traveling Davao. The cooler temperature is a quick sell, brought as well by lush vegetation and natural scenery. It does not only stop there, the outdoor activities you can do from the park is a must try.Whether you're into skycycling, ziplining, or the Indiana Jones gliding, this has so much to offer. You can also see their beautiful garden and the butterfly sanctuary. You should get there early to enjoy a full day of the Day Tour they offer. Nonetheless, you can also avail of their overnight packages from their log cabins and other accommodations.
This place is up on the mountain. Enjoyed riding around in the park seeing the beautiful flowers and wildlife. They have a restaurant there as well serving filipino foods that is decent also.

ReviewTitle: Eden Nature Park again and again!
Review: We never fail to bring our visitors to a day trip to Eden Nature Park. Apart from its cool temperature because it is more than 2000 ft above sea level, it is a serene and relaxing mountain resort. Try the Eden tour and be amazed...More
I miss nature. I miss nature at its origin. Here you can experience it. You can taste it. I toured around Davao City and I found it. Eden Nature Park! I love it.

Eden is quite a popular destination for tourists visiting in Davao City and it is no surprise as it is definitely a great place to go to when people want to get away from the hussle and bustle of the city. The room we stayed...More
After your daily tour in the city. This is a must visit place to unwine and relax, night view in the city. Serranade while eating dinner.

Went here in February 2014 with a party of 8 including young kiddos. The entire experience was great. Kiddos loved the pool. Food was just fine. The outdoor options for hiking etc are easily accessible.

If you are in need to beat the heat and get some fresh air away from the bustling city, Eden is a good day trip to get away. We enjoyed a full afternoon of walking around the grounds and watching the birds on display. It...More
If you want a breath of fresh air, this is a place to go to. Very green, and for nature lovers and vegetarians. There are more things to do here... Prepare yourself to be awed.

ReviewTitle: Great place for the whole family
Review: Beautiful view, nice cottages with a fairly large area for different activities like fishing, hiking, horseback riding, picnics. Nice place for the whole family.

A day of Eden -- true to its name --can beat your stresses away! My family always goes to this awesome 80-hectare resort for a holiday but its magic never wanes. I took friends from different places for a day tour and they were smitten!...More

The garden is, for me, not so much special. Because and but it called my childhood with all kinds of plants which I have experienced in my childhood but I didn't appreciate them or hadn't aware of theirs importances. Like purslane (olasiman), kulitis, ... Maybe one day, we can buy luxury stuffs anywhere, but those plants aren't easy to find. Just a little bit pity in my heart.  The birds and animals are nice. Include heron and peacock. I saw a peacock was walking around and I said: you even are more beautiful than me. I saw the animals in cages and thought: "It looks like you are in "prison". But I am actually also in a prison. It's just my prison is bigger than yours. Because I can't be with you".  Then I think life is just needed to be like that. Living in nature. Self provide organic products. Peaceful and stress-free.  I ate a pomelo at a fruit vendor outside, just p10 per kilo.  The horseback riding, skyrider, skycycle fulfilled my wishes. With a little nervous, worry, but the feeling was GREAT. The staffs there helped me and other riders take pictures and return the phones by dropping in a bag, so no one need to walk upstair to take the phone.  NOTICE that the horseback riding, skyriding area just operate on 1-4pm in a separate place. So if you don't wish to pay entrance fee (with food), you can go there directly on the afternoon.
Lovely place to relax and get close to nature. Well worth a few hours of your time. If you can brave heights the sky cycle seems fun. Not for me though.

Before I start, I'm just going to say, skip the plated snacks.  Reasonably nice place, the only thing I would say you should definitely do is the SkyCycle - an eye-opening experience, not for the faint hearted! Bring a GoPro, or leave your camera with the staff to take a photo for you.  Head on down to the fishing pond to catch your own lunch. Those looking for an authentic experience will be disappointed though - the staff helps you with the bait and all you have to do is be patient to catch your fish. Our catch of 4 tilapia of around 1.5kg cost us about 700php (with drinks and rice).  Some people complain online   Overall good for city dwellers - the 2-way ride will cost you about 2,000php though!

climate is like tagaytay but the nature is supurb! Too bad sky cycling is under maintenance so I suggest you call them first before you go to make sure the attraction you want to do is available. As an alternative, we did horseback riding. The alternative experience is very good specially since their horse track is big and with obstacle. You can really feel how it is to ride a horse.

Eden is up in the mountains and is quite a long drive from Davao City, but it is worth a visit. Just don't expect too much and you will enjoy. We went sky cycling which was fabulous and so different - who would think riding a cycle on a tightrope would ever be available to the general public! Some of the family went zip-lining (flying fox) and my niece went horse riding. Horse riding is not like other places I have visited as only one horse and a guide sits with you. I think this could be improved. Also a warning, these activities are an additional charge. There were some free small zip lines here which were fun for all. On to lunch - this was excellent. Soup, mains and dessert. Unlimited drinks. The service here was great and the staff did a great job. We then did the tour of this 80 hectare property which in all honesty is a marketing tool for their accommodation. Our guide however was excellent and informative.

ReviewTitle: NIce place to get out of Davao for the day
Review: I was looking for a place to go zip lining - started to one place but cab driver suggested this one. Glad I took his advice, did some sky biking - riding a bike 20 meters in the air on a wire and some zip lining. Don't think I would spend an over night, but well worth day trip

the area is so big but is also lacking in some amenities, example is a play area for kids.  i can say that it is also underdeveloped. there is so much more to improve to make this place enjoyable for the whole family, like say, a teenager would enjoy and not get bored or even the small ones.

ReviewTitle: Reconnect with nature at Eden Nature Park
Review: Great place to get away from hot steamy Davao and enjoy the cool nature park at 2000 ft above sea level. Nice affordable buffet with lots of variety. Tour of the nature park via guided tram cars and photo ops along the way.

ReviewTitle: You'd Like This to Be Your Garden
Review: Very homy, very cozy, very fresh!  The greens are very well kept, and it is very clean. Staying here is an ouch to the pocket, but touring here is a great way to see the green side of Davao City. It is very simple in architecture yet very fresh and one with nature.

My family and I went for a day trip after visiting the Phil Eagle. You pay for the entrance with "free food and drink". You pay for a tour, you pay for every single activity that they offer. They even make you pay for the fish you catch in the fishing area - which was loaded whith huge tilapias. WARNING: be prepared to pay for every movement just to enjoy the place. May not be worth the hour trip outside if Davao City, considering you paid for the van/taxi as well.
Good for nature lovers, to relax, have fun with friends.. One of the best places i would come back to relax and find peace..

I am happy to visit the place...so refreshing and envigorating. It reminds me of the gardens of Christchurch, NZ and of Jeju, Korea. I guess i prefer the place more than Baguio, Sagada, Banawe and Tagaytay where the views are obstructed by the metal roofs...More

ReviewTitle: Eden: An Expensive Paradise, Debil Toril Driver
Review: Eden Nature Park is a vast, 80 hectare mountain resort located some 3,000 ft above sea level in Toril Davao City. Log cabins and terraces were carved out of mountain slopes where thousands of pine trees provide a refreshing backdrop. Eden is home to vast...More

We only stopped here briefly as part of a longer tour, but it was definitely a highlight. Cool air and areas of carefully-tended gardens mixed in with the wild landscape make this a place I could enjoy all day. Great swimming pool and avaiary.

ReviewTitle: Cool Place, A pride in Davao
Review: Went here with my family. The place offers great views of the nature. It was cool and i love the vast garden of greenery, trees and flowers. definitely a must-see when in Davao. Would love to try their buffet lunch but wasn't able because we...More

ReviewTitle: I want to visit Eden again
Review: My friends and I were treated to this trip to Eden by my cousin, auntie and uncle who live in Davao. We planned to go fishing and have our catch cooked for lunch but it rained so we changed our plans and instead went on...More

ReviewTitle: good for a day or an overnight stay.
Review: very far from the city proper,I recommend bring a private or hired vehicle..be early to enjoy the rides & avail of the resorts' guided tour,,variety of activities horseback riding,bike on a zip line,hiking or just enjoy nature at its best,tip: be ready with your cams...More

ReviewTitle: Feel the forest with some comforts
Review: It is a private nature reserve owned by the Ayalas if I understood the tour guide correctly. The property was bought from a logging area so the beauty you will see before you is landscaped. Some species of trees like the pines were brought in...More

The 80 hectare area will bring you back into the nature if you are tired of living or pressured with the busy life in the city. then it is a perfect place to relax, recharge and let time pass by. The sky cycle adventure and...More

Our original plan we will stay there whole day,but our time is loaded so we take our lunch and a tour to the place.The food is so good specially the salad,it is so fresh that we come back to the salad station often.The food choice...More

I am a local who wish i can come back more often. It is because of a number of good reasons- the food, the cool fresh air, and the scenery. Although the last time we were there, plenty of trees were cut. Needs a good maintenance though.

ReviewTitle: Get away from stress and Commune with Nature
Review: I totally enjoyed my stay at Eden Nature Resort. Checking in was easy and fast and service was friendly. The food was excellent and organically grown. Facilities were very clean although the lamp shade in my room had a busted bulb. My room had a rustic feel to it that added to the sense of being in the countryside away from the noise, stress and smog of city life. I left Eden Nature Park feeling healthier and well rested. I will definitely want to stay again there. Just have to save up for it and hope that they again make available the room rate promos more often.....

I liked the peace and quiet of the place. For some people, the place can be quite cold. But for me, it's just right. A walk around the entire park is thoroughly recommended as it does calm you down after a hectic ride around the city.

I was invited by a friend to Eden without knowing how massive the property is. Upon arrival, one can do photography of interesting larger than life sculptures. The restaurant setting overlooks a playground that overlooks some wildlife grazing on the grounds. The guided tour completes the experience, making one want to actually stay overnight. The Rainbow area (a stop) is excellent for photography because of the vines hanging on the trelisses around. The native hut with a carabao is also a photography highlight..
if you're a vegetarian, you'd love this paradise. Take a tour and see nature's beauty :-) Though the walk is a little lengthy, it's completely worth it
Food was not so good. From the day we started this tour i got interested in organic fruits and veggies. Got to see the mickey mouse plant and got to try a very small berry. I forgot it na.

ReviewTitle: Perfect place for keep in touch with nature
Review: Perfect place to visit and reconnect with nature. The food was perfect, although I'm not a fan of veggies, but they make their veggies that you will really like and want more of it. The food tastes really good. They do not have air condition for the rooms even with the hot tropical weather. because its naturally cool. The place was so big, it will be hard to traverse from one point to another you have to call for the lift. The place was far from the heart of the city. Transportation is quite hard if you rely on public transport, although they have a vehicle that will cater your needs if you want.

Just got home from Eden. We had a blast! They are too far away but the place is perfect for relaxation. My family had fun! The attendants are very polite- people from every place! Especially the front office ladies. The room is bigger than I thought, it's very clean and they have hot and cold shower, ref and TV. We enjoyed the Indiana Jones, and other rides. They also offer free buffet breakfast during our stay. Thumbs up!
The food was delicious as well as the place. The place have a replica of those houses of the early people. Like the Babaylan's house.

Nice place to run from the heat and spend some time with the family. Take a jeepney ride across the park and get acquainted with the tribes that used to live here. Do some fishing in the pond, but what you catch you have to take home.

Eden Nature park is outside the city of Davao. So plan a whole day for it. The resort has beautiful gardens, the trees are named, so I know now whats a Mangotree and whats a Mangosteentree. Lots to do in the resort, like a fishing village, where you can catch your own fish and cook it afterwards. But the really exciting thing to do is the mountain trail. Be prepared: good shoes, long trousers, long sleeves. This trail takes you for 4 hours through the jungle (4km), you always mind your steps not stepping on a snake, or meet behind the leaves a big spider. It was my adventure in Mindanao. Not really scarry, it is watched.  Snacks are not recommended, pay for the menu.

This place was amazed me the most, very beautiful, natural and there's a lot of outdoor activities makes you fun. What I love the most is, during the day tour you are not only having fun but you will learn for something about the history of eden . I'ts very good for family and friends bonding especially to the children. You will never regret to go this place.At the cost of 500 plus per head you can eat and drink unlimited during lunch.

ReviewTitle: Love the idea of little paradise
Review: I love the the effort put into the place. The place used to be barren of trees. Today it is filled with pine trees, indigenous fruit bearing trees, bamboos, an herbal garden, flowers..... Love it!!

ReviewTitle: Nature makes me feel real good :)
Review: I can say that when you are in Davao a visit to the Eden Nature Park is a must. Not only is it a sanctuary of garden trees, flowers, herbs and organic vegetables it also features the diversity of cultures of the indigenous people of Mindanao. Experience adventure as you trek the mountain trail, rope gliding in Indiana Jones and zipped in at Sky Rider and a lot more. Nature makes me feel real good.

Eden has so many things you can do for every age group in the family so you will not have to worry about a family member to get bored. There is so much to see, so much to do you really need to stay overnight to enjoy it all. The kids especially loved the Indiana Jones ride, I am sure my husband and I really enjoyed the vast greeneries and just fresh air everywhere.
Had a day to tour this place. We enjoyed the buffet, the Indiana Jones ride and the view. Definitely stunning! Food is great! This is a good venue for family getaway. Too bad it is far from Manila.

I thought that this resort would be moving towards one of Davao's major destinations as I felt then that this was destined to attract horde of tourists. My last visit with my wife a couple of days ago turned out to be a disappointment as the place has shown significant deterioration. I observed that only the beddings were changed and toiletries provided. However, the veranda that should be the cottage's big feature was not cleared of a lot of dead insects and poo most likely from lizards. These dung were also spread on the table inside. When I gave the feedback to the gal at the check out counter, she only said that the rooms are usually cleaned up before they take in guests. I hope she would follow through with what she said that she will let the management know about it. Services at the dining hall were fine. I even got 2 cups of brewed coffe. I suggest that would be guests request that their rooms be really clean.
This is a nice place to just get away from the city and all the noise. They do not really have a lot of things to do, But they do have trails you can walk on and it is clean and quiet.
We enjoyed our visit as we are nature lovers.. My daughter loves the kids' zipline and the surrounding view:)

ReviewTitle: More than your average Nature Park
Review: Eden Nature Park resort is an icon when you visit Davao City. It has been a tourist attraction for quite a while and for me it is the best place to unwind and appreciate nature. Even though there are a number of nature parks that you can find in Davao City since its a "green city", you need to visit Eden for a number of reasons; 1. nature in its beauty - the area is wonderfully located in the mountainous region of the city and the weather is cold and even foggy at times.  2. food - at affordable prices, you can taste their buffer that are organically grown. The salad is one of my favorites. 3. cleanliness - the area is well-maintained. The area is clean and garbage bins are properly disposed of. 4. staff - the staff are courteous and honest. I left my jacket in the restaurant area and it took me an hour after to get it (because of the tour) and they gladly returned it to me with a smile. 5. the rooms - there are a variety of rooms to choose from both for the budget-conscious and the extravagant.  6. activities - there will never be a dull moment in your stay there. there are a hefty number of activities you could choose from (free or with a fee).    tip: better stay at this park in just a day or two to fully appreciate the amenities. If it's expensive for you, just book a room on their off-peak (june to august). They offer at 50% discounts. You'll never regret your stay if you want to relax and enjoy nature at its best.

After arriving at Eden Nature Park, we have to wait an hour for the mini shuttle that will tour us around but the peacocks walking around the reception area made it worth wile. Make sure that your camera or camera phone is fully charged when you go here. There are so many interesting things to see in this big park. Also a great view of the Davao Gulf gardens.
Eden Nature Park has something for everyone. Great view of the Davao gulf Gardens and greens Playground Swimming pool Good buffet

ReviewTitle: Nice place, but not for the lunch
Review: If you wanders through the park (good 2 hours) you will already gets hunger and thirst. Unfortunately, the staff needs extremely long something to bring drinks to the (dirty) table. In the admission fee you have to pay for the meal. This is however for us European a disaster. I was now already three times with visitors from Europe there and we get at last time Spagetti with sugar or sweet chicken small sausages in a sweet roll.  The good mixed salad from own cultivation helps only limited. For the nutritious and healthy salad you have to pay extra.

Grounds are not so well maintained, considering it was a slow day with only few guests. Trash can in front of our cottage was up turned with trash spilling unto the ground, when we went for breakfast, another trashcan was upturned and a peacock was scavenging thru the spilled rubbish. Water heater for coffee in our room was unclean, with noodles inside, remnants of the previous guest. Very noisy neighbors became our alarm clock at 530am, had to call front office to quiet them down. I will have serious second thoughts of returning, much more recommending this place.

This was our 2nd stop and I regret not to see the whole place (due to time constraint) If you were to see this place, you should allot one day to enjoy these. Anyways, me and my friends try their newest attraction, The Skycycle! I was terrified! REALLY! I was a bit shaky and really afraid since it was windy and it was almost on top of a hill. A must-try, once-in-a-lifetime experience!! :)

ReviewTitle: Very cozy, ecological and everybody made happy.
Review: Very good and very nice nature park with their plants and trees,with the fishfond to catch fish and grill it.

ReviewTitle: Reminds me of The Manor in Baguio
Review: It's a large area good for outdoor loving people. You'll get to enjoy the greenery and their flower garden, as well as an interesting playground for the kids. There's a mini-zipline too and some obstacle courses for team bonding. Food is pricey and not that good. There are wandering animals around certain areas you get to watch. Overall, a pleasant experience but not a must-see in Davao. Go here to relax and chill away from the city.

ReviewTitle: Nice: some really good, some dated
Review: Had a pleasant day at Eden. It was probably THE place to go 20 years ago, but the format is a little dated now. It's a nice day with the family and they have plenty to do. Perhaps not the best thing for just adults. Pluses: cabanas to eat fish you catch and they cook, Sky Biking (scary but fun!), Zip lining. Not so great: tram tour of park: a little boring and formulaic but the grounds are nicely maintained and the flaura and fauna is nice. It's a nice day though overall.

My almost three-year hiatus in Davao City wouldn't be complete without this long-delayed travelogue to Eden Nature Park. Kadayawan festivities during the month of August, is a unique home-grown event among Davaoenos that continues to attract both local and foreign interests. Throwback 2013. I had the pleasure of celebrating this month-long merriment of abundance and harvest with some good 'ole friends from the past.  The friendly commute means of Davao to Toril would take you high above the city heights towards a hill where there are beautiful sceneries wherein you can unwind, relax, play and reflect. Eden Nature Park, for me is such a classy, underrated yet comparable to all other famous parks of the world. It should be there in anyone's itinerary when in Davao!  And what's even more facininating about the park is that, it is 95% man-made, and continues to be a major haul of the region's premiere crops like pomelos, mangosteen and the "drurian" of various kinds. Whatever entertainment you have in mind, be it a wedding, a reunion, an outdoor overload, or a simply a full-day of environmental tour, Eden can literally transform your stay to something paradise. And that's a promise! ;-)

ReviewTitle: Skycycle was exciting although the wait in line was tremendous!
Review: We waited for like more than 2 hours to be accommodated. It was awful and the experience was only brief but the price was pretty reasonable. It was only for Php 200 and you can experience the newest adventure in town. Overall, we had fun! The kids enjoyed horseback riding, the aviary, and the playground. Love their buffet lunch as well! My family had a great time! Thanks Eden!

The park is sprawling and is well maintained. My group came to visit for the afternoon. We took the tour van and was guided by a well-informed lady. The tour ends with a merienda that is packaged with it.  Fresh clean air is most enjoyable at the park, where a wide variety of flowers and fruit trees are planted, along with vegetables and herbs. Macadamia trees abound too. Large stands of pine trees spread across the park provide an invigorating scent of pine, which travellers won't experience anymore in most places in Baguio. A butterfly farm and museum is accessible near the main entrance.   Hiking trails along forested areas were pointed out during the tour. These are ideal for guests who stay several days in accomodation facilities. At various spots, there are replicas of tribal houses. In one village, a short cultural show was performed.  Capturing the beauty of nature in this park, for the appreciation of a greater number of people, is one legacy of Eden's founder Mrs Fe Ayala whose vision is hopefully pursued with continuing determination by those who have stepped into her big shoes.  A holiday trip in Davao is enriched with a tour of Eden.
Spectacular views and wonderful wildlife, can get busy at the weekends. About an hour outside of Davao but worth the drive.

I was expecting more from all the hype but it was more a park and you will just go around and enjoy nature. But not that spectacular. We paid Php 520 for buffet that was unsatisfying too, maybe because there were a lot of doctors having their convention but they should have anticipated this! I had to go back four times just get food. In the end, I felt I didn't get my money's worth. My advise, book a guided tour if you want one but the tour was boring for me, not worth the one hour travel to get there. The fishing village is just to let the kids try out fishing because you are really fishing in a fish pond full of fishes! You pay entrance, pay for the overpriced fishes that you catch.

A rare resort that has a hiking trail that is safe. We only hiked the portion up to the hanging bridge but we got to pass by a brook, a bamboo grove and of course the hanging bridge. Pretty and refreshing sight and sounds. Eden is just about an hour's drive from the city center so the hiking trail is accessible to those who want to go on a hike at the spur of the moment. It is also safe and well-maintained.
Nice weather, helpful staff! Food is okay, but not that bad. The day tour is well worth it! We had a lot of photos taken with the beautiful scenery as the background!

Went here with my friends, because I really like to try their sky cycle. Php 300 (sky cycle and sky rider)  Sky cycle, riding a bicycle in the air! woohoo. I think I left my heart there haha. :))  Sky rider, it is like zipline, however you are sitting. :)  One of a kind experience! :)  The only thing is, it is soooo far from the city, around 30mins taxi ride and it will cost you around Php 400. :)

Eden Nature Park is located quite a distance from Davao, but worth the trip. It is a nice and relaxing place to walk around, but the trail is not marked very good so it is difficult to follow. They really need more signs with directions. There is a nice play area for kids and a lot of beautiful plants. Food and service is good. On the other side of the road they have a zip line and sky cycle. Both are well maintained and staffed with good attendants. The rides are fun and worth the price of P300 for both.
I was here several times before and it seems more interesting then. It didn't have the same charm as before. The place looks ill-maintained now. Sad.

Going to the park is quite far with slope roads so it's best to travel there with your own car. Got fruit stands along the way but a bit pricey. Weather is very nice considering that you're in the peak. The attractions were not really spectacular but the place is relaxing and a great place to escape from the city. I also find it's a good place for weddings and retreats. We came here for the horse riding for the kids and sky cycle for the adults. Sky Cycle was an extreme ride of our lives, indeed memorable! My 9-yr old daughter was scared and backed-out. Very scary, spine-chilling, and hair-raising experience.

ReviewTitle: Hiking (then Pigging Out at the buffet)
Review: We did their 4km hike trail and it was a blast! Small waterfall, creek, mountain, glimpse of the farm...it's really a place away from bustle of the city. Only, the trail is cut around Lola's Garden and you start using the road. By then we were famished so we didn't mind. When we hit the buffet, wow! Salad so fresh you cut it yourself from the soil/pot and you pick from five dressings. Beef rendang was the best beef dish we've had--extremely tender. Mushroom soup was from fresh mushrooms. All the food was delicious except for the roast pork and the dessert which were just okay. All in all, well worth a visit!

I was told most of the employers are locals, who build this impressive place and maintain it perfectly. It deserves its name. Nice tour and a good and helpfull guide. Great food. Including the transport to the place it was all in all an expensive day, but i definately had a good time.

The park offers visitors a lot of experiences such as a guided shuttle tour of the park that is scenic and educational. Skyride, horseback riding, biking, nature walks and swimming. One can stay overnight Lunch buffet is good. Weather is cool and pleasant. Very enjoyable.

breezy and very close to nature. sight of the colors of the floras are breath taking. activities are very varied. the ride up to eden nature park is a great find. they cater to sight seeing tourists to adventure seeking tourists.

We visited this park for a short time, but was it worth it. I don't know. The aviary was sad, the cages for the birds way to small. We had no idea where we were going and map was useless. Maybe if had more time we could enjoy it more.

I liked the view and the winding drive among the trees and shrubs. The guide was very pleasant. Their crowd management was good. There was a short well choreographed dance by young children of the Tinubdan tribe, who used to inhabit the place. Instead of the buffet, we opted to catch fish at the fishing village. They cooked our catch three ways: fried, grilled and steamed in banana leaves. We enjoyed the food! What I didn't like - They take you on a tour of the estate in a small open bus. The leg room was tight and the seats were maybe about 8" wide. The pavilion had a rainbow made of tin, which I found tacky and detracted from the beauty of the view. The flower garden needs more plants. Although the bathrooms did not smell, they need maintenance.

It was down time, so we had a day to ourselves for some sight seeing, and our host brought us here. Very nice place, about an hour away from the city center.  We had a lunch buffet there, the food choice was limited but very filling and delicious.  We took the guided tour of the place, and the information we had proved to be very interesting. I was thinking that if a Zombie apocalypse does happen, I'll find my way to Davao and live out the rest of my days there, as the place is self sustaining with plants and animals to make sure I'll never be hungry.  If you're in Davao, go to this place.

Great option to relax, commune with nature, and engage in outdoor activities. It's quite far from the city proper but it is worth the long drive. I have not stayed overnight in the place yet so there's nothing I can say about the rooms.   The tour is nice, the organic products are great especially the tomatoes! I can't wait for my next trip to Eden - paradise on earth!

It was OK... Nothing really special, Eden Nature Park is an open park that allows people to escape from the big city. The aviary should be expanded though. Nothing as awful as the Crocodile Park aviary, but still not big enough.

We visited and stayed overnight at one of the cabins. It was a spacious two bedroom house, large kitchen and living room. The restaurant food was excellent, freshly picked fruits and vegetables all grown at Lola's garden inside the park. Instead of taking the tour, we hiked the mountain trail and did the tour ourselves. Thereafter we enjoyed the pool and just gazed at the view looking down on Davao city and the bay. Butterfly garden, and the bird sanctuary was entertaining as well. Great for kids.

I had the chance to visit this place after our seminar which was held in Davao. when we arrived at the place, my other friends who went ahead of us had already started the tour. and we were informed that the next tour will be in an hour. for us to catch up with them ( and to avoid also being late for our flight back to manila )we have to pay for the special tour. the tour guide with us was very informative. the tour was wonderful and the place was awesome. every stop over for picture taking was just amazing and truly a wonderful experience.the water well with gumamela flowers in it was so perfect for taking picture and making it your profile pic.for people who are nature lovers, try to visit this place. it's worth it!!

ReviewTitle: Relaxing, a highly recommended place to visit
Review: Visted Eden Park last August during the kadayawan festival, though it was a rainy day when i came to visit the place but Eden natures park didnt fail to give us happiness and relaxation.  Take a tour and youll be able to see the beauty of nature, learn some of Davaos local culture (though i didnt learn anything because i didnt listen to our tour guide because most of the expalining was done by a recorded voice which shell just play and pause in each location/stop) but nonetheless it was a very nice experience.   After touring the park you might also be interested in fishing and if you still have a lot of time and budget to spend you may also do the skycycling which is also very interesting and fun.

The fee to this place is relatively cheap since it already includes the mini open bus that will take you around, a guide, and a buffet lunch (with lots of local fruits like mangoes, papaya, melon, pineapple, tc.) I had to pay $9 in Portland for the Japanese garden nary a single bite or drink to quench one's thirst. The weather was perfect with a slight drizzle making it feel like you are in an airconditioned world. Part of the place has been planted to the now cancer treating fruits, the mangosteen. Travelers love the place for it is one of the first " developed" mountains that has been converted to a beautiful tourist spot. I visited the place with 9 other giggly principals who are extremely inspired by the beauty and serenity of a man's vision to share his wealth and his love for nature. It took ten years (and lots of money and precious time) to conquer and preserve the gigantic mountain. Tiny falls and pools of fresh water still provide the much needed water for the vegetation.   Be very early when going there for it is usually full of admirers/adventurers. The line for the mini bus is long but while waiting you can go around and visit the gardens and other nearby beautiful places. They can give you a tentative hour to come back since they have everything grouped and timed. We should have stayed the whole day..unfortunately my friends wanted to go to the market to buy mangosteens, chocolate A and cashews. This whole trip would not be complete without ordering the colorful " malongs" which we bought by the triple of dozens in preparation for our cultural competitions! The overweight baggage? That's a different story altogether.

1 1/2 days will do at this place (one overnight). Things to do:  - fish at the fishing village and they'll cook your catch for you. Turns out cheaper than eating at the restaurant. Do this for at least 1 lunch. - always some good food at the restaurant buffet. It does constitute a "hidden cost" of P350 per person (given that you probably won't be able to find food anywhere else near unless you live in a cottage and you brought your own) - the mountain trail isn't picturesque but is interesting nonetheless. Hanging bridge at 250 m, Vanilla loop at 1.6 km and Lola's garden at 2.8 km make it worth the 4 km trek. Bring water and find a good walking stick along the way, especially if it had rained the previous day. - zip line has a great view of Davao Gulf. Do the cycle zip if you want a really good view because you can control how fast you go. Lola's Garden has another good view and few people go there so it's quiet (problem is, you'll end up walking a distance back to where you came from because I didn't see any phones or attendants in the area) - butterfly garden, aviary, and playground good place to bring kids - breathe in fresh mountain air. No aircon needed at night. (this was January though) but can get hot during the day  It's more than an hour from downtown. It's an uphill ride so the vehicle won't get past 2nd gear. The trip downhill is faster. 1 hour straight to the airport, (You can stop over at the Japanese Tunnel on the way to the airport) The staff were helpful. Just don't email them. They don't reply or reply late.

We visited for the zip-line. It was pretty short, but fun nonetheless. Like many Philippine inland resorts, it leaves a lot to be desired. Do a quick visit for the zip-line, walk the garden / zoo and head out as customer service is weak.

ReviewTitle: A beautiful Garden ,Nature park complex at about 700 MASL
Review: Spent 2 nights there at an Aster room. The Aster rooms are without other facilities than 2 beds ,lights and an electric fan. Pillow hard as a baseball bat, rooms in need of a renovation and so are the common toilets. Showers ok. The cottages and other overnight facilities maybe better but would not know, although they seem popular with families and groups.  Beautiful surroundings with a nature trail where you pass through rainforest and the various parts of the park. A couple of big trees had tumbled down and damaged part of the trail but with some effort and crawling you will get through. This is being fixed. The park is Overlooking Davao from abt 700 Meter Above Sea Level. Cool and fresh with forest of pinetrees, well kept good birdpark and butterfly park area. There were few visitors during the weekdays I was there so the personnel gave good briefings on what they had of insects,birds etc. Enjoyable and educational. Food.  They have in addition to the flower parks also extensive salad/vegetable growing areas and their food and especially the salads were superb. Overall I enjoyed my stay ande it is well worth a trip.

It was my second time to be here and I'm always get fascinated on how the owners and staff maintain a nature park like this. The park has lots to offer ranging from tours, adventure activities (zip line), and even accommodations. The tour will educate you on different things and culture.   Going to the park is not a problem if you're commuting since there are habal-habal along the highway. Don't forget to negotiate on the rates :D  Tip: Please be there as early as possible to get a good time slot (for the tour). Expect a lot of people visiting the park.

Great place to escape from the heat down below I walked the mountain trail, a beautiful hike along the stream and through the forest, about 4 km, well marked, totally recommended Entrance fee was 200 p and included a light lunch There was also the option for an all-u-can-eat buffet, at 530 p (with entrance ticket included) I visited on a weekday and hardly anybody there, just the way i like it...probably busy in the weekends though
if your're a nature-friendly person, you'll love it here. The park is so huge that they offer shuttle-tour for the whole area to cover although we prefer walking. I had a blast in this park.

A must visit for the nature lovers! Especially those who are in love in flowers. Every visitor would have the opportunity to appreciate the beauty of the different types of flowers in this park.   The 200 entrance per head)inclusive of a plated snack) is affordable enough. The tour is educational and interesting. Would go back here to try the skycycling!

ReviewTitle: Good place to visit for the day
Review: Nice place to relax & see the nature. Quiet, peaceful & lots of things to do if you deceived to stay a night or two.

This is a nice place for nature lovers. It has good views, a fishing pond limited food service and cabins for rent. There is also an assortment of caged birds and a place for family events. It is an hour or more from Davao

Fresh Air, Fresh food, this are the best thing you can do in Eden. If you want to be refreshed and do some recreation Eden is a great place to Visit. I do enjoy walking in the trail but tours are also available through vans....More

This was our first itinerary for our day tour around the city of Davao. Eden nature Park n Resort owned by the Ayalas in Davao occupies more than 80 hectares of land. The trip around the park starts at 9am riding a big golf cart....More
U will enter a natural paradise how different flowers and the way of life from back in the day. The trees, flowers, and hiking trails are interesting.

Must place to visit whenever in Davao. Best if spent a day or two. Boulder trekking is fun, as well as thier SkyRider Zipline and SkyCycle. Something one must not miss. The buffet is delectable! Worth your money..

ReviewTitle: Good day out with the family
Review: Great place for the day, nature and views at its best, they have a fishing lake where they cook the fish that you catch which was fun for the kids , horse back riding, nature learning tour etc etc highly recommend

It's in a mountain setting since it's a lot further above sea level than the rest of Davao. You can see wild peacocks everywhere, pine trees and there is a deer enclosure and a place where you can fish for your own food. I definitely...More
I almost felt that I am in Baguio. We had a great experience. You must see this although the travel is far and high.

We visited on a weekday on August 2013. Its just 45 mins. to 1 hr. nice and cool drive from the ciy proper. The park has aviary, cold spring pool, rooms for accommodation, restaurant overlooking the mountains, butterfly garden, nice gardens, mangosteen trees, Durian trees,...More

The price of the tour was fair at 120 each but what was annoying was that every guest was required to avail of a meal-either the 200 peso plated snack or the 520 lunch buffer. We opted for the former and it was good but...More

ReviewTitle: Nice Cool Respite on the way to Mt. Apo
Review: Had a wonderful lunch with family friends at this scenic location. An easy 1 hour drive from Davao City. The weather is nice and cool, a refreshing respite from the humidity in the city below. The surroundings and pine trees are inviting and there's lots to do for all ages--from hiking, to zip lines, to horseback riding, etc. Wonderful for kids and adults of all ages.

Eden Nature Park offers vacationers a taste of little Baguio (the famous city, North of the Philippines) for its cool climate and lots of pine trees. The park also offers guesthouses where visitors can enjoy nature, fresh from the garden vegetables, cook/ bring in their own meals, s stroll inside the man-made forest, vast garden, outdoor activities like hiking within the forest, zip line, horse-back riding, among others. It's a nice place for a family to enjoy their vacation. The rate is affordable and varies from the sizes of the guesthouses, the food is superb, enjoyable climate. It is a must see visit for those who love nature, away from the hustle and bustle of the city.

ReviewTitle: Just what I had dreamed of...
Review: Definitely worth the travel here and the fees. Back to nature, well organized, good times for friends and family. I would highly recommend a visit here.

location wise, this is very far from the city proper. much easier if you have a car or service but if you don't have any, you may take a couple transfer of rides depending where you're from. we were here for a day tour. you can check this link for the rates (http://edennaturepark.com.ph/main/packages/day-packages/). you may want to bring a jacket with you if you're not used to cold weather as it gets really cold here. you can enjoy a lot of nice views. the pool is freezing cold. you can also enjoy fishing and butterfly watching.
Paradise on earth. A tour within the complex can be scheduled for the day. Photograph wildlife, including the beautiful peacocks.

Talking about food at Eden Nature Park, I must say its superb! I love their caesar's salad fresh from their garden. The dessert were all so yummy.  Of course, nature lover as I am I always have the feeling of comfort, ease and relief with the green sorroundings and mountain breeze. And the flowers, the butterflies made me feel relax.  Their newest attraction, SKYCYCLE is a must try. Never leave Eden Nature Park without trying this one. I have tried extreme rides and this one is unforgettable. I thought Im confident enough not to be scared but it scared me a bit. And the moment I finished it, wooohoooo I said, yes! i did it!...   Be there soon...

A nice, cool place for relaxing and sightseeing. Located very near Davao city.   We chose Davao City as our basketball team's yearly adventure venue. On day1, right after we ate lunch, we spend the afternoon in this place. The entrance fee is 200 pesos per head. This includes snacks (carbonara or ham sandwich). We first tried the "Indiana Jones". Everybody had fun. Then we availed their tour around the park for 120 pesos per person. Boarded their park vehicle. Learned good lessons on farming and plant varieties. They also have hydroponics growing system.   The sights are very good for picture taking. The air is really fresh. The ambiance is very romantic. I recommend this place for your next honeymoon venue.

ReviewTitle: Not as impressive as it was touted to be
Review: I went to Eden with high expectations and hopes but what I got was a so-so experience. It took us a long time to reach the area by tricycle and the driver asked us for more than what we agreed on.   Once we got inside, we decided to walk around the place. It seems to have been very nice but there were things that weren't maintained properly and they really dont have that much to offer except for a big place to roam around.  There were "rescue units" in case guests were unable to return from their trek and it would cost you a 1000php fee to utilize those. Their other facilities were also expensive.  The only things I liked about this place are the following:  The high altitude which gave a really nice temperature The fresh food (Their produce are the best!)  That's just it. Aside from those I can't really find anything that would warrant a 2nd visit or more. It might work for some people but not for me. If they did better on their maintenance and lower their exorbitant fees then I might go back in the future but as for now I cant help but feel that they're milking it too much without actually improving it.

This is a place where you can truly unwind from the "city's every day's demands". A mountain resort where you can hear the chirping of the birds, the call of the wind and the rustling sound of pine trees. A place for a solo, couples or family travellers. It offers a lot of activities, you can just enjoy fishing and have your "catch" grilled. Children can enjoy swimming in their cool pools. They also offer horsebackriding, zip line and to mention Eden's newest attraction, the Skycle. A day tour or an overnight stay will truly make your day. Even by just simply hiking around the resort and seeing the beautiful flowers will surely bring ease and comfort to one's senses. A must place to go when in Davao . Camping amenities are also available for the entire family. And their restaurant offers organic and home grown products. I love their salads and sandwiches!

it's a massive park and it would take the entire day to see everything. we only chose the areas we wanted to see. it was not spectacular but not poor either. don't forget to wear comfortable footwear when visiting the park. there were butterflies, deers, tall trees but nothing special. it was an average hike.

If you love the outdoors and nature you will love this place. As its name says it is a "nature park. The best way to see the park is by taking the tour bus. It is a very big park and with the weather being so warm it will be hard to cover the park on foot. Once you have taken the bus tour you can travel on foot for a closer look at the flowers and trees. Don't go there expecting great food. There is a restaurant but the park is not there for the food. The name tells you it is a nature park and that is what you get.

We stayed here last with with our three kids ages (at that time) 4, 8, 11. they enjoyed themselves. Many things to do for kids and very nice surroundings to do them in. Most important, the emphasis is on nature, the wild and the environment in all the tours and activities. VERY important in the Philippines where so much of the land is degraded.

One of the coolest place in Davao. Must be visited for tourists. You can go to the place by means of taxi or book with the company's vehicle. Again, a daytour would be fine for travelers on budget. Just a suggestion, better book for a more expensive daytour with buffet lunch than the cheaper one with light snacks.. Its very disappointing. Dont miss the tour package in their forested area for like 40 minutes, thats actually the highlight of the tour..   A side trip to Loleng's Mountain resort and Mountain Haven will make the tour more interesting..

We traveled to Eden Nature Park on our own and was very disappointed on what we saw. The place is all green alright but i think every move that you need make has a price. Initially you need to pay Php200 for entrance with not tasty spaghetti. For you to be able to tour the park you need to pay extra for the ride. I would say this was the deal breaker to my Davao trip.

Whilst 95% of this "reserve" was planted by man it looks & feels totally natural in every way. Thoroughly enjoyable place to visit & whilst the tour was short it was somewhat educational. Food served as part of the package left a lot to be desired. The views from this dormant volcano are stunning & the wild life (including the insects) abound. Totally recommended although it is quite a drive from Davao - prepare for cooler temperatures & perhaps some heavy rain at times

The best thing about this place is the feel of being in Baguio City. Pine trees adorned the surroundings giving a cool impression of the place. It is a great place for family bonding though it is quite expensive. What is so significant about this place is that it is a park, a nature and playground rolled into one. It is best to go on hiking while you are there. You really have to try Indiana Jones while you are at it. Food is just so-so and staffs are not so friendly. Generally, though the visit was rewarding and enjoyable.

ReviewTitle: If you love nature, this is the place to be!
Review: I think others have already given great reviews on this place, there's nothing more I could say. The place is refreshing, great for children, the food is delicious, they grow their own organic vegetable for the restaurant. The price is just fine for delicious and fresh buffet. The staff is super polite and nice. If there are foreigners on the shuttle ride around the park, they'll speak English so don't worry!  You can buy plants from the green house if you fancy. I lived in Davao for a year so I got some herbs back home to grow and they do grow very strongly.   For those who like Asian adventure on motorbikes, you can easily get here like a local: from the city center, C.M Recto street, however, this is the new name of the street, the name on the jeepney would be Claveria; On this street, you can take the jeepney that says "Toril" This jeepney will take you along Mc.Arthur Highway all the way to Toril district. Let the driver know in advance that you are going to Eden Nature Park, it's very well-known among the locals, so when it's time to get off, he'll let you know. Do not get nervous or pissed off if the driver doesn't respond to you in a proper way; they themselves are nervous when they have to communicate in English, trust me, they do want to be helpful. However, keep your eyes on the road after around 20-30 minutes after you get on the jeepney, you'll see a sign that tells you that you are arriving at the intersection where you have to turn right and go up hill to Eden. If I remember it right, it's only about 20 PhP for the jeepney fare. Get off at the intersection and ask for a motorbike ride. If you're not so big, they can ride 2 of you on one bike and it would be 100 PhP each way. Otherwise, each of you get on a motorbike and it's also 100 PhP each way for each of you. Well, in general, 100 PhP/per motorbike regardless how many people. It's very inexpensive considering the 12-kilometer distance ahead and it's uphill. When you're already there, the driver will wait for you to take you back if you come back the same day. If you stay the night, just take their phone number and call them half an hour ahead of when you want to go back. If they wait for you, just be nice and generous to give them a little more money when they take you back to the city, 50 PhP will do just fine.  I love the place and take everyone here who came visit me in Davao =))
We loved the "forest" atmosphere because of the trees and the medicinal garden. The only thing I disliked was the prohibitive price of souvenir items in the shop-- best to buy at Aldevinco.
Good for nature lovers because of its lust of green gardens and man-made forest with cottages that caters to visitors who wish to have a peaceful and stress-free vacation.

ReviewTitle: What and what is this kind ?
Review: When we arrive I saw and wonder what this here was. Nature park yes but fake. Didn't use time here, as the entrance was with lunch(470 P) or snack(180P). Why we have just get breakfast on hotel. Then the park is 7 km long , and then the want you to pay extra for their car also. No we went away.

Make sure you have Eden Nature Park in your itinerary when you tour Davao. It's about an hour or so taxi ride from the Davao International Airport. But the trip is going to be worth it. Too bad we just got the day tour package. The place offers recreational activities like fishing, "Skyriding," mountain trekking, swimming, etc. Take the guided shuttle tour and you'll appreciate the place even more. We'll stay for a night or two there next time we visit Davao.

I'm Glad That Our School Chosen This Beautiful Place During Our Educational Tour Way Back 2008! I remember The different kind of Vegetable garden and Lola's Garden?
