I for got the name.. :-) you will Found a thousand of Pine Tress and a very Cute Philippine Deer!!! during our Vehicle tour with Tour Guide :-) .. Also their is a Mini Zoo a lot of Animals Specially the kinds of birds. A place for a Family outing, School Camping, retreat and many more..    one thing I observed this place they don't air-conditioned.. , But You Don't need Air con, Because of the Cool Surrounding! the View Of Davao city is Awesome at the top of Mountain!   the Buffet Is Okay!   I will Definitely go Back in this Awesome Place Again!

ReviewTitle: Place for a Superb family vacation
Review: I brought my family in Davao to have the much deserved summer vacation. Manila is so hot during summer so the first place that will come to your mind is Baguio but we already went there before. How about another cool place to avoid the scorching heat? Eden Nature Park! Situated 3000 feet above sea level. We went there this May 2013 and the weather was fine although it rained at night time which makes the place cooler. All rooms does not have aircondition but we do not need one, it was summer and it was cool, just imagine if it was December. We stayed at Begornia Room and there was no TV as well. But I'd like to thank Eden for not installing TV. We spend quality time/ talking/playing with our kids (precioius bonding moments). Thanks Eden! We hope to come back to Eden soon.

It is remarkable garden and delightful place to visit.well-maintain garden. I like the lunch buffets-they serve yummy foods.i like the zipline ride.horse riding and fishing.. staffs are accommodating and cheerful.Unfortunately;it was raining when we went there but still nice..we rode a semi-jeepney to roam around the place. I had a super duper fantastic visit here:)one of the best garden ever!.

ReviewTitle: For nature-lovers, you have to visit this place...
Review: We've been here for a large group and we've enjoyed the nature... you will love walking and seeing different kinds of birds and other animals.. you've got to see the whole place --- its wonderful!

This park is beautifully maintained. The air is cool up there. Entrance fee has option of 1) with snack or 2) with lunch buffet. Chose the latter and were pleasantly satisfied with what were served.   You will have free ride within the premise and you'd see their different parks. You'd have a guided tour and appreciate the place more. They have a zip line and worth trying. One may opt to go fishing and have your prize cooked there and enjoy it. Or you may simply go to that area and order fish dish/s and have your lunch by that pond.  There are various photo taking opportunities. Going to this park is a good change from the city itself.

Eden Nature Park is a wonderful place, even if the rooms are spartan. I think the reason why the amenities in the rooms are sparse is because it is trying to position itself as a "Green" Resort, therefore there are no air conditioners, and their television sets are not up-to-date. After all, you want to go there to be one with nature, and not to stay in your room to watch TV. The food is healthy, as they grow their own organic vegetables. We particularly enjoyed the fishing (it was easy because they stock up their pond regularly with Tilapia), and eating-what-we-caught, experience. They wrapped our fish in banana leaves and deep fried it. It was so good! Also, the operations manager, Celia, took care of us very well. We wish we spent more time in the place. The next time we visit, we intend to bring our hiking boots and will do a lot of hiking.

Eden Nature Park is a family destination. Ecotourism is being promoted here. They have different themed gardens around this huge park. Nice airconditioned rooms and cottages for rent. Truly organically grown food served during their daily lunch buffets. Small jeepneys move around the park to transfer guests from one location to another. Nice set up and beautiful park.

ReviewTitle: Davao's mini version of Baguio City
Review: In my recent trip to Davao last month on a business planning session with officemates, we took a guided tour to this place. It is about 45mins - 1hr from Davao City proper and it is their version of Baguio City, i.e. a tourist attraction perched on top of a hill, zigzag roads, cool and sunny weather, pine trees and a cultural performance from a local minority tribe. In fact, you wouldn't imagine that you are in Davao if you visit this place because it will remind you perfectly of Baguio City. There are three areas here for picture taking. Once you take the shuttle ride, it will stop at those 3 areas, i.e. the rainbow garden and the minority village are two of those places. This is something totally different and unexpected from Davao City. Fresh like a scent of pine trees indeed.

This is an 8 hectare land where apparently 6 hectares was converted into a nature park. They have zip lines for adults and "kids", horseback riding, swimming pools. There are portions of the park where you can see Davao City from afar. Lots of areas were converted into orchards - mangosteen, mangoes. durian etc. Was here April 9 after a successful RTD with OB doctors (who by the way looked gorgeous) the previous evening. The quality of the air is really good, weather wise it was a respite from the tremendous heat in the lowland. Food at their restaurant was good with lots of organic (park grown) veggies was my favorite.

ReviewTitle: It was an enjoyable day at the park.
Review: We are from San Francisco, CA (USA). The park was very clean and green. It was an enjoyable day. We had lunch at the restaurant that used vegetables from its own gardens. After lunch took the tram around the park to enjoy the beautiful gardens and views of Davao.

If you are looking for a place to relax with family or friends, you've got to visit this place. This is accessible both by public and private commute. We highly recommend that you go to this place by public commute for more adventure and fun.  How: From the airport, you take a jeepney going to Abreeza Mall. Go to the information counter and ask how to take a jeepney going to Toril. When you reach Toril, take the habal-habal going to the resort.  *The public commute is a lot cheaper than hiring a cab.  When staying at this place, it is best to book in advance. You may opt to choose to stay overnight. As for my experience, my friend and I stayed for one night only and was not able to experience everything. We should have stayed longer, like to 2 to 3 days more.  There are plenty of activities to do:  1. Check out the amphitheater where a lot of beautiful flowers could be found. There you could also see the rainbow structure. You will definitely have a lot of pictures taken here. 2. You can go trekking. You can try their mountain trail. 3. You can go swimming. 4. You can go fishing and have your catch cooked. This is for your yummy lunch. 5. Try the zipline. This is to experience something exhilarating. 6. Their Indiana Jones ride is worth the try. :-)  Aside from that, there are a lot of cottages to choose from. This depends of the number of people checking in. You can check their website for this.  Of course, you should not forget the food. During our stay we had buffet dinner and breakfast. The food is so satisfying. :-)

ReviewTitle: Nice forest, but the rest is nothing special
Review: Everything is so far apart and the pool is really cold, the rooms are pretty ok, and restaurant is above average, value for money i think I am down to 2 stars, for feeling of nature 4 stars
Staff are fantastic and very knowledgeable about the park and its history. Will be recommending everyone to go see this whilst in Davao.

ReviewTitle: Poor front desk and web service
Review: The place is great, the food is good, the accommodations are nice BUT online booking service and front desk people screwed up and did not even try to appease the disgruntled customer. I was on a personal retreat and the webmaster erroneously booked my room and I had to pay almost double than what I ought to. Front desk people were not very helpful in resolving the issue, did not even try to do a refund of the excess payment and just told me to gorge myself with food at the restaurant or to buy toursit-y souvenir items (which I don't really need since I'm from Davao) to consume the excess payment. Very bad customer service. The restaurant crew was very pleasant though, maybe because I was at the restaurant A LOT. I ended up eating a lot since I had no choice but to do so.  This place is great for those who love nature. Staff could use a little more training on customer service. And just a warning for those who'll book through the internet to be very vigilant.

We went here for a day tour trip. The place was nice especially for nature lovers. The entrance fee was quite expensive, which includes a snack meal. This is the fee that we chose since we don't plan to stay long. But they also offer an entrance rate/fee with lunch. The food that they served was not worth the price and the tour was short considering the price that we paid.

if you want to try some nature trip in davao then don't miss Eden Nature Park. I rode a horse here and tried their "exercise field" where you could see things used by the soldiers when they exercise like big tires, monkey bars, etc if you are in a company outing, you could use this "exercise field" for team building or sportfest. They also have a zipline here for added attraction.

ReviewTitle: Great for those who love nature
Review: We love this place. The fresh air, fresh food. Lots of things to do. Great for families. The kids will surely enjoy the playground especially Indiana Jones

The nature park has beautiful views and the air is so fresh and healthy far away from all the air pollution of Davao. It’s quiet and serene and all one hears are the birds chirping (besides for all the visitors of course).   The owners have done a good job restoring the place and its defiantly worthwhile visiting. Guests/visitors are taken on a guided tour on an open air golf buggy type of car. The guide spoke an excellent English. The only downside is she was always promoting and talking about their cottages and rooms which one can rent etc…. in fact it got quite annoying as she always managed to bring it up during the 45 minute tour. Personally I would never stay here as the accomadation is very basic, no luxuries and no air conditioning. Well I must say the climate here is nice and cool and perhaps air con is not needed.  They have swimming and fishing as extras and also lunch.  They have a beautiful aviary which I enjoyed.   I would sum up and say this was my best day trip from Davao. Enjoy my pics!

Nice place to have a relaxing time.  Buffet lunch was not that bad. If you are a salad eater, this place is a must for you. The salad are freshly picked, as they grow it on their own backyard.  The guided tour is a must. You will see a man made forest.
The place has cool weather and I certainly enjoyed the guided tour. Special commendation to the buffet food, it is glorifying.

ReviewTitle: A nice view and that is all
Review: A long way to go for what you get. Only thing which impressed us was the mountain view of Davao from a couple of locations. The tour was short but not too bad considering the low price, just don't be fooled into purchasing the "lunch"...More

ReviewTitle: A name that speaks for itself.
Review: A good place to see for the whole family especially for children. The tour guides are excellent. The place is very cool coz it is located on a hill. A very nice experience.

WOW!!! from the moment we arrive @Eden we said were going to enjoy our stay here. And it was really a worth it experience! We stayed at the Pine Lodge for 10pax but the place could accommodate more than that. And I forgot to take...More
It's far from the city center but when you get there it all paid off. As you go up, you'll me caught with tagaytay/baguio environment. Try Indiana Jones, if fun way alternative to zipline.

Our family stayed at Eden Nature Park last Dec 26, 2012. The place is best if you want to isolate yourself away from the city. If you are looking for adventure, this is not the place to go. There is a fishing area at the...More

Beautifully laid out .courteous and efficient staff ..Left our booking too late to stay at this resort but visited on a day trip . Buffet .lunch provided was excellent in quality and presentation . there was evidence of damage from the recent typhoon but repairs...More

eden is beautiful and adventurous nature park this has been restored since during 70s this a logging area the restoration is truly close to what it looks like before but of course there is pavement and roads that has been added for easy access of...More

ReviewTitle: Costly Nature Adventure! No to Fishing Village!
Review: The place was nice! It was my second time going in there, so I know what to expect. As usual, the 1 hour tour is still fun even if I had experience it already. But what gives me pain is that I should pay for...More

It was an unexpected so very interresting and amusing "free" bird show ( not in cages) and will return to see it again ! Buffet was in the good average and staff always pleasant; Nice sunday drive............

If you want to run away from the busy life in the city and want to get close with nature, to be in the woods- you can try to stay at Eden Nature Park. Just an hour ride from city proper, you will reach there by rent-a car services, hired taxi if you don't have your own car. The fruit bearing trees, the wild flowers, the fresh air will surely gives you peace of mind. If you want to emote, you do it there because the serenity will help you think the right ideas. And if you want to try some little adventure, you can try their Zipline for only Php 150.00 and the Indiana Jones for free. I love the Indiana Jones, tried to play it twice. It is not only for the kids, it is good for adults. I'm sure you will enjoy :)
We just had a quick tour of the park. It was a pleasant experience. And the lunch buffet was great and worth it.

ReviewTitle: overnight stay not enough, wish i had better sleep though
Review: again writing a review from a perspective of a mother with 2 young kids. there is just so much to do here that we all felt (especially our 4 year old) that an overnight stay is too short.  we booked a Camella room, it's good for 4 adults and arrived just in time for check in at 2pm. Check in was quick and we were asked to book meals ahead of time.   the room was sufficient. nothing impressive except that it was SPACIOUS it had 4 single beds that we pushed together to make 1 (gigantic) bed. a couple of concerns though, i would have preferred and slept better if we had 2 king sized beds as opposed to the singles since the kids sleep in our bed too but that is not an option here. room size is ideal for families with teenagers as it can still accommodate 2 more extra beds. but for families with young children, a king sized bed would really, really be appreciated. I barely slept as I felt so uncomfortable and at some point in the evening, i got really sweaty. there's no AC btw. they rely on the cold mountain weather to keep guests cool. the t&b was spacious as well with hot and cold shower and strong water pressure. you'd have to bring your toiletries though. they only provide tiny rectangles of soap and 4 sachets of shampoo.   so why give it 4 stars? because the dinner buffet was very good. the filipino fare served was delicious ( fried chicken, pancit sotanghon, siomai and bistek tagalog) plus, there was a salad bar with freshly picked tomatoes, carrots and lettuce. all for only P350 per person.  also, there's so much to do. for the kids there's the play ground and horse back riding and for the more adventurous, the indiana jones and more extreme zip line. the tour is also worth mentioning as we had the most photo ops there.  i think there's more to do here but we just did not have enough time. we will definitely be going back to find out.
I really Enjoy the place because of its wonderful nature beauty. When I have time I will go back to that place and spend the rest of my life in the heavenly made resort

Spent a few days at eden nature resort and would thoroughly recommend if you need to chill out and relax,the services and the staff very friendly and helpful,food very good and generally a nice place to spend time,the big zipwire is a must enjoy folks.;)

ReviewTitle: A Nice Getaway from City Life
Review: Eden Nature Park is one of the best places in a natural setting, lots of trees and lots of bird calls. We arrived in Eden late afternoon. It was pouring but still nice to smell the air. We had a free dinner and breakfast that went with our hotel room rent and we were fortunate because there was a seminar and the dinner-buffet was delicious. Breakfast was also good. I chose the fish and garlic fried rice. Our room had a hot and cold shower but no cable TV. Wi-fi was strongest only in the front desk. The resort shuttle was quick to bring us to the dining room. Everybody was nice and friendly. For first time visitors, I would recommend a visit. I wish I could give the place five stars but I saw a huge rat running across the dining hall. Too bad.

We booked for an overnight stay at this place. The room was fine had a big space enough for 4 persons (we were 4 by the way). We joined their day tour which costs around 300+ per pax and it was okay. The lunch, dinner and breakfast buffet were ok, nothing special. The problem was after the tour we practically had nothing to do! There's this pool but we cannot swim due to the cold weather, and then there came night time these neighbors of ours (a group) had videoke which was originally only up to 10:30pm but extended unitl 11pm+!!!!! We were not able to sleep properly as we all were tired from the flight.  Overall, would recommend the day trip but to stay overnight?? A big NO.

We set off to Eden from Davao by taxi, (negociate the fare first as some drivers will charge you to much). We had a booking for one night in their cheapest room, that was a mistake. The cheap rooms are basic with no bathroom and ours was situated next to one of the places where they have seminars, the noise from there was so bad I had to go to reception and ask for a transfer. After a long phone call to some where they agreed to transfer us to another room but at and extra cost. I strongly objected to this as I felt that I should have been informed when I booked that the room was next to a seminar. After another lengthy phone call they agreed to give us an upgrade to a holiday lodge at no extra cost, the lodge was excellent and I strongly recommend that you go for this. The meals at Eden seem to be average but unless you get there when the doors open you will be dissapointed at the choices left as they don't seem to replenish the buffet, when it's gone it's gone. The park it's self is very good with nice walks and plenty to keep you occupied.
In fairness to Eden nature park, probably it would best to go there when weather is sunny and fair...We reach eden nature park it was raining that's why we did not appreciate much the place.

Its a nice place to relax and unwind.. food wasnt remarkable andneeds improvement.. its just ok but knowing the quality and amount of serving standards in Davao City, its a little bit of overkill.. definitely try their tour as it is the best thing to do their..
Davao City has several nearby nature centers. This one is well maintained, offers a fair amount to keep you (and the kids if you bring them) occupied.

ReviewTitle: Wasn't too accommodating to walk-in guests
Review: So here are the tips: Call in advance. Book your tour early. Come in the morning. These things we obviously failed to do so we did not enjoy the trip too much. The park tour was fully booked so we had no other choice but...More

The park is nestled on a mountain overlooking the city of Davao. The lush forest that surrounds the entire place is very relaxing. Our trip was for day tour only. We appreciated the guided tour as such was systematic as the sound system is clear,...More

I was very happy that at last I was able to visit Eden Natrure. It is one of the perfect places that I've visited. The air was so fresh and the place was very solemn. Everything was so natural I can't help but appreciate and...More
Eden Nature Park is a one getaway for the warm and busy day of Davao. with the altitude of 3,500 feet above sea level, surely this is one of the best experience to suit and relax your self.

From the time you enter the gates of the park to the time you leave, that smile in your face remains. Its been a pleasant experience with the friendly staff, amazing environment, good food. Thimbs up!

Very nice spot for communing with nature, with it's own farms that grows beautiful vegetables, cool early morning and at nightime the forest lulls you to sleep with it's unique sounds only nature can offer.
There are lot of activities that can be done in this place especially those who are nature lover. I enjoyed the zip line!

ReviewTitle: well done for being a "Man-made nature park"
Review: I was so impressed! it was an amazing park. unfortunately it was somehow raining at the time of our tour but still I can say that we enjoyed it. our tour guide was so jolly and she was very articulate and knowledgeable about the entire...More

It looked like a nice place on the brochure but its a long drive to get there and once your there you have to pay for everything, just to walk around the park it costs. If you do any activities it costs extra.

Went to Eden on a day trip and only stayed 2 hours. The tour of the property which takes approx 1 hour was great and the guide was excellent. The mosquitos were really bad so make sure you take repellent and cover up. The flower garden was nice but this was the extent of what I enjoyed. The zipline which was the main purpose of my visit was closed which was disappointing and we were advised of it when booking in. We then thought we would try the fishing village which you have to pay additional for which is fine. Then when arriving there I am advised that you also have to pay for anything you catch even if you don't want to keep it. To me this just seems unreasonable because you are paying twice and when I booked the trip I was told I could catch and release as we were flying out first thing in morning so didn't want to keep anything.   Anyway this just turned me off and so we left and went to the Philippine Eagle Park which was amazing!

This is a must see place to visit when you're in Davao. Though going there was a bit hard, it will be all worth it, especaill for nature lovers. Indiana jones was fun. What I dislike is their breakfast buffet. Not worth the price. But the shuttle tour was amazing. The tour guide was nice and jolly. He takes good pictures, and will always prioritize taking pictures of us before the other guests. And for an extra adventure, ride a payong or habal habal when going there instead of a taxi. :)
They have year round promos where you can get accommodations for 50%-60% less! Roam around the whole premises every morning while jogging or just walking.

Thumbs up for Eden!  I never knew this place existed.  Good thing I heard it just before our Davao Trip.  I was impressed with the tour. There was even tram that was comparable to Singapore's Safari Tour where tour guides were professional, approachable, knowledgeable and kind!  In between, there were even a pre-recorded documentaries/annotations.  COOL!

I had 4 Filipinos with me and paid for all of them, so it because quite expensive. The buffet was 470 PHP/person, so it cost me close to 2500 PHP for a very average buffet! The grounds were nice, but there was a price on everything. If you're only a couple, the price is worth it but not when you must pay for many.

i didnt expect that there would be a place like that in Davao. Its located about 1 and a half hours away from the city and once you get there you will ride one of their open air mini trucks. there is a tour guide who will take you around the farm. it is a truly educational and unique experience. at the main mess hall, the peacocks are roaming freely and you can take pictures with them. I definitely recommend this to anyone going to Davao.
The place is very clean and serene! Strolling there makes me feel like I'm one with nature! This is one of my favorite places in Davao. I will definitely go back here! :D

ReviewTitle: I wish I could stay here at least once
Review: Great feeling to be in a forest, with wildlife around you. Peace and quiet and open air.   But I went there only on a tour, and snacks. Book ahead and arrive before your tour schedule as you might miss the tour, as what almost happened to us.

Davao is a big city with a lot of beautiful places to explore. You have to stay for a week to see most if not all of the refreshing places they have. I admire the local gov't for strictly implementing the NO SMOKING rule...you can see fines posted on the walls for violators...nice job. It is comparatively clean and the people are very accomodating and friendly, as Filipinos naturally are in general, right? Food tastes great and i will never forget the best body spa i ever experienced...too bad i just couldn't remember the place...ha ha..These Eden garden is one great place- refreshing and reminiscent of people in the past. The fruits, trees, flowers and mini forest made the experience truly refreshing..

ReviewTitle: Very relaxing and tranquil place with nature at its finest!
Review: First we hopped on an hour and a half van ride from the city, and on our way were forests and plantations that catch the view. When we arrived we went in this cute cottage, as the reception. We then payed for the package and after waiting for around 30 minutes we were able to hop on the tour. It was really a very well executed tour in this nature paradise! The tall trees, the mist and the breeze by the forest was really calming. Herbs and beautiful flowers at time envelop the side of the path. The view at one point is breathtaking! Also, there were stops that showcased the history of Davao, such as the different tribes in the area. Also, interesting fruit bearing trees such as Marang, Mangosteen, Durian and even Macadamia Nut trees are found in one of the plantations. After the tour we went on to have snacks in a garden set-up which continued the calm atmosphere of the place as we dined (it even has a free wi-fi connection). It was really a great experience with nature, and a must when going to Davao!

ReviewTitle: for nature lover; not really for an adventurous traveler
Review: This attraction is far from the hustle and bustle of the great city. Good for nature lovers because of its lust of green gardens and man-made forest with cottages that caters to visitors who wish to have a peaceful and stress-free vacation.  If your the adventurous type of traveler, you will somehow get bored on the tour packages they are offering. Nonetheless, the tour rates are reasonable and worth trying for.

No need to travel to Northern Luzon to smell pine trees, and experience cool Baguio weather! Their restaurant serves delicious organic salad greens. Watch out for the friendly peacocks which might fly above you as you enjoy the mountain top view of Davao City

I found the place amazing, in the sense that it was surprisingly fantastic, like one of those hidden gems. When you arrive at the area, one would be mistaken that they were not in the Philippines. The climate is cool, fresh air and the facilities are of some standard. If you like to go hiking and trekking, this is one of the best places to go to if you are in Davao City.   You do not have to travel so far to experience the beauty of nature nor suffer so much in the traveling part. Its best if you have your own private vehicle to get there, because taking public transport to Eden is just simply impossible. I enjoyed the trails that they had around the Park because its high up, and with the freshness and coolness of the area, you don't get tired easily in usually such a humid country. With great views of Davao City from certain areas, this park is not a place to be missed!

1000 mt a.s.l. means fresh(er) air and spectacular views. The park consists of sections some with sleeping quarters, some with groves, gardens, orchards, nurseries, others with native jungle, trekking paths and a large area has been planted over with thousands huge pine trees. None of this existed before the management decided to replant the whole wild grassland. There are also an angling pond, a swimming pool, a long zip-line, a menagerie of exotic birds, particularly peacocks, both blue and white, a Pinoy (native Filipino) game area, and a large restaurant/communal area. The nights are very quiet, except for the loud, shrill call of the peacocks or the creaking masts of the bamboo bushes. Pure nature, pure Eden.

A very relaxing place located less than an hour from downtown Davao. Relatively cool since it is located in an elevated area. You can opt to for a day tour or an overnight stay -- i personally prefer to stay at least 2 nights to really enjoy the place. Several types of accommodations are available, the mountain villas are my preference since we have a large family. This villa would allow you to cook and park your car right next to it. It is located very near the pool as well.  Around the park there are many activities to enjoy -- indiana jones, fishing, zip line, horse back riding, basketball, camping to name a few.  Food buffet is wonderful, especially the fresh vegetables!
It nice nature park but they try to sell every thing to you from bungalows to wedding packages to the food and trees atleast that what I thought. Very nice eatting place and little swings on side.

ReviewTitle: It is almost like Eden without serpents.
Review: If you want to get away from it all this is the place to do it. Nestled at the foot of a tall mountain, the air is fresh and there are a number of thing to do enough to occupy a days visit. We stayed overnight. Not much to do at night but read and enjoy the ambiance.

The drive to eden nature park was long and uphill. I hate the drive because i didnt know what to expect. When we got there my jaw dropped since the place is really green and beautiful. The weather up there was cool too more like tagaytay during the ber months but it was june when we went there. There's a jeep that would take you to different parts of the park and a tour guide which would happily take your pictures. The place is just plain awesome. Nature is really beautiful especially when untouched. I felt like i'm lost in a jungle full of fruits, trees and flowers. before going to the restaurant for lunch, our last stop was almost at the top of the mountain, giving us a birds eye view of Davao city. Breathtaking is all i can say. Lunch was served buffet style. :) there is also a zipline on the other side of the park. It was my first try and i felt all my blood drained from my face but it was worth it. please do not ever skip going here when you are in davao.

it was an ok trip. it took us around an hour to reach the park but there really isn't much to see. if you're into nature then it might interest you but if not then better look for other places to spend your time
it is a welcome respite from the city madness. Also the foo is good and the place is clean. Love the peacock hanging around

So loved and enjoyed my trip here. If given a chance to visit Davao again, I will be back here to experience all the fun and the eco-adventure in place. It's a 80-hectare nature park...here you'll surely enjoy the cool mountain air with flower and butterfly gardens, mangosteen orchard, fruits and herbs terraces and a lot more. There's an entrance fee of 200 pesos. If you wish to take the park ride with the tour guide explaining for an hour about the whole park, you need to pay additional of 120 pesos inclusive of a snack (spaghetti meal with slice of bread and soda). There are also rides to enjoy in place like zipline or kayak in the fishing area. They also have rooms for over night stay. What's good visiting there is they have this map, where in you get to go in all of their attractions. The tour guide is also friendly and very informative in telling us of the park's history. Spending a little amount of money to indulge in nature is so worth it!
for nature lovers, this is a nice place for you to go... it's a cool nice place...
We had the guided tour and it was fun. I fell in love with nature! :) Our guide was also kind to us. Their snack is good also. I love their tuna sandwich! Weeeh! :)

ReviewTitle: Eden Nature Park, the green without Pinoys
Review: At the checkout you have the choice. Admission is not charged, but you must choose a meal. Pinoy lunch buffet (450P) or Snack (120P), including soft drinks such unspeakable. Plus a round trip - by all Pinoys and 80% of the other passengers - booked. Ate and I are of course tempered hikers so we gave up the tour. The dashed line is the trail. Supposedly 6 km long. However, you forgot the highs and lows well. Of course you can stay there at relatively high prices. The walker leaves the course effeminate bus passengers back in the InfoCenter.  These have a good time there anyway. You can go fishing where the fish is considerably more expensive than the market. In addition to there is a "Pinoy Model" village from non-food material, a kind of cable car, etc. However, I was come to walk. The trail is rugged and increasingly steeper. The hikers reached after about two hours a hill. From this point of view in good weather you have to Samal and beyond. There is anything built on what vegetables you want lettuce, arugula, tomatoes, etc. The tourists are offered by the raised beds culinary herbs (rosemary, coriander, Basil, celery, etc.) to sniff and taste. Disgusted by the healthy, the observed Pinoys throw the stuff away again immediately. Is not she lovely, is not greasy and not smelling like old fish, they can not use. Arrived back at the information center you can order the yummy stuff from the field as a salad. Tastes and is inexpensive.
Its for nature lover park. Like baguio also with pine trees and cool weather with an altitude of aprox. 2800 ft.

ReviewTitle: EDEN as a local vacation place
Review: Eden is one of the sweet and lovely place for a local vacation place in davao. Our company have a team building in this nature loving place and we really have fun and enjoy our stay in eden.

ReviewTitle: A trip to an 80 hectares nature park
Review: Everyone suggested this place so we were very curious and booked it. The property is huge, the entrance fee is packaged with the lunch so there's no choice but to savor their buffet lunch which they claimed as healthy and organic based. It's a so so lunch though, nothing special. After the lunch, we took their mobile van to go around their park for a fee. It's a nature park with lots of fruit bearing trees, herb gardens, vegetable gardens. They also have cabins, lodges and cabanas for rent. Nice but not something that will excite you.

Went to Eden for a Valentine treat with my husband last February. We immediately decided that we need to bring our two sons to the place, which we did this May. The park's set up allows maximum family bonding as there are limited distractions. We all toured, ate well, walked around, enjoyed the cool climate and had fun together.
I love this place. It is a nice getaway from the hustle bustle of the city. I recommend staying overnight here with friends or family. Very relaxing.

ReviewTitle: SO MANY THINGS TO DO, SO LITTLE TIME....
Review: There are so many things to do at the Eden Nature Park, but so little time.... Activities include taking the guided tour for 120 Philippine pesos (3 stops). swimming, hiking, fishing, taking the zipline, horse back riding, playing Pilipino games, camping, visiting the Aviary, etc. There are cottages for hire for those who prefer to stay overnight.  My favorite activity = eating. For 470 pesos or approximately US10.00, one can eat the buffet lunch consisting of dishes made of organic ingredients grown at the Eden Nature Park. Salad greens are very fresh and delicious. The same is true with the meat dishes, fresh cut-up fruits and other desserts. Those prefering light lunch, they can have sandwiches for a cheaper price..  Relax, and watch the views of Davao City from the distance. The Park is located at the hilly parts of the city (80 hectares) and with many trees and plants surrounding it, the weather is cool and comfortable. .   Note: Without your own transportation, it is difficult to reach this Park and other tourist spots of Davao City. Consider paying between 2500 -3000 Philippine pesos for a car, taxi, or van that can accommodate 1-6 passengers to visit the Eden Nature Park and other tourist spots.

Cool weather a little bit like Baguio City. For 200 pesos entrance fee (quite steep), you can enter the park. To maximize your trip, you have to avail of tour of the park with free snacks at 120 pesos (which is reasonable). There's nothing much to do if you don't avail of the park tour, unless you are there just to eat lunch where you have to pay P55 to be able to fish tilapia which you can have cooked (with a fee of course). Our lunch (10 persons) was almost 4,000 pesos (of course that's because we fished 6 large tilapia, ordered 4 more mudfish and vegetable salad, rice and water).  Over-all, the trip to the park is worth it, although a bit expensive after you sum up all the fees.  It would have been nice if the park can offer a choice of package where you can choose between one with lunch and park tour and snacks, and another package where it will just be tour and snacks. I hope they just incorporate the entrance fees with the packages. Simpler.

I liked the environment and the nature. The place will make you relaxed and forget the noise and the stress from the city. People were very nice and helpful.  You have to pay for an entrance fee of around P200+ per person. This includes a snack (sandwich or pasta and a drink). Don't expect too much of course on the snack. :) A shuttle with a tour guide will show the whole place for a fee of around P100+ per person. You can take a walk but the staff told us that it would take you 3-4 hours to finish just one area of the park.  Overall, we had a refreshing experience.
We celebrated our 2nd anniversary here and the place is just wonderful. The food, especially the salad buffet, is just amazing.
It's a great place for day touring because of it's cool climate and sight of different plants and animals. Great restaurant too.
Nice park. The entrance fee comes with the tour of the park, a sandwich and cup of coffee. It has good ambiance because of the plenty trees.

The buffet lunch was just okay, I could have taken lunch outside the park.   I enjoyed the tour around the Eden Park. It was very relaxing to see the high trees, lushes of green, beautiful flowers matched with the chirping of birds and quiet noises of different kinds of animals.   It made me realize the importance of taking care of our environment.  One half day is just enough to see the park. I suggest going up here to relax after a long day's work.

ReviewTitle: relaxing after a long trip UP
Review: you need to rent a car when you go up rather than having a taxi... one whole day would be best to experience all amenities the Park can offer.

i love eden nature park it gives u awesome experience and its not expensive the entrance was cheap and for 100php u can go on 1hour tour in a ride wd 5 stop over where u can see thier garden, thier trees, and a look at samal island.. what i love most is the tour guide as a photographer as welltheyre so nice n frendly.  we also went ziplina and it hell scary lol but we did it .. tnx god for giving us courage to do ity bec were contemplating really to do it or not but we dont want to miss d experince with a trembling feeling and shaking knees we stared to go up.. whooooaahhhhhh...  the food was nice the staff are frendly too..and the place is clean..the garden gave u a paradice experience..  i had an amzing experience here ...

Eden Nature Park is worth your time to visit.Lots of Greenery,fresh salads for buffet lunch,amazing zip line and a friendly peacock that roams the open grounds. Nevertheless I plan to visit the plan for a longer stay.I was there for a quick half-day stop which was not enough to savor the tranquility of the place.Buffet lunch was really good at Vista resto. Buffet lunch was included for the price of the tour.I really enjoy taking pictures around the place.Fortunately as I was standing next to the peacock it unexpectedly opened its feathers (pic attached).There's No comparison between Malagos garden & Eden Park..the latter is a lot better than Malagos. A Whole Day tour is recommended for Eden Nature Park.
its so boring.. the view is so common.. nothing unusual to tour.. it is much better that you go to a tall building

Davao in general is so full of greenery but this park was just amazing, definitely worth a visit. It's beautiful, extremely peaceful and full of wonderful plants, flowers and trees. It's huge so took the tour to go around it which was fun. Staff are very friendly and accomodating. Wouldn't recommend the restaurant at all though. Food was almost inedible, felt like it was a day old and didn't taste good at all. Sweets and fruits were also unimpressive. The drive up to the park from the city is also very relaxing with nice scenery.

If you want to relax and forget the city life for a moment, eden's the place to be! Best to stay overnight and perfect for honeymooners. Affordable rooms, sumptuous buffet meals, great accommodation. Safe for hiking and trekking too. Don't forget to try the Indiana jones ride! Once you get to try, you won't stop! :) and make sure you avail of the tour around the park, really worth it.

Eden Nature Park???  At first i actually have no idea about this place but most of the people around me talked about it..I was zoo courious about this place and zoo i look at it at the google map and see it for myself.. We went there together with my fiancé and since he wants to try Pilipino style instead of riding on a taxi we decided to ride on a jeepney (with signage TORIL) though its hassle  cuz its kinda hot and its a long ride (cheap thou its cost 14-20. 00) ..if I'm not mistaken that ride took 45 minutes from downtown to TORIL .We told the driver to take us off to the market ( TORIL PROPER) where we can get another ride from motorcycle which cost at least 150.00 all in all for the 2 of us and the ride took another 30 minutes i guess?..Just be careful and be wise cuz if the driver know that your not a Davao residence they will make the price higher so take this advice "always asked those people around before you ride in"  By the way if you take TAXI? it would take at least 30-40 minutes from down town to TORIL / EDEN PARK...some part of the road going to EDEN PARK was rocky soo it kinda rough and hassle to go to EDEN by motorcycle..  More or less after 1 hr? when we got there yoou will see their front desk and they will great you/approach you and they will ask you to pay 300+ (for entrance fee and snack only with tour guide or if you don't want to avail the tour guide then you might pay lesser) and for buffet lunch and with tour guide you will need to pay 400+ including entrance fee. Actually the buffet lunch is available till 1:00pm if I'm not mistaken.ABout their snacks they only have few choices for their visitors and i admit i don't like their snacks cuz its plated but but but but,... i LOVE their buffet lunch its zoo cool most are fresh nutritious. They actually have vegetable farm inside their park zoo their menu are always fresh and you will know what i mean once you try it..I love it and i would love to go back their again soon..I was kinda sad cuz i dent get a chance to try their "FISH VILLAGE" ..as far as i can remember the Entrance fee to their fish village was 200 per head and you can take with you the fish that you will catch or you can ask them to cook it for you..They will give you material u need on catching fish ;)  And you guys should try their Nature Tour cuz they have a lot of good stuff to discover..(from plant) they have different kinds of flowers,trees,fruits,vegetable etc. and anyway the last time that i was there " i saw some horse" ( i love horse..dont know how to ride them though).hope they have a riding horse :) soon cuz i would love to try ...but on the ZIP LINE part witch is 100 meters away i guess from that park ..they have horse riding ...   AND ofcourse in the end of the day you don't need to worry about getting a ride cuz there is a motorcycle waiting for you out side the entrance gate..I remember before the guard told me that we don't get any ride and the only way for us to get back into the city was to take that TAXI who was parked at the street..and too late for us to realize that the guard fooled as ..we notice that there is a motor waiting out side..and zoo the 2nd time we went there i know what to do and don't listen to that stupid guard anymore :) and for your information guys? the driver ask as to pay 1600.00 with is too much..soo best advice always check the meter before riding on a taxi ;)  We didn't ask for meter anyway..ahahha no wonder why we surprised   Hope you guys enjoy your visit ;)

i've stayed at eden several times and highly recommend it even for a day trip.   if you are a big group, they have cottages that can fit all of you. you get the privacy and the traquility for a restful night. rooms do not have any air conditioning since it's pretty cool there all year long. my favorite cottage is the one with a bathroom that has an indoor garden. awesome stay!  it's very family friendly because kids have a lot of space and options to play. there's even a fishing pond where you can spend an hour or two fishing for tilapia which they can either cook for you on the spot or you can bring home.   for day trip they have a tour of the place which gives you a lot of information about the place and nature.  what's awesome about eden is that they have their own vegetable farm so what you eat is so fresh and tasty that you can just keep coming back.
Clean and organize, no dislike in this place. It was 23 years in the making, along the way they sell Marang at 20/ kilo and durian and avocado, very cheap :)

ReviewTitle: Wasn't amused about their high bank rates
Review: Hi   I haven't been there yet, but I wasnt amused about the P1000 I had to pay their bank just to transfer a deposit. All in all I paid eur 25 in bank charges. Some bank charges are normal, but this is excessive. I am allergic to companies not telling me about hidden costs. Not a good start, Eden Park!  AJR

ReviewTitle: A day at Eden Nature Park
Review: Almost 1.5 hours road trip from our hotel at North Zen and 3,000 feet above sea level, you will find Eden Nature Park. Eden is still part of Davao City. If you love nature, then you will definitely enjoy a trip to EDEN. Going around Eden is simple by renting a shuttle service. I enjoyed the Hydroponics since I have this type of system installed in my house. Here you can see different variety of plants, veggies, herbs, fruits, etc. You also offer overnight stay in EDEN and you may choose from different rooms or villas. Never leave Davao without paying a visit to EDEN.  Pros: Lovely view and scenery, fresh air and a lot of activities available.  Cons: Make sure that the van you rent is bnew and able to climb steep roads. Budget going here is not on the cheap side. Check pricing on their website.

ReviewTitle: The Park that Never Ceases to Amuse
Review: We had our trip booked at Matina Town Square (MTS) day before our desired schedule. We were shown the price list and minutes after we paid for the reservation. We had it scheduled for 10 in the morning. When we arrived at the venue, we got there late. Upon arriving we were asked by the guard on duty if we have reservations made and we were then given a laminated sheet to submit to the front desk. At the front desk, we weren't told that we're late or anything. Turns out we got there early for the reserved buffet lunch. The lady at the front desk asked us if we wanted to join the guided tour, which we thought was included in the buffet lunch. We had the reservation explained and it turned out we we're not booked for the guided tour as the guy in the MTS office told us. So we paid additional to join the tour and were just squeezed in like regular walk-in guests. Well, that's okay. We could've verified that at the MTS office.  So while waiting for the guided tour at 1PM. we went first to the Indiana Jones grounds. It's a nice starter for those who would want to try zip lining but are afraid to try the real thing. Simply, Indiana Jones is a miniature zip line wherein you would help yourself out in gliding through the zips. We enjoyed it a lot!  After that, we went to the Skyrider. As I can remember, it's a 400-meter long, 60-meter high two-way zip line. You'd need to pay extra for this. Also, you'd need to sign the waiver before engaging the zip. If you're a minor, you would need your parents' consent. So we got the harness ready and we're ready to zip. It was enjoyable! The tiring part is the climbing the staircase all the way to the top. The people there are courteous and accommodating.  We went back for the buffet lunch and it was okay. They served 4-6 courses of food together with a free glass of softdrinks. For me, it was okay. What's nice is the salad. The vegetables are fresh as can be. It's like they were freshly harvested.  Then off we go to the guided tour. Your registered names will be called one by one as you get assigned to multi-cabs. You'll have one tourist guide who will explain the sites at the park. They also have this recorded voice over that would help you appreciate the view more. We learned a lot from this experience. The three stops were great! Our tour guide, Sarah, whom we call Anna, for fun, was friendly, knowledgeable and approachable, not to mention, jolly. She took most of our pictures and she explained questions that we have about the park.  After the 45-minute guided tour, we're just left visiting the Family Trail wherein they have lots of bird and other animals. Then we visited the souvenir shop.  We enjoyed our stay at Eden Nature Park! Maybe next time, we'll stay there overnight or try the mountain trail. Whew!

Very really great nature park, has flower garden, herbs, vegetables, animals, birds, and the inspiring story - Eden is plant and nurture by human from a not much trees left.  Playground - fun Indiana Jones ride, zip line Reasonable price. Really fresh food! especially the salad greens.   Just the feel of walking in the huge nature paradise, and you can smell different pleasant fragrances from herbs, flowers, and grass... The trees shades the sun and produces cool breeze...  If you're a first timer, take the shuttle tour. Also, go early so you can walk around during morning while the sun still not so hot.

For visitors to Davao, one usually recommended place to visit is the Eden Nature Park and Resort. Although it’s just a little more than an hour away, it’s way out of the city and few taxis will venture there on a metered fare basis and will usually negotiate a fixed rate which effectively translates to a round-trip fare.  For overnighters, check-in time is 2:00 PM. Full pre-payment is required upon reservation (via bank deposit); and during check-in, another P1000 is paid as a refundable deposit. We ventured first to the Fishing Village, where one is allowed to fish-all-you-can (mostly tilapia), provided you pay for all the fishes caught, and have them either grilled and steamed for consumption in any one of the huts surrounding the lagoon. Spaghetti, bottled water and soft drinks are also sold here. There were a lot of peacocks freely running around, as well as several pigeons in the open.  It started to rain after lunch, so we took the shuttle back to our cabin. The Camella room has four standard beds but has enough space for two extra beds. The room was spacious but basic; aside from the beds, there was a small TV showing local channels, a cabinet, small coffee table and two chairs, a small refrigerator and a writing table. There was complimentary bottled water and coffee. There was no air-conditioner but an electric fan was provided.   Their lone restaurant Vista serves buffet lunch/breakfast/dinner. For lunch and dinner, there were about 5 dishes, salad (with vegetables harvested from their own farm within the park), soup and dessert. Our room package included breakfast and dinner. The rooms were quite spread out in the resort, and although our room was reachable by a 10-minute walk, the rains made the roads and pathways muddy. A shuttle service is available for guests to bring them to their rooms (free for certain type of rooms; with charge for others).  One can take the guided shuttle tour (for a minimal additional fee) which goes around the park showing various fruit trees, hydrophonic vegetable farms, herb gardens, flower gardens, a tribal village, among others. The guide was knowledgeable and very accommodating. Along the way there were three 5-minute stops for photo-taking.   There was a swimming pool and a smaller kiddie pool located at the edge of the resort, with a nice view of the Davao Gulf. At the time we were there, only few guests availed of the pool, probably because this was a bit of a distance from most of the rooms.  A popular attraction was the Sky-rider, their version of the zip-line. Other activities include horseback riding and mountain trail hiking. There were also mini zip lines (where your feet are just only about two feet from the ground). There is also a small playground and obstacle course, and a floral/plant shop.   A sour note occurred at the end of our stay, or more particularly after we’ve already gone back home. We were supposed to receive a refund, but the counter clerk said that since this was already fully paid via bank deposit and an OR issued, they cannot give the refund immediately but will deposit the amount back to our account. To this day, more than four months after our stay, no refund ever came and when I called a couple of times earlier to follow up, I was given the runaround.  Overall, this is a nice change of scenery when one wants to relax in nature other than the usual beach getaway.

ReviewTitle: This place is a must visit if you like the outdoors!!
Review: I really cant say enough great things about Eden and the service is second to none!! We love the outdoors and loved everything about this place. There is lots to do always and you will never be bored. From the pool to the zipline to the fishing village and everything else is just amazing and emmaculate. I will say dont try the mountain trail if you are out of shape because its not so easy and wear shoes with really good soles. The restaurant could have been a little better but everything we did eat there was really good. You really should experience it if you are in Davao.

ReviewTitle: Eden Nature Park- a man-made attraction nestled 3,000 feet above sea level
Review: Eden Nature Park - is a man-made attraction nestled 3,000 feet above sea level. It is an 80-hectare paradise with lots of pine trees, facilities, accommodations and attractions. We spent a great day here with a guided tour by bus, thanks to our pretty and very cooperative tour guide, Emilee Timbreza, all the places, plants, trees, etc. were described to us. The children enjoyed the adventure playground and some of the adults did too! including us, of course! Going up at Eden, there’s a gate before the main office/lobby of Eden where you can buy the ticket for the tours. At the entrance, is another 10 min drive going up. We took the day tour, Snack package, which consists of a guided tour to the whole park, and a sandwich, chicharon, mini cupcake and glass of soft drinks as the snack. The guided tour plus the plated snack cost us 320 pesos each. The tour of the place is more of an ‘agricultural’ tour, the place had some interesting plants and flowers around. On the tour, there would be stops so we can take pictures of the area, or often times, get a chance to pick plants around the farms. The tour takes about 45 to 1 hour, depending on how ‘makulit’ our co-tourists are. In our case, since we are quite a big group, we’re the ones that’s always taking too long during tour stops. hehehe. The destination at the end of the tour is the canteen of Eden park. This is where they’d give you your food. They serve the food in buffets, which we didn't avail since we’re pressed of time (going back to Manila at 3pm). So instead of having lunch, we did avail of the plated snack
Really enjoyed this place. The place is well kept and the staff is friendly and helpful. There was construction on the road up the hill to the park but it was just a minor inconvience.

We took the nature tram ride - informative and interesting, although short - only 3 stops along the way for exploring/picture taking purposes. The lunch buffet was good as well. The highlight of our visit was a ride on the zip line (for a modest separate entrance fee). For those who are afraid of heights, there is a free "kiddie zip line" by the buffet area. Very fun... Just remember to hang on, the kiddie zip line has a boomerang effect at the end
Beautiful scenery! Well developed! Fun activities! The restaurant has great food as well!
this is the perfect place for nature lover. you're far from the pollution of the city. if you love hiking this place is perfect.
the salad was excellent - fresh, flavorful ;) the kids had a grand time at the low zip lines... then more at the higher ones. the mountain, fresh air was refreshing

ReviewTitle: its my momentum towards my enjoyment
Review: Its a Paradise were i discover my self confidence, a place were i exceed,explore and become real,this is my journey come and join me as we discover my world

ReviewTitle: Beautiful nature just outside the city
Review: I made a brief day trip to the Eden Nature Park. It was hard to believe there was such a beautiful park just outside the sprawling city of Davao City.  There are some bird displays and hiking trails and a large restaurant and conference center. Some great views of the city can be had.  It seems this project started with a grand design and great location, but maybe suffers from being an overwhelming project. The hiking trails must have been superb when they were first built, but some places are a little overgrown now. The whole place is a bit of a work in progress, although it's hard to imagine it completely finished.  They offer cottages and cabins and campsites. The restaurant was more than adequate. There's a large swimming pool and a zip line ride among other things.  I was only there for a couple of hours. If you like being out away from the city, it might be nice place to stay. For local families it seems like a great weekend retreat for family reunions and conferences.
Being with nature is a wonderful feeling......you feel free, you feel clean, free from stress, etc......free to feel the air......
food good service a little slow restaurant is currently being upgraded

We took a quick day trip to Eden Nature Park. It was quite a distance from the airport but was worth the trip. Basically, it's a fruit and vegetable farm. But you can take a short guided tour around the place and have a buffet...More

If you want a different place where you can embrace nature, it's Eden Nature Park. It's best place for honeymoon if you stay at their cottages. It has also a wide playground for kids and adult activities.

Eden Nature Park is a manmade forest, more or less 25 years in the making...and it was all worth it. By visiting this park, I got more in touch with nature and learn to appreciate it more. The tour was calming, relaxing and educational. But...More

Many varied plantings, picturesque and tranquil park. Nice buffet lunch included with entrance fee. There is a jeep tour of the park for $3 but it's too short time to really get the feel of the place - you need to go early in the...More

ReviewTitle: Ideal for Nature lover and trekkers.
Review: A place to stay even for more days. Thrill seekers get the more fun and enjoyment in their zipline. Food is pesticide free (they plant their own vegetables and fruits and herbs.) that is why food is a bit expensive. We have been there many...More
We stayed the whole afternoon and it we had a great time - we tried the zip line and had sooo much fun. We also tried fishing and had our snacks there.
They will tour you to promote the area and their business. There are fun things to see though. The food isn't exceptional.
If you're going to visit Eden Nature Park, be sure to spend a day there to enjoy all the activities offered like swimming, fishing, camping, trekking or just a simple seeing of the beauty of nature.

ReviewTitle: mother nature up close and personal
Review: Very wonderful place, well maintained and super eco-friendly. the tour in Eden made me think how wonderful our world could be if only we know how to care for our nature. Very educational as well and the tour guide is very well trained and they...More

The place is surrounded with trees and vegetations, very peaceful and relaxing. We joined their tour, their guides are very knowledgeable and at the same time helpful. I also love their lunch buffet, the foods are fresh and delicious the fruits are sweet. We also tried their zip line which ok. The playground is nice except for the indiana jones which needs oiling.
Nice place to visit in Davao and if you are a nature lover, this park is amazing !!!!

Eden Nature Park is great educational place.here are guided tours where it is told about the fauna in the park, you can also watch a great view. but what ever you do....do not miss the lunchbuffe its awesome

We had a short trip in Eden, the place is nice and well maintained. The price of the buffet is expensive but the food is so limited and is not delicious. The tour guide is always in a hurry to speak and tour us, and the shuttle is so fast that you need to hold tight. Maybe one visit is enough for Eden for me, its one of the overrated places and visiting it is not a must because going there is expensive.

After Samal Island, most folks recommended we visit Eden Nature Park. The trip from Davao took about an hour and a half. It is located behind Mt. Apo (highest mountain in the Philippines) so you won't see the mountain when you're in Eden but you'll see it on the way.  The buffet lunch included in the entrance fee (PHP450/person, approx US$10) was ok. Nothing extraordinary. But it was fun to cut the salad leaves yourselves - and the leaves are nice and fresh because they're organically grown at the park itself. There were a lot of people so oftentimes the buffet trays needed to be refilled (and it took some time).  We took the guided shuttle tour within the park (they recommended this for first time visitors) which costs PHP75/person (~US$1.5). You have to choose the time of your tour and each time slot has limited seats. You ride a shuttle around the park (some areas cannot be reached any other way) and the tour guide will describe what you're seeing and a description of the accommodations you can stay in.  Part of the tour are 3 10-15 minute photo stops -- a colorful flower garden, an open air exhibit of the indigenous people who used to live in the area (not sure where they are now?) and a garden of herbs with a really nice hut. The tour guide can help take your picture. The whole tour lasts about 45 minutes to an hour. After the tour there is a shop behind the souvenir shop where you can buy some of the plants (seedlings) to take home. We didn't take any home but they say it takes a few minutes at the airport to get clearance for small plants but about a day for fruit-bearing trees.  We also visited a bird park and enjoyed watching some heron arrange twigs to form a nest :) Other places we saw on the tour but didn't enjoy - swimming pool, area for Filipino games.  All in all, it was a relaxing day.

Great Views of the mountains and the gulf on the way there. Cool and refreshing place to visit. Nice buffet, great views and relaxing tour of the trails. Our tour guide was a local lady from the area and very knowledgeable of the park and it's history and very friendly.

Amazing place! My family and I went for a day tour just last May 24, 2010. We went for an hour tour around the place. The tour guide was very accommodating and showed us the beauty of Eden. My kids loved the flower garden and the fishing village. They can't seem to get enough of it. They also enjoyed seeing the deer and the peacock around the fishing village. After we when to the Zipline and the horseback riding. My wife enjoyed the Zipline and of course the kids enjoyed horseback riding :) Next time I would stay overnight to see the fireflies and take a nature hike around the beautiful forest. This is definitely a place to visit in Davao

I was interested in visiting Eden Nature park and stay overnight. The web site shows 3 phone numbers, one a mobile number. No one answered any of the three numbers for two days. Obviously, they are not looking for any business and who would want to go to a place too lazy even to answer the phone?

ReviewTitle: I Enjoy My Tour In Here!!C:
Review: Eden Nature Park is a mountain resort 3,000 feet above sea level, it is 95% man-made! It is a great model of how we can re-create nature and rebuild a lost environment. It is a 80 hectares park where you can experience different adventure activities such as Skyrider (The Zipline), a 200-meter long steel cables suspended roughly 20 meters in the air between two steel towers, on which you glide along suspended while enjoying the spectacular view of Davao City and the Davao Gulf. The Mountain Trail for about four-kilometer winding trek through Eden’s forest. They also have Campsites for campers. One good thing about EDEN most of the vegetables they used in their foods can be found on Garden. They are all fresh. Their foods are all great. I enjoy the lunch and adventures here.c:

I've visited Eden before and wasn't too impressed, however they had only been open a short while so I thought I'd give them the benefit of the doubt and hold off from writing a review. This week I'd heard good things from the place and so thought I'd have a return visit. First thing that greeted me was "we don't have any change" from the entrance desk. I hear this more and more in Davao thesedays and I think its a scam so that maybe the foreign visitor will say, "don't worry about it, keep the change". Maybe I'm wrong but either way thats bad service on the part of the park. I refused to come back later for my change and eventually and unsurprisingly they fould the 40 pesos needed. The entrance fee includes a snack which apparently includes a selection of sandwiches or pasta. This is a blantant lie as the only thing on offer was Pinoy style spagetti which as always has been made so sweet you need to check you have all your teeth afterwards! So quite annoyed by this I thought I'd try the zip line, which after all, looks great. Its wasn't to be as by this time it was 12 noon and all the attractions close for lunch hour! I know this is common practice with many businesses in the Philippines but I never thought a tourist attraction would close for lunch!   The one redeeming feature of the day was the swimming pool which is quite nice and surprisingly not busy considering we visited on a Saturday. However as with all the attractions in the park, you will pay extra for this and then extra still if you want a cottage, and then you have to go through the whole "no change ordeal again"! We left the park quite early, very dissappointed and as we drove past the security guard urinating against a tree I vowed never to return to Eden. Its such a shame because the park could be so nice but its let down by bad staff and even worse management. One more thing to add, although its nobody's fault, please be aware that it rains heavily here every day so if your planning a trip, bring an umberella and a change of clothes. If you do decide to visit, I sincerely hope you have a better experience than me!

ReviewTitle: Davao's Tagaytay made a little more adventurous
Review: Eden Nature Park was a side trip during a visit to Davao City on business. We arrived around lunch time and left by 4:00 p.m. to catch our plane back to Manila. With just about 4 hours to spend at Eden, we decided to do 3 things:   Lunch A breezy tour  The Skyrider (Indiana Jones thing).  Buffet lunch was okay. The selection included Asian dishes, many of them spicy. They also had an array of dessert from cakes to fresh fruit. They also served fresh 100% organic vegetable salad. The restaurant sits on an elevated area overlooking thick vegetation. Peacocks and other farm birds roamed about the dining area, taking food scraps from diners. This could appeal to kids.   The tour about the property was extensive and a little exhausting. We had to take a vehicle designed to take tourists through steep slopes and rugged terrain. We visited a camp site in the middle of the forest, perfect for nature trippers and honeymooners.  Eden Nature Park's flower garden is at one of the area's highest peaks, where one can enjoy a faint Davao cityscape. The area is reminiscent of Tagaytay Highlands, with shades and benches if one wants to stay for a while and see sights.  Eden Nature Park also has a vegetable and fruit farm, where veggies are grown organically. They also advocate aerophonic farming, or growing vegetables without soil. These farms provide fresh ingredients to Eden's restaurants. Families can also fish at the fishponds and kids can enjoy its mini zoo, playground, jogging trail and more.  Now as for the Skyride? There are no words to describe. Try it at once!

Eden Nature Park is located upland of Davao so it is normally cold specially in the afternoon. It is not accessible to public transportation. We took a habal habal, a motorbike ride which can accommodate 3 passengers only including its driver for an P80.00 two-way ride. But beware of scammers when choosing a habal habal for they are going to charge you a hundred pesos if they know you are a first time tourist. I was glad because ours was recommended by a friend.   Eden Nature Park was just an ordinary "nature park" for me. It was a huge park that you should be able to a avail of their tour guide so you can wander around and visit each places riding in a minicab. Entrance fee was quite expensive for me. We availed of their P180.00 entrance fee with a snack, i tell you, nothing special about their snack so don't expect too much about the food. Other rides like Zip line and tour guides are another issue.   What we enjoyed most was the Zip line overlooking Davao Gulf. It was a fantastic view and we had fun riding the zip line for a P150.00 each. The ride was really enjoyable especially for us first timers, geeezzz. I can't forget the excitement riding it.  We also loved their Fishing village, elders took time to catch fishes (carp) in the pond, pay for it and have it cook for them. Nipa huts are scattered around the pond. It was pleasant to see families gathering when one catches fish.   We weren't able to visit other "must see" in Eden for I kept on coming back to their Information Desk asking if there were available Tours for us two. They kept on insisting that the cabs were reserved only for tourist, I told them that we were tourist too. But hey, tourist for them are Caucasians and the like...ganun?! geezz....So we left Eden at 3:00pm and i told myself never ever going back there again. One is enough, hehehe

From the city proper of Davao, we hailed a taxi to take us to Eden Nature Park. He charged PhP600 one way but I tried to haggled\ and he charged us PhP1000 back and forth instead. It was reasonable because we were a group of 5.  It was almost an hour trip from the city via Toril and I recommend that if you want to go there for a day trip, try to go early so that you'll have lots of time to walk along their mountain trail.  The view going there was splendid. I loved it.   Their rates were quite reasonable also. They charged us PhP180 per person for the entrance plus snacks (tuna sandwich or spaghetti and drinks). We didn't avail of the tour because we didn't want to spend more already. Instead, we chose to hike. It was tiresome but it was worth it. I loved the flower garden and the amphitheatre.  This is a definite must-see if you plan in visiting Davao.

We booked a five day stay at Eden, thinking it'd be a restful, nature-trip vacation, where I'd be able to go hiking, catch up a little on work, and the kids would be able to do some fishing and horse back riding. I must say - if you know what to expect - Eden is not that bad. But it's clearly not ready for prime time. For starters, the accomodations are old. The beds creak and the metal supports are rusted. They charge P3350/night, whereas Davao's Marco Polo charges P3,800 per night, yet the quality of accomodations are very far apart. The wifi is very bad! It is down 70% of the time, and is only available from the restaurant (which may be quite a walk from your cottage). The mobile service is even worse - I had to climb a hill to be able to carry a voice conversation, and SMS reception was only possible from our Vista Cottage only 5-10% of the time (the rest of the time, there was No Mobile Service available). So much for being able to catch up on work.  You can get a little hiking done - there is a trail that takes about 1-1.5 hrs to complete, but bear in mind that Eden is a completely walled garden, and you can only hike within the garden. I was under the impression that I could hike towards Mt. Apo then return back down to Eden, but that was not to be.   The fishing was also a disappointment. Eden won't let you catch and release. Everything you catch, you must eat! Our kids went fishing while we slept, and when they returned, we found out that they had caught ten fishes that we had no choice but to consume and eat! Needless to say, a lot of those fishes just went to waste.  It's a lovely setting - but it's a shamethat they try to nickel and dime you.   Most unsettling to me was the shuttle service. First of all, the rates are usurious. An earlier reviewer said the regular cab fare was P400 one way. Eden charged us P1500. On our return trip (from Eden to Davao city), we again paid the P1500 charge. I later found out that Eden doesn't actually own their own shuttle - they subcontract to a company called Far East Car Rental. Thinking that the P1500 rate must be a day rate (or a multihour rate), I asked the shuttle driver if we could also use him in the afternoon, as part of the P1500 service, to pick us up from the Waterfront Hotel and take us to the Marco Polo hotel (a 15 minute ride). To my surprise, when we arrived at the Marco Polo, he charged us an additional P500. When I asked why he had not explained earlier that there was a separate charge, his reply was that he was not working for Far East Car Rental, and that in fact, Far East Car Rental had outsourced the service to Cairo Car Rental (whom he worked for), and it was thus for Far East Car Rental to clarify their rates to us.   So I immediately called up Far East to try to sort things out. If I had only been dealing with Eden, then it would be simple - the hotel would apologize for not apprising me of the additional rates, and given the amount of business I had just given them, they would probably waive the P500 charge. But instead - I had to deal with Far East and Cairo Car Rental passing the buck to each other. Far East said they had texted the rate to the Cairo driver, but the Cairo driver felt it was their responsibility to communicate directly with me. The Cairo car driver then refused to leave the hotel premises until I decided to pay up, saying that P500 would be deducted from his salary, and Far East Car Rental would then tell me that the driver's waiting time at the hotel would be charged to my account!   What a nightmare! I agreed to pay P1500 in the beginning simply because I wanted service, not THIS! In the begining, I wanted to make a point - the P1500 was usurious, but charging P500 (for a 15 minute taxi ride from Waterfront to Marco Polo that normally costs P70) was unthinkable - especially since the driver did not mention that there would be an additional charge. In the end, I just paid up in disgust.

Eden Nature Park is a wonderful place to go if you love, well... nature. You can really do a variety of things up at Eden. Different people really love nature at a variety of scale. starting from the soft nature lovers to really hardcore nature lovers. For the soft ones, you enjoy the view, ride a small jeep and again enjoy the view with a tour guide then eat at a nice restaurant. The restaurant salad bar is fabulous as they grow their own veggies. For the hardcore nature lovers, you can enjoy short walking trails, go camping maybe do some mountain biking. If you want to just unwind, they also have their nice cottages for rent.

ReviewTitle: Great place for nature lover and organic food
Review: Our trip to Eden Graden in Davao was a wonderful experience. We enjoyed the sceneries, very good food and tour of the 80 hectares of fresh vegetable gardens and lodging. Hopefully next time we will stay at the Eden Garden for at least one night rather than staying at the Marco Polo Davao. The shuttle ride was exceptionally pleasant. We saw all their facilities as well as the many gardens they have for growing their own fruits and vegetables. The guide was also very accommodating and explain clearly the different areas. View of the coastal area was also very nice. We can clearly see the white building of the Marco Polo.

First of all you have to decide what you will do if you go there, and i mean if you are just planing a day visit or to stay overnight in one of their many houses or cabins for rent. If you are just going for a day trip then i recommend going early because getting there and back will not be easy. My wife and I took a taxi from Toril Town to Eden Nature Park. Toril Town is a suburb of Davao and its located at the base of the hill where you get the road to go up to Eden Park. My wife and I paid a driver P400 for the ride up and P300 for the ride back and we also paid him P50 as a tip to stay and wait for us. So the whole taxi ride was only P750 and that way we knew we could get back without a worry. The driver was very nice and he gladly waited for about 3 hours while we were there. Upon arrival you can pay for the lunch and tour combination package, that is what we did. It wont take long to notice how quiet it is compared to the town below or how fresh the air is. Next we at lunch at the buffet style restaurant. Now after being in the country for many days and being very cautious about eating certain foods and drinking the water i did not have any problems there. They informed me that the water is from a spring up high on the hill and not local city water. The vegetables they serve in the restaurant are grown there using the same spring water so it is safe for tourists. Now the food that is served in the restaurant is simple food but it was very tasty and fresh. We both enjoyed it a lot. After lunch we went for a walk around the bird sanctuary and took some photos. Next we went on the tour around the grounds and you ride in a jeep that stops many places for photographs at their very picturesque gardens, and also the people who worked there were all very nice and were willing to take our photograph. So all in all it was a good time. We both enjoyed going there and will go back again on our next trip and next time i will look forward to spending the night to enhance my experience.

ReviewTitle: Peace defined plus nature at its BEST!
Review: Every time I visit Davao, I made it a point to visit two places of interests these are Pearl Farm Beach Resort and Eden Nature Park. Eden is a nature park PAR EXCELLENCE from accommodation, facilities, food, price and travel arrangements. though a few minutes drive away from the city center but the trip is worth everything considering the nice view on the way and back. The place is really true to its name, Eden a paradise on Earth.

EDEN- A mountain resort @ 3000 ft above sea level just below the foot of Mt.APO where you can view the scenery of Davao City and the Davao Gulf as well, it was quite fulfilling indeed and lifted your spirits high specially @ holy week season. As we went on with our mountain hiking, we can feel the freshness of the cool morning breeze as well as tall trees sway and seems whispering welcoming us. Accomodations were great, clean toilets and or restrooms where stragically located along mountain paths, call of nature indeed! The place was all FUN, be at mountain trailing, bird or deer watching, trill riding, gone fishing, swimming and or horseback riding. Nature At its best, i could say. To feel and talk with nature is to commune with GOD. To my Mommy Perla, Big thanks and we love you. Good health,GOD Bless!
